title: Technical Manager
company_info: ASIAPAC TECHNOLOGY PTE LTD AsiaPac is a Singapore ISO9001:2008 and BizSafe Level 3 certified company established since 1990. We have a cohesive, dynamic and relatively young work force of over 80 employees ranging from fresh graduates to industry veterans. Our business is in helping organizations to protect their business, increase productivity and reduce wastage using I.T. Our clienteles which include the public sectors, educational institutions as well as those corporations in the FSI, F&B, manufacturing, healthcare, marine, oil & gas industries, are serviced and supported by our multiple teams of proactive sales and certified support personnel. We are direct partners of industry leaders such as Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, VMware, Cisco, Fujitsu, HP, Fortinet, Hitachi Data Systems, Symantec and Acronis. The core of our business is the fundamental philosophy of ‘All-Win’ where all our customers, suppliers, and employees must collectively win.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
We are looking for a Technical Manager who can build, lead and manage the engineering team. This is a senior managerial role that will be involved in strategic planning, staffing, training and budgeting.
The incumbent will be engaged in people management, engineering management and cross-group collaboration.

Engineering management
Architect, design, build, deliver the overall platform to manage and support hybrid multi-cloud which enables customers choice to build and enable XaaS
Architect, design and build new XaaS modules to address customer needs, and reuse e.g. Device as a Service, CSOC as a Service, Service Desk as a Service, AI-Ops automation
Ensure high delivery standards with successful desired outcomes for the customers i.e. proactive monitoring, tight resource management inclusive of vendors/partners dependencies as necessary
Provide technical direction for project delivery and handle and resolve all technical aspects, with hands on approach
Create and execute delivery plans and manage mitigation plans to meet changing clients’ needs and requirements/escalations
Improve governance (policies, standards, guidelines) on successful delivery outcomes e.g. industry compliances, delivery frameworks/playbooks, port-mortem reviews, documentations
Cross group collaboration
Work closely with Project Management Office to ensure timely update on implementation and serves as liaison between delivery team and project managers
Work closely with all technical group to on-board technical knowledge of solution offerings, inclusive of vendors and partners as needed
Work closely with Sales and Pre-Sales to progress new delivery opportunities and ensure adequate resourcing i.e. demos, tenders, Proof Of Concept (POC) requirements
Job Requirements:
Degree or other equivalent
At least 15 years of IT experience
At least 5 years in ICT infrastructure project implementations and operational support management
Technical knowledge of infra stacks i.e. x86, Unix, storage, networks, security, desktops/laptops/devices, servers
Technical knowledge of Linux and Windows Server Operating Systems
Technical knowledge of on-premises (data centres, virtualization, hyper-converge, security) and cloud ecosystems - AWS, Azure, Huawei, Alibaba
Knowledge of IT lifecycle management
Knowledge of ITSM - Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Asset Management, Patch Management
Knowledge of AIX (AIX server Admin), Server & Azure, Infra App (10 of them), DB (MySql, MSSQL etc), Oracle, Middleware, Network/Security Devices
Candidates possessing the following will have an added advantage:
Solution Architect experience
ITIL Certification
Experience in handling large Enterprise RFQ/RFP and government tender

title: Project Manager
company: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. is a subsidiary of the VDL Group, an international industrial company with its headquarters in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. The company started its operations in 1970 as a manufacturer of machine parts used in factory automation and assemblies for its then-parent company. Over the years, we haveaccumulated valued competencies that has enabled us to grow as an equipment manufacturer. Today, we are a world-class capital equipment contract manufacturing company operating worldwide, employing committed people to provide our customers in the semiconductor and LED equipment industries with innovative and unique technological solutions and logistical services. With our rapid expansion and new facility, we seek dynamic and like-minded individuals to join us. Advance the world of engineering possibilities, realize your potential and succeed with us here at VDL Enabling Technologies Group.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an integral Project manager you are responsible for highly innovative complex challenging projects in a high-end precision environment. You have an integral responsibility, from customer request to development to implementation of volume production in the factory and delivery at customer site. The technologies are complex and the products are first of a kind. VDL ETG is a contract manufacturer and VDL ETG T&D works on customer order only. The projects are often part of a larger development project at the customer site. You need do build and maintain a close relationship with the customer. Projects have an international scope so as a Project manager you deal with different company cultures, different regional cultures and a different Ways of Working (Project Management and Development processes).

You manage the projects with a (large) multidisciplinary team of highly skilled, mainly technical experts in architecture, design and manufacturing. That’s why we expect you to have a solid technical background, with experience in product development projects, as well as professional project management skills. You are responsible for:

The delivery of innovative mechatronic systems from initiation and concept & development until manufacturing and customer acceptance
Project set up, organization and Governance
Leading the project team, in close cooperation with a System Architect
Monitoring and control project progress, take action and escalate when needed
Managing stakeholders: external customers and suppliers as well as internal stakeholders at various managerial levels and functional domain (T&D, business, manufacturing and others)
Applying the project management and development processes of the organization
Contribute to the continuous development of the project management competency of the department

Requirements:
Professional project management skills, preferably certified (PMI, PRINCE2, IPMA)
A degree in Mechatronics, Mechanics, Electronics, Physics or related
At least 5 to 10 years’ experience as a project leader in high-end product development projects, leading multidisciplinary team(s)
You have knowledge of Design for Excellence
You are a team builder and able to inspire, motivate and convince people
You are a pro-active, analytical, creative person with a “can do” mentality
Good communication skills verbal and written

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role: Project Manager

Department: Project

· Report directly to the Assigned Senior Project Manager or Director
· Oversee and direct construction projects from conception to completion to be delivered within time, budget and resources through scheduling deliverables and work progress.
· Establish and manage the relationship with the client, stakeholders and relevant authorities.
· Oversee all onsite and offsite constructions to monitor compliance with contractual obligations and building and safety regulations.
· Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant internal and external stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
· Coordinate and direct with internal team engineers, coordinators, draftsman, construction workers and external vendors such subcontractors and suppliers.
· Conduct internal meetings for assigned projects on design and project deliverables and subsequently, monitor the necessary deliverables required.
· Review design drawings for value engineering and constructability considerations and resolution of any technical matters on site.
· Review and recommend on variation advices to Clients for assigned projects.
· Prepare internal and external detailed project plan to track progress and ensure compliance to cost report and manpower budgeting submission timelines.
· Analyse, manage and mitigate risks by planning ahead to prevent problems and resolve any emerging ones.
· Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques.
· Administer Project Manager Resources to assist Tender department such as formulating technical responses to tender or attend client tender interviews.
Requirements:
· Minimum Diploma in Engineering or related fields from recognized tertiary institution.
· Working Experience in LTA Projects (Architectural / RC / Wet Trade)
· Possess high level of integrity, good interpersonal and strong leadership skills
· Good communication skills

title: Senior Project Manager (1 year contract / SD-Wan Delivery)
company_info: AEA INTERNATIONAL HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
address: ESR BIZPARK @ CHANGI, 8 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK AVENUE 1 486018
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job

The Senior Project Manager is part of the PMO team and is responsible for planning, overseeing and leading projects from ideation through to completion. This role at International SOS requires specializing in SD-WAN delivery where you will be responsible for planning, contracting, coordinating the technical design and documentation and managing the end-to-end execution of a landmark transformation project. You will collaborate with IT solution vendors, partners, cross-functional teams, including stakeholders from various business line, to ensure successful project delivery aligned with business requirements. Your expertise in project management and technical leadership will be vital in driving the successful implementation of complex infrastructure projects.


B. Key Responsibilities

· As the Senior Project Manager, manage core program deliverables on time and within budget while mitigating issues and risks to achieve the business benefit of the program.
· Contribute and shape the statement of work to achieve RFP objectives and business as well as operational requirements.
· Drive vendors to meet their commitments per agreed work order or statement of work
· Tailor and provide the right program and project communication updates to all necessary stakeholders
· Define the customisation of global operational processes together with relevant point of contacts to meet project requirements acceptance
· Manage relationships of all stakeholders and resources during delivery and serve as a primary interface between the various internal and external points of contact
· Manage all complaints, change requirements and corrective actions, while avoiding “scope creep”
· Prepare a clear and effective communications plan, and ensure proactive communication of all relevant information to all stakeholders
· Monitor and control so that the project streams within the program are delivered within the approved budget, forecast, and planned scope.
· Ensure that the project meets all objectives for quality and looks continuously for quality improvement and customer satisfaction.
· Actively apply appropriate best practices and lessons learned throughout the life of the project. Monitor, control and report KPIs defined in customer contract.
· Ensure data in all project-related tools and repositories is accurate and up-to-date
· Conduct thorough risk management for all project risks and opportunities
· Lead the project team to execute against the project objectives
· Complete the project closure and handover as required, and include: complete contractual requirements, post calculation and, lessons learned
· Drive and close out any operational issues that arise during project delivery phases until handover completed and accepted by run teams.
· Maintain all project artifacts, including infrastructure diagrams, technical specifications, and configurations.
· Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to team members.
· Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, promoting effective communication and problem-solving across infrastructure projects.


C. Job Profile

· Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
· Proven experience as a Senior Project Manager, or similar combined roles, managing enterprise-wide, complex SD-WAN projects.
· Strong knowledge of IT Infrastructure principles, network architecture, server infrastructure, storage systems, and security mechanisms.
· Well versed on IT Service Management processes such as incident, change, problem management.
· Familiarity with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, and infrastructure automation tools.
· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand complex business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
· Strong project management skills, including the ability to develop and maintain project plans, monitor progress, and manage budgets and resources.
· Effective communication and interpersonal skills to manage senior stakeholders and collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
· Strong leadership skills to provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members.
· Relevant certifications, such as CISA, CCNA, CompTIA Network+, or ITIL, are a plus.

To report and assist Project Manager (PM) on project functions included but not limited to project management, site management, risk control management, safety, commissioning etc. to meet the project(s) goals.
Design, install, commission, maintain, and troubleshoot electrical low-voltage (ELV) systems. This includes systems such as fire alarm systems, CCTV systems, access control systems, and audio/visual systems, BMS and Security system will be added advantageous.
Prepare technical specifications and drawings for ELV systems accordingly to client requirements, and submission of drawing and material for approval.
Able to work up the Method of statement and Risk Assessment with the SI integrator.
Work with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure that ELV systems are integrated with other building systems.
Meet with clients to discuss their ELV requirements and work with System Integrator (SI) for the deliverables.
Obtain permits and approvals for ELV works.
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Electrical Engineering is required.
At least 2 years of working experience in the related field (Have handled BMS system, Security system will be advantageous).
Experience and relevant knowledge in ELV Systems not limited to CCTV, PA, Data Cabling.
Keen to learn, possess positive attitude and able to work independently.
Ability to interact effectively with project teams, SI, vendor and managers at all levels.
Able to work within the timeline and achieve the required deliverables.
Based at project site office and required to be on site to co-ordinate during installation and commissioning till handover.

title: MARKETING MANAGER
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Marketing Manager Job Description
We are seeking an innovative marketing manager to promote our company's brand and services. In this role, you will be optimizing our marketing strategies, managing the marketing department's budget and staff, as well as preparing forecasts. To ensure success, you will need extensive knowledge of marketing strategies and the ability to identify new business leads. An outstanding marketing manager will be someone whose expertise translates into increased brand awareness and profitability.
Marketing Manager Responsibilities
Evaluating and optimizing marketing and pricing strategies.
Analyzing market trends and preparing forecasts.
Generating new business leads.
Develop strategies and tactics to get the word out about our company and drive qualified traffic to our front door
Deploy successful marketing campaigns and own their implementation from ideation to execution
Experiment with a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels like content creation, content curation, pay per click campaigns, event management, publicity, social media, lead generation campaigns, copywriting, performance analysis
Produce valuable and engaging content for our website and blog that attracts and converts our target groups
Build strategic relationships and partner with key industry players, agencies and vendors
Prepare and monitor the marketing budget on a quarterly and annual basis and allocate funds wisely
Oversee and approve marketing material, from website banners to hard copy brochures and case studies
Measure and report on the performance of marketing campaigns, gain insight and assess against goals
Analyze consumer behavior and adjust email and advertising campaigns accordingly
Marketing Manager Requirements
A Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or any other relevant field
Sound understanding of marketing fundamentals and tactics
Creative thinking and problem-solving ability
Leadership and project management skills
Knowledge of digital marketing and social media marketing strategies
Excellent verbal and non-verbal communication skills
Proficiency with marketing tools and software
Proficient in marketing research and statistical analysis
The ability to work under pressure.
Availability to work within opening hours (e.g. evenings, holidays, weekends).

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Project Engineer (Power Generator)
Working Location: Boon Lay
Working Days: Monday - Friday
Working Hours: 8:30am - 5:15pm
Basic salary: SGD 4,000 to SGD 6,000, 13month, SGD 250 transport allowance


Basic Functions
The engineer will be responsible in the planning and execution of projects. Candidate will work with the sales teams/customers/distributors, support the industrial solution team to advise on project feasibility study, variation order and manage submittals for approval upon order.

Specific Responsibilities
Execute the project management duties and ensure all key milestones are met within the schedule.
Generate the master project schedule and monitor project executions milestones.
Liaise and coordinate with internal and external parties to carry out the implementation works of the project.
Monitor respective functions responsibilities and ensure project milestones are on track
Coordinate and Lead the Factory Acceptance Test with customers and distributors.
Ensure all documentations are agreed and endorsed for delivery.
Schedule and coordinate the on-site testing and ensured smooth transition to the aftermarket team.
To provide the first level technical support during project execution.
Work with engineering team on project feasibility studies and assist Industrial Solution team to generate project cost estimation in term of project management activities.
Submit a monthly report on the project status to highlight key issue or concern relating to the project delivery and milestones.
Provide engineering support on 3rd party product and drawings for submittals purpose.
Participate in continuous improvement project.
Work with interplant associates on deliveries, factory tests and project documentation.
Work closely with scheduler, customer service team and the production team, update projects status in weekly project meeting.
Attend weekly site meeting with the main con and consultant if required.
Manage site installations work and ensure completion within stipulated timeline.
Coordinate and work with sub-contractors on site installations work, drawings, and materials submittals.
Qualifications / Requirements
Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering with 2 - 3 years of relevant experience; or Diploma in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering with 5 - 7 years of relevant experience
Able to read and interpret M & E drawings
Familiar with generators, controls, and its associated equipment & accessories will be added advantage
Familiar with generators standards and codes will be added advantage

title: Senior Manager, Operation (Parts Manufacturing)
company: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. is a subsidiary of the VDL Group, an international industrial company with its headquarters in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. The company started its operations in 1970 as a manufacturer of machine parts used in factory automation and assemblies for its then-parent company. Over the years, we haveaccumulated valued competencies that has enabled us to grow as an equipment manufacturer. Today, we are a world-class capital equipment contract manufacturing company operating worldwide, employing committed people to provide our customers in the semiconductor and LED equipment industries with innovative and unique technological solutions and logistical services. With our rapid expansion and new facility, we seek dynamic and like-minded individuals to join us. Advance the world of engineering possibilities, realize your potential and succeed with us here at VDL Enabling Technologies Group.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose: This is a senior role in the organization and will have the resources and full operational responsibility to:
Lead and develop the parts production and fabrication department to visualize and realize our the company’s vision to become the role model for smart manufacturing
Lead and develop the department to meet our customers’ expectations (present and future) in product quality, performance, lead-time and cost – supporting the company’s goal in highest customer satisfaction and profitability.
Key areas of responsibilities:
Define the operational strategies of the department to support the long and short-term objectives of the company.
To define clear responsibilities and accountability of direct reports and ensure effective deployment of goals to the different levels of the department.
To continuously improve the operational performance of the department (quality, lead-time, delivery performance, costs and safety).
To identify and develop the core competencies of staff.
Define short and long-term manpower plans and resources required to support the business goals.
To define the technology roadmap and recommend the investment of new technology and machines to stay ahead of the competition.
Qualification & Experiences:
Degree in mechanical, manufacturing, Engineering, or other equivalent
Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience
Knowledge of Parts Manufacturing production management
Knowledge of risk management and safety regulations
Leadership skills
Strong project management skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with in-depth knowledge of quality approaches
Knowledgeable of lean/six sigma methodology.

title: Project Manager
company_info: NAPIER HEALTHCARE SOLUTIONS PTE. LTD Headquartered in Singapore, Napier Healthcare Solutions was established in 1996 as a Healthcare IT Products and Services Company. With deep domain knowledge and singular focus, we have built a robust, feature rich suite of solutions to deliver value to the stakeholders of the healthcare industry worldwide. Napier’s offerings are built with inputs from industry veterans, clinicians, medical authorities and patients. Designed with intuitive user-interface, our modular products are scalable and easy to implement, making us the obvious choice for small, mid-sized and large private as well as public sector hospitals.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Napier Healthcare is currently looking for professionals to join the Consulting & Services team as Senior Project Manager. To be based in Singapore, the person will be responsible for managing product implementations and post implementation support. The person must be highly client focused with excellent relationship building skills.
The Project Manager will oversee all aspects of client implementations as a member of the Napier Implementation Team. The primary focus will be managing the implementation objectives of customers. In addition, he/she will support the organization’s growth by applying a clearly defined project management approach for both new and existing client implementations.
The person will likely come from a technical background with demonstrated experience of delivering healthcare IT projects in an onsite – offshore model. The role demands a pragmatic, hands-on approach to delivery and working closely with our Sales and Engineering teams. The candidate must be motivated by the challenge of building a culture of continuous improvement and celebrated success.

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
• 10+ years of work experience primarily in a software implementation role managing people, processes and project delivery.
• 3-5 years of implementation lead and project management experience.
• Demonstrate a strong application of project management methodology in delivering projects, especially in the healthcare provider space.
• Exceptional communication skills to converse with all levels of clients; internal and external.
• Must have a working knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, MS Outlook.
• Excellent verbal and written communication, time management, presentation and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities, and prioritize appropriately to meet project deadlines.
• Self-motivated, pro-active and effective in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
• Adept at leveraging the value of an onsite / off-shore model.
• Ability to travel to other regional and international sites.
• Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience) is required.
• Experience implementing healthcare IT solutions (onsite/ offshore model) for US providers would be an added advantage.
• Certification in Project Management (PMP, PRINCE2, CAPM) preferred.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Project Manager

Job Description
As the project manager, your job is to plan, budget, oversee and document all aspects of the specific project you are working on. Project managers may work closely with upper management to make sure that the scope and direction of each project is on schedule, as well as other departments for support.

Responsibilities
· Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
· Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
· Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
· Ensure resource availability and allocation
· Develop a detailed project plan to track progress
· Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs
· Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques
· Report and escalate to management as needed
· Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders
· Perform risk management to minimize project risks
· Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors
· Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation

Requirements
· Degree in Architecture
· Minimum of 3 years' proven and relevant working experience
· Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
· Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
· Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office

title: Technical Project Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Technical Project Manager
Founded in 2016 with only a handful of individuals, Quantexa was built with a purpose that through a greater understanding of context, better decisions can be made. 7 years, 15 countries and 600+ employees later we still believe that today. We connect the dots within our customers data using dynamic entity resolution and advanced network analytics to create context, empowering businesses to see the bigger picture and drive real value from their data.

Due to the continuous success and high demand from our customers, we are looking for a Project Manager with a proven track record in technical delivery to join the Quantexa family. 🚀

Quantexa are looking for individuals with experience of managing the delivery of high-quality enterprise-level systems, which are operationally ready and deliver value to the end customer. You will be joining our services team in a client-facing role which will help our clients and delivery partners deploy Quantexa’s platform as part of their Data strategy. We’re looking for an individual who enjoys working in complex environments with multiple stakeholders and who is able to lead agile deliveries working closely with scrum teams.

What does a Technical Project Manager role at Quantexa look like?
Lead project teams to deliver projects following agile techniques optimising quality, time, and cost of delivery to the customer.
Act as Scrum Master or support a Team Leader as Scrum Master to apply agile techniques to best effect.
Provide regular reporting internally and to our customers of the status of projects.
Work with our customers to develop statements of work for ongoing implementation services.
Work with other Project Managers to develop the Quantexa delivery capabilities.
Mentor and upskill Technical Team Leaders to ensure our teams have the skills and capabilities necessary to produce high quality deliveries to our clients.
Work and learn with a high degree of autonomy with minimal supervision, seeking and know when to engage the rest of the Quantexa organization for support.
What do I need to have?
Have strong Project Management and Leadership skills particularly focussed on Agile delivery methods.
Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to devise delivery solutions to address customer challenges.
Exhibit strong technical communication skills with demonstrable experience of working in rapidly changing client environments.
Exhibit strong technical authoring skills and have experience producing estimates, plans and commercial documentation.
Have an excellent appreciation of what makes a high quality, operationally stable system and how to streamline all areas of development, release, and operations to achieve this.
Ideal candidates will also:
Have worked on a variety of complex data orientated projects for financial services, government, and telco clients.
Have exposure to Agile, especially SCRUM.
Be open to short-medium term international travel.
Please note: Our office is located in Raffles City, but some work occurs on our clients’ sites. Whilst our clients are often in the Central Business District, Quantexa is rapidly expanding into other territories and candidates interested in travel opportunities are encouraged.

Manage, lead, and handle a team of engineers, supervisors, WSH Coordinator and sub-contractors.
Manage and control project budget and ensure project completion in timely manner.
Manage and prepare monthly payment claim submission, variation order submission and extension of time submission to the Main Contractor.
Manage and prepare sub-contractors’ payment response and variation order claim.
Carry out site visits throughout the project to record information on the progress of the project against the agreed programme.
Analyse and prepare the overall schedule and project execution plan.
Mitigate site issues and propose a contingency plan.
Liaise with the main contractor, consultant and client representative.
Plan and allocate resources, projection and forecast of manpower.
Ensure proper management and control of project documentation.
Manage and lead the team for preparation, submission and obtain approval of MOS, RA, SWP, shop drawings, material, equipment, RFA, RFI etc.
Conduct regular site meetings and attend essential meetings.
Manage, plan, and lead the testing & commissioning of ACMV system.
Manage, lead and handover OMM document, training, as built drawings, spare parts and DLP program.
Job Requirements:
At least a Degree in Mechanical Engineering, or Diploma in similar fields.
Preferably with 10 years’ design and installation experience in ACMV and BMS System.
Good knowledge of codes, standards, and procedures.
Proficient in MS Office, AutoCAD, Revit and etc.
Self-motivated, Proactive and result-oriented with proven track record in the construction industry.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
The candidate is overall responsible to manage a software development project team consisting of a technical architect, technical lead, application developers, system engineers and IT support engineers to meet project schedule, cost and quality objectives.
The candidate will take the lead in the requirements gathering, design, develop, integrate and implementation throughout the entire SDLC. The projects will be in different business domain for different vertical market.
The commissioned system(s) will be deployed in a highly available and scalable environment.
Successful applicants can expect to work in a fast paced environment with dynamic projects teams. The projects involved are high profile, challenging and offer good career references.
Working collaboratively with stakeholders to facilitate and positively influence strategy, business requirements, and solution development
Building strong relationships through engagement with customers, colleagues and other key stakeholders across all stages of the project management life cycle
Prioritise and collaborate with teams with a sense of purpose and build strong relationships• In addition to project management responsibilities, the candidate will also have the opportunity to be exposed to the pre-sales process as a member of a tender proposal preparation team.

Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent work experience
At least 10 years relevant working experience including expertise in enterprise architecture Consulting skills such as interviewing stakeholders, conducting architecture reviews, and consensus building
At least 10 years experience designing, software development and operating large scale application platforms
Experience developing applications design pattern using native cloud service offer by AWS or Azure
Professional experience with n-tier application architectures development.
Hands-on development experience for Backend application and The ability to produce clean, well-tested and highly maintainable code in at least one of the following languages: Kotlin, Java, C#, .Netcore, NodeJS and Python
A deep understanding of automation through the software delivery lifecycle, including automated testing, infrastructure, delivery, support and operations
A mature approach to Agile based on real experience leading software development teams using Agile, XP, Lean and/or continuous delivery practices such as pair-programming, TDD and CICD
Experience of cloud technology, architecture, patterns and tools, including some of the following: Microservices, Event Driven Architectures, Containers, Kubernetes, Service Mesh, Observability, Immutable Infrastructure, Infrastructure-as-Code, Declarative APIs, Security, Linux and SRE
Experience of DevOps infrastructure, tools and patterns including Pipelines-as-Code and scripting
Experienced with principles and best practices of Software Configuration Management (SCM) in Agile, scrum, and Waterfall methodologies.
Experience in creating Docker Containers leveraging existing Linux Containers and AMI's in addition to creating Docker Containers from scratch.
Knowledge of Data Modelling, Data Integration
Experience with Containers and Orchestration
Certifications in Project Management such as CITPM or PMP will be highly valued.

title: IT Project Manager
company_info: APPVANTAGE ASIA We build digital automotive solutions.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are a fun & passionate team of digital strategists, designers and developers who’ve implemented major digital projects for global corporations across the Asia & Pacific region. Appvantage implements innovative digital projects for global automotive corporations and we continue to strive towards delivering the best results for our clients.
In light of our continued expansion, we’re currently seeking a Project Manager to join our team in Singapore.
Are you ready for an exciting new adventure at Appvantage?
Job Description
The selected candidate shall be responsible for the following:
Maintain rapport & close relationship with customers, vendors and partners as well as ensure that the project implementation adheres to the company's quality standards.
To consult and work with Design Director and/or Tech Lead for project requirements (relating to UI/UX and Technical issues) to ensure feasibility, and preparation of Design Specs and Understanding Document.
Work with client to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs. Clearly articulate and document business requirements. Assess the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands.
Prepare proposals or quotations, negotiate & finalize contract with clients.
Manage the project implementation plan & budget; identify the scope of project deliverables at each project milestone; monitor progress & take preventive/corrective action whenever necessary; report progress to the management on a regular basis.
Manage the project team (in-house and external vendors). Proper allocation of tasks and management of priorities for project team members.
Carry out QA/QC activities of projects to ensure successful & timely delivery of the projects in accordance to the clients’ expectations.
Prepare project documentation including Minutes of Meeting, Requirement Specifications, Design Specifications (or Understanding Documents), User Acceptance Test Plans and Reports, Training and User Manuals, Release Notes, Project Status Reports, etc.
Provide proper briefing before start of the project, and proper backup and project debrief after completion of project.
Handle other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree Information Systems or Business
Minimum 3 years of experience in IT Project Management
Practical experience in similar positions/ projects
Experience in mobile app/ software development is a plus
Excellent communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)
Organized, meticulous, with positive working attitude
Excellent administrative skills, coupled with a general understanding of the project life cycle, project documentation, project standards
Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies

title: Project Manager (Apps | Agile)
company_info: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Job Description
The successful candidate will run exciting digital projects with various government agencies to achieve the objectives of their digital agenda, providing opportunities to contribute to shape the digital government landscape. The Project Manager will engage and partner various stakeholders to formulate the overall implementation, roll-out and adoption strategy for digital projects, managing the project timeline, risks, change management and stakeholders. The Project Manager should have sufficient technical knowledge and strong communication skills, with the ability to ensure successful roll-out and adoption for the digital projects in an evolving tech environment

You will work closely with business analysts, solution architects and technical services consultants to ensure that business needs are met and projects are delivered in a timely manner within projected costs, yet without compromising quality.

If you are a decisive and driven individual with skills and experiences in actively engaging and handling key partners within a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we want you.

What you will be working on:
Plan and own the development of the business cases, along with the budget for digital systems which align with Agency Outcome.
Create and manage an efficient roadmap to deliver the digital systems
Strategise how different types of initiatives should be managed and coordinated, and highlight the interdependencies between the projects
Establish standards for reporting on progress, improve processes to drive efficiency or scale growth
Manage stakeholders across technical and non-technical domains, especially around setting delivery expectations of quality and scope and communicating progress
Understand risks to delivery and manage them to lower the overall risks
Acquire and manage financing and resourcing of the programme to allow delivery to flow seamlessly
Define KPIs and corresponding measurements
Resolve interdependent projects’ higher scope issues / conflict resolution
Handle and timely execution of the procurement of IT systems.
Ensure that projects are performed based on the project plan to meet identified business needs and outcome, within agreed parameters of cost, duration and quality.
Assess and apply the right project management methodologies, such as Agile practices, to ensure project success.
Actively engage and motivate various key partners to deliver and effect positive change of digital products.
What we are looking for:
At least 5 years of relevant working experience. Would be advantageous if you have managed 2 full project development life cycles, with at least one using Agile methodology.
Strong vendor and key partners leadership skills.
Strong stakeholder management balancing both the analytical aspect and the people aspects.
Excellent communicator in articulating plan at both the executive level and the working level and is an attentive listener to understand needs and issues, with strong presentation skills, both written and verbal
Strategic, technical thinker to understand and manage the complexity of people and technology
Strong business acumen to understand priorities and the business drivers of the priorities
Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills.
An adaptable and bold personality, with openness to pick new knowledge and take thoughtful risks.
Be motivated by innovation to achieve business goals and customer happiness.
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/ Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related field.
Preferred Skills:
Experience in handling application digital solutions, preferably involving Cloud, Design Thinking, Data Analytics or Product-Centric Development.
Experience in tender bids, calls, evaluations or presentations.
Project Management-related certifications such as CITPM, COMIT or PMI.
Agile-related certification such as Certified Scrum Master.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

title: Senior / Project Manager (Automation)
company_info: NNIT Singapore Pte Ltd Management Consultancy services for the Life Science Industry. Focus on Manufacturing Operations Management with two leading categories of serivces - Manufacturing Excellence and Compliance Excellence.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior/Project Manager (Automation)
Job Roles:
Responsibilities:
· Lead consulting service area in Digital Transformation in the Life Science Manufacturing domain in one or more of the following disciplines:
- Computerized System Validation CSV
- IT Infrastructure Network Qualifications
- Laboratory Instruments/Equipment
- Production/Manufacturing System
- Engineering/Automation
- Digital, SaaS platforms, Cloud system etc.
· Manage SDLC (system design life cycle) including risk, deviation, change managements e.g., conduct risk impact or functional assessment(s)
· Ensure Good Documentation Practices, working with policy and procedural governances, assessments, plans, reports etc.
· Manage, develop and execute FAT/SAT, qualification protocols and test scripts with relevant quality and/or industry best practices
· Review, analyze, evaluate system functions and processes to deliver validation deliverables
· Lead business and development designated service area.
Professional Skills and Experience:
· Minimum 15 years with at least BSc in technical discipline eg. Engineering, Science, IT or with relevant experience to the job description
· Experience in engineering automation such as DCS, OSI PI Historian, Mfg systems and services, would be viewed favorably
· Ability to communicate quality and risk-related concept to technical and non-technical audiences
· Good written and oral communication skills, presentation, and data analytics with center of excellence
· Demonstrated ability to work as both a team player and independently
· Good organizational skills and ability to follow assignments through to completion and meet timelines with commitment to task and attention to detail
· Develop approach using science, or risk -based approach that meets with good interpretation to regulatory regulations
· Understanding of ICH Q7/Q9, 21CFRPart11, EU Annex11, and regulatory standards.
· Experience with IT Standard e.g., ISO 27000, ITIL, COBIT, etc.
· Experience in Software development/troubleshooting eg. C#, JavaScript, Visual Basic, operating systems, and databases (SQL), and reports/labels (Crystal Report) preferred.
· Provide supports to Mfg Automation, Mfg-IT and/or implementation, patch/hotfix and/or SDLC management such as change/ issue/ incident/ release etc.
· Provide supports to Manufacturing Automation, Manufacturing IT and/or implementation, patch/hotfix and/or SDLC management such as change/ issue/ incident/ release etc.
· Knowledge of ISO9001, GAMP5, ISA88, ISA95, and other relevant pharmaceutical standards.
Offering:
· Consultation roles for international healthcare clients in strategically relevant projects.
· Work in a professional consultancy environment within a highly motivated team.
· Opportunity to take on responsibility and to help shape our organization.
· Excellent career development and growth opportunities in a premier consulting organization.
· Structured training program and peer mentoring system towards competence and personal growth.

Roles & Responsibilities
Company Description
STACS (Hashstacs Pte Ltd) is a Singapore-headquartered FinTech company focused on ESG FinTech, operating ESGpedia, which powers the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s (MAS) Greenprint ESG Registry. STACS serves as the Nexus of ESG Finance with ESG data across multiple industries and digital tools for the financial sector to scale decarbonisation financing, as well as a platform to provide high-quality carbon offsets to mitigate residual emissions. Its clients and partners include global financial institutions and corporates.
STACS is an Award Winner of the MAS Global FinTech Innovation Challenge Awards 2020, and a two-time awardee of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Proof of Concept (POC) grant, under the Financial Sector Development Fund administered by the MAS.

Job Summary
The project management intern will work closely with our Product team to drive adoption of our platforms. You will assist in writing product documentation, conducting market research, and creating product design specifications.
The intern can expect to pick up project management software and apply Agile principles to manage project deliveries and product features. You will have first-hand exposure to user interviews and client meetings that drive the overall product roadmap.

Job Responsibilities
Your core responsibilities:
· Design wireframes according to product specifications with tools such as Figma
· Produce and maintain product documentation for internal stakeholders
· Assist in BAU operations for the Product team
· Provide on-going application support and be involved in various stages of the SDLC.
· Liaise closely with multiple stakeholders in project implementation, application testing and application support.

Requirements
· Strong written and verbal communication skills
· Diploma / Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent preferred.
· Demonstrate good understanding of at least 1 programming language (java, python, C++, node.js, go)
· Prior experience with a UX design tool such as Figma
· Good teamwork and communication skills (including presentation and report writing)

What you will need to thrive:
· Value teamwork above all.
· Natural curiosity to learn.
· Loves to work with code.
· Intrinsically motivated personality.
· High adaptability and strong problem-solving skills.
· Customer focused mindset.
· Self-starter who thrives on complexity and independence.

title: Project Manager (Technology) for AI Singapore
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore's AI efforts.

AI Singapore (Technology) is sourcing for an individual to join the AI Technology team as a Project Manager. The Project Manager will be a critical member of the team, and will work with key stakeholders to plan, design, deliver, implement, and manage strategic programs, initiatives and projects that are aligned with AISG’s mandate.

Duties & Responsibilities
In this role, you will:
● Lead and manage multiple research programs concurrently, with the overall aim to enhance Singapore’s research, innovation and enterprise ecosystem in AI.
● Work with diverse stakeholders to design strategic initiatives, programs and projects in AI and data science.
● Develop partnerships and maintain relationships across key stakeholders from academia and industry.
● Support the team in exploring potential collaborations across diverse domains, with local and global, research and industry groups.
● Monitor progress of existing programs to ensure that they are executed smoothly and communicate regular progress updates.
Qualifications
Technical skillsets are not required but you must be sufficiently familiar with AI, data science, and/or technology in general to be able to converse credibly with technical experts and business leaders.
The ideal candidate would have the following:
● Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent. Knowledge of AI or Data Science is highly desirable.
● At least 2 years working experience in conceptualizing, implementing, and/or managing technology-related research projects or programs.
● Possess strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
● Resourceful and proactive, able to identify opportunities and work around ambiguity.
● Excellent written communication and presentation skills.
● Experience with engaging government agencies on projects and collaborations, or international partnerships, is highly desirable.
● Experience with research grant management or public policy design is a bonus.
● Project management certification is a bonus.

Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: HSSE Officer, Project Management Office (2 years contract)
company_info: ABOUT SEMBCORP INDUSTRIES (Company registration: 199802418D) Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) is a leading energy and urban solutions provider, driven by its purpose to do good and play its part in building a sustainable future. Headquartered in Singapore, Sembcorp leverages its sector expertise and global track record to deliver innovative solutions that support the energy transition and sustainable development. By focusing on growing its Renewables and Integrated Urban Solutions businesses, it aims to transform its portfolio towards a greener future and be a leading provider of sustainable solutions. Sembcorp has a balanced energy portfolio of 16.7GW, with 9.8GW[1] of gross renewable energy capacity comprising solar, wind and energy storage globally*. The company also has a proven track record of transforming raw land into sustainable urban developments, with a project portfolio spanning over 12,000hectares across Asia. Sembcorp is listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange. It is a constituent stock of the Straits Times Index and sustainability indices including the FTSE4Good Index and the iEdge SG ESG indices. For more information, please visit www.sembcorp.com. [1] Including acquisitions pending completion
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE AND SCOPE
Responsible as HSSE officer for project of Project Management Office, Singapore and Southeast Asia (PMO).
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Direct report to project manager and functional report to PMO HSSE Manager.
Support the project manager in leading and manage projectHSSE related matters.
Advises and supports the project team in interfacing with authorities, and other institutions regarding workplace health, safety, environmental and security issues.
Monitors local laws and regulations and Group HSSE requirements, and imposes measures to ensure that Health, Safety, Environmental and Security compliance and performance expectations are being met.
Attends and provides HSSE inputs during project/ site meetings & PTW meetings.
Conduct HSSE training for project team and vendors.
Create method and plan and conduct site observations, and prepare observation analysis.
Schedules and participates in HSSE inspection programs, including daily site inspections and surveillance during the execution of critical work activities.
Prepares project Emergency Response Procedure and coordinates planned drills as per local legal requirement.
Act as Fire Safety Manager to conduct regular inspections for critical equipment and systems such as firefighting and lifesaving equipment to ensure they are maintained in good working condition
Reviews and provides inputs on MSRA and other safety critical related documents relating to PTW approval.
Initiates and leads in project HSSE Awareness, consultation and engagement program including development and execution of promotional activities and HSSE coaching and training (Safety induction and HSSE critical activities).
Conduct investigation on any HSSE violation incidents and provide the mitigation, prevention and action plan.
Ensure all activities carried out are in full compliance to all regulatory and authority requirement.
Any other necessary activities and/or deliverables for implementation of HSSE requirement.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor Degree in Occupational Health, Safety Management or Environmental Science, or Specialist Diploma in WSH (Level C) and Fire Safety Manager or equivalent
Min 5 years of related HSSE experience
Good computer skill (Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Experience in Power & Utilities industry is a plus
SKILLS/COMPETENCIES & PREFERRED CHARACTERISTICS
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitude, teamwork, analytical, communication skill, leadership skill.
Can work independently with minimum supervision.
Positive attitude with high self motivation to deliver the outcome
Good stakeholder management skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About SLB:
We are SLB, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. Throughout much of the oil and gas lifecycle in over 120 countries; we design, develop and deliver technology and services that transforms how work is done. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people’s energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible. If you share our passion for discovery and want to find out what you could really do, then here is the place to do it.

Manufacturing Engineer (Electrical/ Automation/ Project Management/ Troubleshooting)
Location: Benoi
Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay)
Salary from $4500 - $7000 depending on experience
AWS + VB

Job Summary:
Performs the lead role in the design and implementation of manufacturing processes, standards, and techniques.
Key interface between Engineering and Production and will typically be an expert in areas such as electrical and mechanical assemblies, test procedures, and process planning, to improve existing manufacturing processes.
Responsible for solving manufacturing or assembly problems and takes an active role in troubleshooting quality and production yield-related issues within manufacturing.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Responsible for the implementation of key elements of Lean & Six Sigma, such as standardized work instructions, work sequence (routing) optimization, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S activities, pull processes, etc.
Takes the lead in managing the deliverables of third parties by setting project timeframes, identifying problems, and assuring product quality.
Responsible for providing bi-weekly production order status and risks to the management team.
Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators for manufacturing process capability and product quality assurance.
Responsible for assisting in investigations, performing root cause analysis, and identifying corrective actions tied to manufacturing quality issues.
Review and sign off on Engineering Change Orders that impact the product life cycle, e.g., Obsolescence, etc.
Implement engineering specifications into processes and provide shop feedback to capture manufacturability and assembly issues for existing and future designs.
Responsible for identifying opportunities and driving continuous improvement projects on manufacturing processes to reduce waste, lead time, and cost.
Implement process improvements to achieve manufacturing excellence in areas like cycle time reduction, productivity, and process yield (e.g., First Pass Yield, Rolled Throughput Yield).

Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's: Electrical, Electronics, Manufacturing, or Mechatronics Engineering.
Knowledge of the assembly and testing phases of the electrical and mechanical manufacturing lifecycle.
Knowledge of instrumentation and control systems is ideal
Knowledge of LEAN Six Sigma techniques and metrics.
Exposure and experience in Hazardous area installations (IEC 60079).

Apple Lim Pey Chyi – Apple.lim@manpower.com.sg
Personnel Reg No: R2090579
EA Licence No: 02C3423

title: Project Manager
company_info: SINGAPORE REPERTORY THEATRE LTD Founded in 1993, Singapore Repertory Theatre (SRT) is one of the leading English language theatre producers and presenters in Asia. In addition to its repertoire of original musicals like Forbidden City: Portrait of an Empress, the company has produced a number of critically acclaimed plays that include ART, The Pillowman and God of Carnage. SRT was the first Singaporean theatre company on Broadway in 1998 as Associate Producer of Golden Child, which went from Singapore to New York and earned three Tony Award nominations. SRT’s international collaborations include Royal Shakespeare Company’s King Lear and The Seagull starring Sir Ian McKellen, Oscar-winning Sam Mendes The Bridge Project (2009-2011) as well as 3 Titans of Theatre – a season of works directed by Simon McBurney, Yukio Ninagawa and Peter Brook. SRT co-commissioned Peter Brook’s Battlefield in 2015. SRT produces the very successful Shakespeare in the Park season and is also one of the biggest producers of children’s theatre in Southeast Asia with shows like The Cat in the Hat, The Ugly Duckling and The Three Little Pigs. SRT is also very active in the local community with a Learning & Engagement programme that benefits thousands of students, teachers and children and which underpins a substantial investment in audience and talent development for the wider industry in Singapore. SRT is supported by the National Arts Council under the Major Company Scheme for the period of April 2019 to March 2022.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB MISSION:
The Project & Business Analysis Manager oversees the effective deployment and maintenance of client-oriented systems such as POS, CRM, eCommerce, and other retail-focused platforms, collaborating with system owners within the Regional Technology and Digital Services team.
Furthermore, this role entails actively pinpointing business domains where technological enhancements can augment business outcomes. It involves aiding in the implementation of technology-driven solutions on a global, regional, and local scale to enhance market performance.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Digital transformation in the CRM, Retail, and e-business technologies space
Serve as the primary point of contact for Regional & Global counterparts to champion Chanel's digital brand value.
Assume responsibility for various activities, including gathering requirements, defining customer journeys, coordinating with agencies and consultants, assisting in local customizations, managing end-user testing, and overseeing technical performance
Work closely with the business team to ensure alignment of business requirements and desired outcomes.
Orchestrate change management efforts within local IT (for systems) and business (for processes) to deliver a seamless Omni-channel experience for customers.
Deliver necessary technical training to users as needed.
Establish Omni-channel integration across various online platforms wherever feasible (e.g., e-Retail).
Project Management
Work closely with essential customers to align expectations with project objectives and goals.
Actively engage in the development and verification of SIT & UAT test cases, involving stakeholders directly.
Monitor the project's advancement in comparison to the project plan, and collaboratively make adjustments to ensure successful completion, based on predefined project success criteria.
Provide regular status updates on the project to client sponsors and IT management.
Take the lead in resolving issues through effective issue and risk management. Escalate issues to the decision-making body when necessary.
Technical Support
Serve as the primary local contact for IT technical support on all Retail and Customer-related projects.
Collaborate with Regional IT and vendors to address and troubleshoot any issues.
Information Security
Collaborate with the Information Security teams regarding applications and processes associated with Client Solutions.
Guarantee that initiatives are executed in compliance with the Information Security framework, and provide assistance during assessments and audits.
Vendor Management
Oversee and verify that vendors meet the required service levels.
Guarantee timely deployment and delivery as per set schedules.
Ensure vendors adhere to contract agreements and terms.
Budgetary and Performance
Propose service enhancement plans and ensure timely execution of recommended actions.
Supervise and track the budget for market initiatives as needed.
ROLE SPECIFICATIONS:
Academic/Professional Qualifications
Bachelor of Arts (BA) or Bachelor of Science (BS) degree
While undergraduate degrees in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields are preferred, they are not mandatory.
Possession of a Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is advantageous, but not obligatory.
Work Experience
Possesses a minimum of 7+ years of hands-on experience in implementing Retail systems and e-commerce solutions, with verifiable success stories.
Demonstrated proficiency in guiding projects through the entire life cycle, involving diverse internal and external teams on both local and global scales, including vendors, consultants, and stakeholders.
Skilled in various disciplines, encompassing IT and strategic planning, IT operations, ERP, CRM, BI, vendor management, project management, and change management.
Exhibits a practical understanding of integrating retail technologies such as POS, CRM, O2O, OMS, BI, and e-Commerce.
Experience as a consultant with a reputable firm is a plus
Required Competencies
Extensive project management expertise with a collaborative approach to navigate projects through crucial milestones.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with meticulous attention to detail.
Possesses effective communication and interpersonal abilities.
Exhibits a pronounced sense of urgency and takes ownership of tasks.
Displays organizational prowess, self-motivation, enthusiasm, and a proven ability to quickly grasp new concepts.
Capable of excelling both independently and as part of a team.We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted.

Our esteem client is looking for an IT Project Manager
The IT Project Manager must be trained and certified. He/ She must be able to deliver any IT projects (including both Software/ Application and Infrastructure). The incumbent must be good in managing Project Planning, Design and Implementation. Prior experience in managing stakeholders and experience in providing consultancy.

· Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
· Involved in Project Design, Planning and Implementation.
· Develop project plan to monitor and coordinate internal resources and vendors for project execution
· Meet with clients and stakeholders and clarify specific requirements of the project
· Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation


Requirements:
CITPM or PMP certified
Experience in handling IT Project Management and
Demonstrated experience in handling Project Life Cycle.
Min. 5 years of IT Project Management experience.
Experience in Agile or Scrum development methodology
Good Degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering.
Knowledgeable in both Software/ Application and Infrastructure
We respect your privacy and all communication will be treated with confidentiality.

Roles & Responsibilities
(EA License Number 16S8126) Our client is a global logistics and supply chain expertise company, being a leader providing logistics solutions to customers around the world.

Job Description:
This candidate will need to work along with sales/pricing coordinators/ tender team for new businesses enquiries. Identify and target new accounts with customized propositions, in line with national, regional and global accounts sales plan, in order to close new profitable business and increase sales revenue.

Responsibilities:
· Implement and execute strategies for assigned accounts and align with annual account plans, in line with national, regional and global sales strategy and market developments, in order to set realistic plans and safeguard and enhance revenue from account assigned.
· Plan specific activities to ensure realization of the account strategy
· Continuously monitor own performance against account strategy and if necessary, adjust actions or approach within accordance with Industrial projects Manager / Sales Director
· Work along with sales/pricing coordinators/ tender team for new businesses enquiries. Identify and target new accounts with customized propositions, in line with national, regional and global accounts sales plan, in order to close new profitable business and increase sales revenue.
· Develop a sustainable relationship with the customer
· Analyse customer needs and provide customized innovative propositions, in cooperation with Business Solutions
· Capitalise on all sales activities within the organisation
· Manage correct allocation of tenders as well as correct hand over of customer information, in line with tender process.
· Coordinate proper handover of customer contract agreements (SOP) to the operations and IT department in cooperation with business implementation
· Coordinate with operations team and all relevant stakeholders involved to check and ensure progress of job in execution to client’s requirements
· Actively develop new / existing profitable clients
· Develop new business leads provided by global counterparts locally.
· Identify and pursue tender opportunities within allocated global accounts, in line with Global Tender Process, in order to further develop the account
· Processing of enquiries, responding efficiently and accurately to customers requiring RFQ, RFP, RFI, Tenders, Bids and Proposal and negotiating win-win profitable conversions pertaining to shipments
· Provide quotations, cost and other business information to existing and new clients assigned
· Maintain an updated and accurate record on costs of services, contact details of all service providers, clients and filing of sales quotations, tenders, bids and proposals
· Manage the development of VP and presentation to customer
· Submit management information related to performance as well as the opportunity pipeline for assigned accounts, to enable the Manager Global Accounts to steer and take corrective actions if applicable.
· Prepare and undertake QBR’s with global/regional customers
· Updating of Salesforce/CRM on regular basis.

Requirements:
· Experience in freight forwarding and logistics industry
· Knowledge of Industrial Projects freight management·
· Needs preferably 5-8 years’ experience with documented sales record
· Good sales techniques; concept sales, customer psychology and purchasing patterns
· Able to work under pressure

title: Senior Project Engineer / Project Engineer
company_info: CHANG HUA CONSTRUCTION PTE LTD Chang Hua Construction Pte Ltd was founded in 1995. The Company is a registered contractor with the Building and Construction Authority CW01-A1. Chang Hua Construction is a major contractor of Architectural and Structural Engineering works. It's vast portfolio includes various kinds of building works such as private houses, government housings, factories, hotels, dormitories, offices, show flats, and private high-rise condominium, etc. The total contract value of more than S$600 million Singapore dollars had been awarded to the company in the previous years. Chang Hua's team of professionals, skilled and unskilled workers totaling more than 400 were recruited and selected internationally by our key personnel. They are managed under our direct management team, with our structured re-training and direct assignment of work packages in Singapore, which had resulted to a superior labor force in project bidding. The company's direct management team ensures a consistently high standard of workmanship and ensures timely delivery of projects. Delivering and completing the assignments within schedule had been a prime consideration and important factor by our regular clients. Chang Hua is able to procure, import and install a special material that meets the particular requirement of unique and special designed projects thus increasing our competitiveness in project bidding. Chang Hua aims and is well prepared to go regional and is taking an important step forward in expanding major business division to foreign countries with potential business growth opportunities such as China, Abu Dhabi, etc. The company seeks to consistently achieve perfect workmanship. This acts as a guarantee of our confidence which will benefit our pool of existing and potential clients. Chang Hua's motto "RESPONSIBILITY IS OUR KEY" sums our full commitment to every project we undertake.

Job Summary:
Responsible for the delivery of Operational and Financial sustainable results across the Scientific Affairs organization.
Ensure that all project expenses are properly accounted for, that all purchase orders align with project budgets and timelines, and that all necessary steps are taken to manage projects effectively.

Responsibilities
Key Results:
Accurate tracking and reporting of project budgets, including regular updates on budget vs. actual spend
Timely and efficient processing of purchase orders, ensuring that all necessary approvals are obtained and that all purchases are made in accordance with project budgets and timelines
Effective communication of purchase order information to project stakeholders, including regular updates on the status of purchase orders and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Effective project management, including delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards

Accountabilities:
Monitor project budgets and provide regular updates to project managers and stakeholders
Manage the purchase order process, including creating and submitting purchase orders for approval, tracking the status of orders, and ensuring timely receipt of goods and services
Communicate basic purchase order information to project stakeholders, including order status, delivery dates, and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Provide project management oversight, including ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards
Ensure that all purchase orders are in compliance with project budgets and timelines
Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to resolve any budget, purchase order, or project management issues that arise
Maintain accurate records of all purchase orders, project budget information, and project management information.

Requirements:
Extensive technical knowledge of MS tools, especially Excel and Power-point. Knowledge of Power BI and share-point are ideal
Demonstrated good project coordination and data analysis skills based on information reported from a broad variety of sources
Excellent influencing, negotiation skill to build consensus and drive resolution of issues while maintaining positive working relationships across functions

Roles & Responsibilities
JOB OVERVIEW

We are looking for an individual who likes challenges, is detailed-oriented and gets satisfaction from taking ownership of his/her work. The Project Executive has ultimate responsibility for the project and ‘owns’ the Business Case throughout the life of the project. If that sounds like you, join us!
