To assist the Senior Project Engineer/Project Manager to conduct kick-off, pre-project/project meetings to ensure team members is clear on the objectives, deliverable, Quality, equipment’s Lead-time, Safety and construction requirements.
Plan and assist the Senior Engineer to monitor the daily progress of activities to achieve on or before schedule, i.e., by comparing the planned vs actual progress status, identify critical activities.
Preparation of engineering documents, such as inspection form, testing form and progress reports, updating of completion status.
Together with the project team prepare the statement/work procedures, RA to specify the detailed work step required for the specific task of the job to be done and identify key risk with the associate risk. A risk mitigation strategy is applied with the whole project construction task.
Calculate and tracking usage of resources, such as materials and tools with report prognosis to the Senior Project Engineer/Project Manager.
Understand and evaluate the project requirements and project plans particularly, materials, schedule, equipment and labour loading.
Assist the Senior Engineer/construction superintendent in assigning tasks to work teams.
To explain the site situation, technical requirements, project specifications, special engineering requirements, coordination procedures, execution approach and activities priorities to the various work teams to seek contributions for further refinement.
Ensure that various disciplines (including quality and safety personnel) are carrying out each tasks and tests/inspection in accordance with specification and standards as per the contractual requirements.
Assist in resolving engineering issues at site, coordinating with the respective engineering support units, if necessary report discrepancy (if any) on labour status, equipment, materials etc. to the Senior Project Engineer/Project Manager.
Preparation of project close-out report for the Senior Project Engineer/Project Manager to review before submission to clients.
Ensure final acceptance of the project by client in accordance with contractual requirements
Entry Level: Fresh grad
Salary range: 1,800 – 2,800

title: Director, Technical Project / Program Management
company: APPLIED MATERIALS SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: Applied Materials, Inc. is a Fortune 500 global growth company and the world's largest supplier of wafer fabrication systems and services to the global semiconductor industry. As the global leader in providing manufacturing solutions for the semiconductor, flat panel display and solar photovoltaic industries, our technologies help make the products that change the world. Applied is focused on delivering technologies that enable customers to solve their high-value problems better, faster and at a lower cost; deliverying the differentiated, valuable and sustainable solutions that provide them with a competitive advantage.
address: APPLIED MATERIALS BUILDING, 8 UPPER CHANGI ROAD NORTH 506906
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
General Profile
As a team leader, helps Applied achieve its medium to long-term strategic objectives for enhancing operations performance. Utilizes highly specialized skills in areas of advanced analytics, information systems, operations management, executive-level communication, and cross functional leadership to scale projects in support of Applied’ s business objectives. This role will be focused on bringing together key SMEs across the organizations and lead the team to scope, develop detailed plan, and execute to the “Operations-Leadership Framework” that comes out of the JOLT Organization. The individual will set up an organization, market, train, institutionalize, and track impact to take the “JOLT Objectives” forward in a sustainable manner
Key responsibilities
The candidate will drive Applied’ s strategic initiatives in following areas:
Be core team member of the Smart Initiative team. Define and develop digital platform for internal operations and suppliers. Leverage advanced analytics and Artificial intelligence to enhance WW manufacturing effectiveness.
Predictive Early Warning system
Adaptive iOMS for shortage mitigation
Self-Healing to avoid part failures
Ai Enhanced SPC Chamber Matching
AR/AI QC & Defect Disposition
AI controlled swarmed AMRs in Warehouse
Virtual Manufacturing Assistant and AI based Skill Augmentation to reduce DMRs and NCs
Work with suppliers to strengthen the S&OP process and the process of sharing demand information. Enable Build & Supply Alignment
Develop Enterprise-wide aligned supply planning process
Integrate it with Supply Chain ecosystem (Suppliers, CMs & OSPs)
Strengthen link between Supply Planning & Build Planning
Establish process to align plans with Supply Chain. Align terminology & training. Heat Map Automation
Process Automation: Automate material supply heatmap analysis and constrained parts allocation across BUs
Deploy BIC SP processes, constraint allocation & align with AGS S&OP
Support Operations Capacity planning team
Develop agile capacity planning capability using advanced analytics
Integrate demand forecast with operations capacity planning process
Achieve Factory linearity objective for improved customer trust. Develop strategy and roadmap for changes in factory planning processes and systems to enable a “linear” factory output, while allowing prioritization for critical upside opportunities
Churn Policy Implementation
Slotting Zones: Align zone slotting policy across enterprise
Exception Process: Define approval process for exception activities and align R&R across organizations
Hot Lots and Upsides: Align hot lot and upside definitions
Deploy IT Tools for new milestones & change control
Operational efficiency – Develop improvement roadmap for key business processes to cost-effectively scale to production targets of up to year 2028
Improve productivity of resources and continuously deliver sustainable reduction in Cost Per Tool (CPT)
Efficiency improvement for direct labor, indirect, WH labor, freight
Process efficiency improvement through SmartFactory / SmartOperations
Redesign build process steps (Virtual Build/Feeder Modules/Kaizen), WH storage densification; WH Process Automation using robotics
Lead demand forecasting and planning for SPG
Support senior executives in managing product demand planning objectives by developing demand forecasting models, data analytics infrastructure and executive reports across all business units
Work cross-functionally, gather and analyze industry trends data, historic sales data, and key market share metrics
Integrate industry benchmarks, customer-technology roadmaps, and develop demand plans. Analyze potential bottlenecks and recommend mitigation strategies based on data analysis and insights
Build strong cross-functional engagements across multiple business units with Chief Operating Officers, Field Group, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain Organizations
Analyze data, build demand forecasting models, build analytical frameworks, evaluate trends, and compare with industry benchmarks
Identify and integrate software toolsets for automation, standardization of data collection and analytics, data security, etc. partnering with IT team
Build dashboards for effective executive-level communication across businesses and functions
Core team member for developing Scenario management capability
Collaborate with Operations leadership Team for developing scenario-based decision making for S&OP trade-off. Deploy advanced analytics to scale company’s existing demand forecasting capabilities to incorporate macroeconomic, technology, and customer scenarios
Cyclicality playbook – Manage downturn / upturn
Functional Knowledge
Demonstrates a broad and comprehensive understanding of enterprise information systems, e.g., SAP, Salesforce, Hadoop, etc.
Possesses hands-on expertise of big-data management using advanced analytics tools, e.g., Alteryx, Python, Tableau, and MS Excel.
Is adept with advanced decision and data science techniques of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Possesses cross-functional expertise in strategy, marketing, manufacturing, logistics functions
Business Expertise
Has knowledge of Applied’ s technology footprint, vast product portfolio, and customer base that will enable in developing roadmaps to scale strategic initiatives across the enterprise
Demonstrates a comprehensive knowledge of the Wafer Fab Equipment industry and Applied’ s organization structure in order to contribute to the commercial objectives of the business. This includes enabling the business unit to differentiate itself from the competition
Leadership
Leads key cross-functional project teams and initiatives
Acts as a mentor and role model to others within the organization
Has experience with coaching and mentoring direct reports. Should have created training and development roadmaps for direct reports, carried out periodic performance appraisals, and provided developmental feedback
Interpersonal Skills
Demonstrates sound communication skills to be able to modify the beliefs and opinions of other peers in the business unit.
Creates strong business relationships with key stakeholders to enlist their active support
Education
Bachelor's Degree in mechanical or production engineering. Master’s degree in Business Administration preferred
Experience
15+ Years of multi-national experience with track record of growth and high business impact
Cross-functional experience in management consulting, operations strategy and management, strategic marketing preferred

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Audio Visual Project Engineer
Working days: Monday - Friday
Working hours: 9am - 6pm
Salary range: $2800 - $4000
Location: Kallang Bahru (Near Bendemeer MRT)

The Audio Visual Project Engineer will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of audio visual systems for various projects. The Engineer will work closely with project managers, technicians, and clients to ensure that all audio visual systems are implemented to meet project requirements and specifications. The Engineer will also be responsible for testing and troubleshooting audio visual systems, as well as providing technical support to clients as needed.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with project managers to determine project requirements and specifications for audio visual systems.
Design and develop audio visual system schematics, floor plans, and wiring diagrams.
Oversee installation of audio visual systems, including equipment placement, cabling, and integration with other systems.
Ensure that all audio visual systems meet industry standards and project requirements.
Test and troubleshoot audio visual systems to identify and resolve any issues.
Provide technical support to clients, including training on system operation and maintenance.
Create and maintain project documentation, including system manuals, as-built drawings, and testing reports.
Work with technicians to schedule and perform regular system maintenance, including firmware updates, software upgrades, and hardware replacements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices for audio visual system design and installation.
Brief project updates and status to project managers and clients as needed.
Qualifications:
Possess with Electrical Engineering, Audio Engineering, or related education background.
Experience in audio visual system design, installation, and maintenance.
Knowledge of audio visual system components, including video projectors, sound systems, video walls, and control systems.
Familiarity with audio visual system design software, such as AutoCAD or Visio.
Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and schematics.
Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.

title: IT MANAGER
company_info: We are an end-to-end IT solutions company. We develop technology-based systems to enable our clients to extend their business into the web market or become an eBusiness, the predominant business practice of digital economy. Our solutions cover both infrastructure and business application, including their related services, offering a one-stop engagement for our customers. DELTEQ is one of the early local Systems Integrator established in Singapore. We focus helping our customers in the creation, management and distribution of knowledge within their enterprise value chain using Information Technology to gain a competitive business advantage.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Delteq:

DELTEQ started operations in 1992, when two ex- Hewlett Packard employees saw great opportunities in providing quality systems integration services in Singapore. With key achievements including the establishment of relationships with reputable clients in the banking and finance, government, manufacturing, and telecommunications sectors, DELTEQ’s next innovative move was to invest in building state-of-the art technical support infrastructure and expertise. Strategic alliances with world-class hardware and software providers were formed. Further success in providing project management, consulting and cloud services in addition to systems integration services resulted in a significant growth in our client base.

Job Description:

The IT Manager is responsible for overseeing the technological infrastructure of the organization, managing the IT team, and ensuring the efficient operation of all IT systems and services. This role involves a combination of strategic planning, project management, team leadership, and technical expertise. The IT Manager works closely with other departments to align IT strategies with overall business goals and objectives.

Responsibilities:

• Develop and implement IT strategies, policies, and procedures to support the organization's objectives.
• Manage and lead a team of IT professionals, including hiring, training, and performance evaluation.
• Monitor and maintain the organization's IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, hardware, and software systems.
• Oversee Manage Services projects and Maintenance Projects, including its hardware availabilities.
• Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations by implementing and maintaining cybersecurity measures.
• Budget, forecast, and manage IT expenses, making recommendations for IT Maintenance projects, Tender biddings, etc.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for innovation.
• Troubleshoot complex technical issues and provide guidance to the IT team in resolving challenges.
• Manage vendor relationships and negotiate contracts for IT services and products.
• Design, implement, and manage local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), and other network architectures.
• Configure and maintain network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, IP Phones.
• Plan, prioritize, and oversee the execution of IT projects, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
• Proven experience as an IT Manager or in a similar leadership role.
• Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
• In-depth knowledge of IT systems, infrastructure, and emerging technologies.
• Experience in budgeting, cost management, and vendor management.
• Cisco Certified (CCNA), (CCNP) or other HP, Huawei certification is a plus.
• Leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and guide team members.
• Strong knowledge of networking protocols, architectures, and technologies (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, VPNs, etc.).
• Familiarity with network security practices and technologies.
• Experience with network monitoring and management tools.

title: Construction Project Cost Consultant
company_info: SHELL EASTERN PETROLEUM (PTE) LTD
address: THE METROPOLIS, 9 NORTH BUONA VISTA DRIVE 138588
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About The Role
This is a 12-month contract role.
You’re responsible in contributing to the delivery and maintenance of standard and consistent full suite of Project Controls to the project, such as Cost Management, Planning & Scheduling, Risk Management, Progress and Performance Analysis and Reporting.
Accountability can be summarised as management and support of the following activities:
• Implementation the project controls processes, procedures and systems.
• Support the Project with establishing list of plans required to execute the project and their hierarchy relationship.
• Development and maintenance of accurate project schedule integrating all disciplines and functional requirements.
• Implementation of the cost management, risk management, planning and progress monitoring procedures.
• Implementation of Management of Change procedure and processes.
• Analyse project schedule and cost performance, progress trends and changes in risk profile to provide project team with forward looking unbiased view of the health of the project.
• Analyse trends that offer early warning of any deviations.
• Review scope change requests for the total installed cost & schedule impact.
• Development of cost breakdown structures, estimates, records and forecasts for the timely submission into the investment documentation, the annual corporate planning cycle, or partner cash calling submissions.
• Development of the work breakdown structure, activities, logic, resources and progress of the integrated project schedule.
• Development of Cost Time and Resource (CTR) sheets for phased cost estimates for the project, contribute to development of accurate monthly cost reports.
• Development of monthly and weekly progress updates, forecast completions, together with the critical path and trend analyses.
• Conduct Cost and Schedule Risk Assessments implementing probabilistic techniques to determine and communicate the possible range of cost and schedule outcomes for the project.
• Prepare reconciliations between earlier cost estimates and the current cost forecast.
• Identification and implementation of project controls structure, tools and procedures needed for the Project based on the contracting strategy, execution plan and the risks identified.
• Develop contract key dates, milestones and shall plan dates that align with the overall project schedule. Participate in evaluating bid schedules and reviewing contractor plans to support contract award recommendations. Develop contract sections for planning and progress reporting. Review and verify contractors reported progress and ensure that this is reflected in the project schedule.
• Contribute to Project close-out reports as input to Lessons Learned and benchmarking efforts.
• Carry out Cost and Schedule Benchmarking exercises in support of the project evaluation or competitiveness reviews. Provide support for Data Capture and Internal Benchmarking.

Competencies Required
• Works effectively in a team environment and builds consensus.
• Working knowledge of a broad range of cost controls systems, tools, and practices specifically in the oil & gas industry.
• Computer skills – SAP, Excel, Forecaster, Primavera, Microsoft Office.
• Strong leadership, communication, and presentation skills.
• Excellent stakeholder management skills & ability to interface with various levels of project and organisational stakeholders
• Flexibility and speed to meet fast-moving business requirements with credible and high quality independent delivery is a critical job requirement

Job Requirements
• Engineering Degree and/or Proficiency in Project Planning and Cost Engineering.
• Project Management certification in any discipline, or equivalent.
• Minimum 10 years industry experience in Cost & Planning engineering in the oil & gas industry with responsibility for the establishment, maintenance, and delivery of at least one major capital project experience (>100Mln to2Bln USD).
• Extensive experience in project controls

company_info: Linde Gas Singapore Pte Ltd (LGS) is the operations base of The Linde Group's business in Singapore. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Manage the progress, analysis, and cost management of projects within the agreed budget and resources.
Prepare customer billing and payments, including verifying and checking invoices and claims from suppliers, vendors, and subcontractors to ensure all project expenditures are properly captured and recorded.
Extract data from SAP in the process of preparing project cost and other related reports.
Lead the development of the spend forecast for the project.
Manage the reallocation of costs and budget across project Internal Order (IO) numbers.
Coordinate and work with the project management team and other stakeholders to resolve project issues to ensure the delivery and completion of the project work within budget.
Perform Capitalization, physical asset verification, reconciliation, IO management, and other Fixed Asset related activities.
Perform month-end closing and financial planning and reporting task.
Review Financial Statements and provide fluctuation analysis report.
Support Internal and External Audit requirements.
Develop and implement Process Improvement initiatives to drive process efficiency and cost savings.
Job Requirements
Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or equivalent with at least 7 years' relevant or similar capacity in project and or cost controlling & accounting experience.
Practical knowledge with finance software (SAP) and Microsoft Office Tools: Word, Excel, Power Point is essential.
Experience working in the Industrial Gases industry is an advantage.
Evidence of continual professional development (e.g. MBA, PMP certification or other relevant courses) in the field of Accounting, Project Management and or Controls would be advantageous.
Excellent attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Ability to think analytically, conceptually, and adaptively.
Strong numerical reasoning to interpret, analyze and draw conclusions from multiple data sets.
Ability to communicate useful insights effectively with stakeholders across all levels in the organization.
Ability to work across disciplines and deliver priorities in a complex and ambiguous environment, builds collaborative relationships, engages others, and fosters teamwork.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to deliver clear and concise messages.

title: Manager
company: DELOITTE GLOBAL TAX CENTER ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: In an increasingly demanding global environment, managing tax responsibilities and planning for tax issues is becoming more complex. With consulting, technology and outsourcing experience, Deloitte helps businesses meet the challenges of multi-jurisdictional tax operations, including compliance, reporting and risk management for direct and indirect taxes. We help clients to understand and transform their processes, technology and resourcing models and where appropriate offer global outsourcing capabilities. This helps tax departments to meet key objectives for quality and control but at a cost and in a way that also creates value for their organization.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key responsibilities:

This is a position with Deloitte’s rapidly expanding Tax Technology Consulting practice, providing tailored advice and solutions to a broad range of clients, both domestic and multinationals looking to gain access into various markets from tax and regulatory perspective.
As a Senior Associate, you will have some knowledge of working on ERP (SAP/Oracle) implementations and familiar with integrating the tax bolt-on solutions (OneSource/Vertex) within the ERP transformation programs.
You will join a team of dedicated ERP and OneSource/Vertex implementation specialists, focusing on end-to-end project implementations. You will be responsible for delivering compliance and customs solutions which include project management, change management, solution design, solution implementation and end-user support & training.
In your role, you will also lead and/or facilitate business process definition and modeling, check the feasibility of this business model regarding the ERP products and the legal requirements. You will guide a team to implement and configure the software to replicate the required business processes and analytical/reporting needs
You will be a key contributor to the development and growth of our TTC practice globally.

Requirements:
Bachelor degree in Accountancy, Business Management, Information Technology or similar fields.
At least 5 years of experience in ERP (SAP/Oracle) project implementation or similar projects, and thus have solid knowledge of the ERP Solution.
Integrating tax bolt-on solutions with the ERP system (i.e. Vertex, OneSource Indirect Tax)
Technical or functional lead on at least 2 full-lifecycle SAP implementation
Experience in SAP modules (e.g. DRC, ABAP etc.) is an asset
Software aptitude in PowerPoint, MS Project, Access, Excel, and/or Visio
Well versed in pitching presentations to clients and key stakeholders
Advantageous to have good understanding of the supply chain management processes
Good analytical and modeling skills
Team player with strong communication skills
Open to work in an international multicultural environment and to work abroad if needed;

company_info: Syneos Health® (Nasdaq:SYNH) is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, strategically blending clinical development, medical affairs and commercial capabilities to address modern market realities. job_category: Education and Training, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Develops change management strategies and work plans for multiple internal/ external projects based on a situational awareness of the change and the groups impacted by the change.
Collaborates with the project teams on the Change Management discipline and work plans for project initiatives, as well as, development of the framework for related processes and procedures to implement change management strategies and the seamless implementation of various related tactics (readiness assessments, focus groups, change agents program, targeted communications), to ensure a sound methodology and platform for delivery of plans/services.
Ensures a sound communications strategy, plan and timeline. Responsible for implementation, including determining the most effective communication channels, and ensuring all messages conform to company guidelines. Writing and delivery of communications may be provided by this role or may be in partnership with Corporate Communications and/or external communication resources as appropriate.
Applies a structured change management approach and methodology for embracing changes.
Identifies potential risks and anticipated points of resistance, and works with business stakeholders to develop specific plans to mitigate or address the concerns.
Develops a set of actionable and targeted change management plans – including communication, sponsor roadmap, management coaching plan, training plan, business development, operations support, and any other areas as required. May be supported by a Subject Matter Experts (SME) or be required to provide content expertise.
May support delivery and/or development of Change Management curriculum to provide appropriate training for employees and leaders.
Creates and manages measurement systems to track adoption, utilization, and proficiency of changes.
Creates, recommends, and enables reinforcement mechanisms and celebrations of success.
May have line management responsibilities for Change Management staff members (i.e. interviewing and selection, professional development, performance management, etc.).

Requirements:
BA/BS in business, communication, organizational development, or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
A solid understanding of how change and change processes impact the organization internally as well as external client environments
Prosci certification and/or experience with change management tools such as ADKAR is strongly preferred.
Significant experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies, especially with large-scale organization change is preferred or corporate project management experience.
Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal.
Able to work effectively at all levels in an organization.
Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
Must be a team player and able to work with and through others.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), email, and voicemail.
Experience with graphics programs preferred.

title: Digital Transformation Manager
company: LONDON SCHOOL OF BUSINESS & FINANCE PTE. LTD.
company_info: LONDON SCHOOL OF BUSINESS & FINANCE PTE. LTD. Founded by a genuine entrepreneur, LSBF has always been one step ahead when it comes to business education. From day one, the school has adopted a global mindset, offering industry relevant programmes that are tailored to the career goals of students. Under the royal patronage of Prince Michael of Kent, LSBF has established itself as one the world's fastest growing business schools, teaching over 38,000 ambitious students from over 150 countries. LSBF has seen exponential growth over the last 10 years, establishing campuses in the UK, Singapore and Canada, and regional offices in over 12 cities around the world. Over the years, LSBF has won several industry accolades, including the recent Queen's Award for Enterprise for its contribution to the international trade. LSBF in Singapore has been awarded by CPE (Council for Private Education) for attaining 4-Year EduTrust Award in key areas of management and the provision of educational services.
job_category: Consulting, Education and Training, Engineering, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Develop and Implement Digital Strategies: Formulate and execute a comprehensive digital transformation roadmap that aligns with the organization's vision, mission, and business objectives. Identify key areas for improvement and prioritize initiatives to ensure effective use of resources.
Digital Technology Adoption: Evaluate emerging digital technologies and solutions to identify opportunities for implementation. Lead the adoption of relevant digital tools, platforms, and software to enhance productivity and operational effectiveness.
Change Management: Act as a change agent, driving a culture of innovation and digital adoption across all levels of the organization. Collaborate with various teams to promote a digital-first mindset and ensure smooth transition during the transformation process.
Data Analytics and Insights: Utilize data-driven insights to identify trends, areas for improvement, and business opportunities. Implement data analytics strategies to make informed decisions and enhance overall organizational performance.
Process Optimization: Analyze existing business processes, identify inefficiencies, and implement improvements using digital solutions. Streamline workflows and enhance collaboration across departments.
Cybersecurity and Risk Management: Implement robust cybersecurity measures and ensure compliance with relevant regulations to safeguard the organization's digital assets and sensitive information.
Vendor Management: Evaluate and select suitable digital vendors, negotiate contracts, and oversee vendor relationships to ensure timely and effective delivery of services and solutions.
Employee Training and Development: Organize training programs to enhance digital literacy and skill sets across the organization. Ensure that employees are equipped to leverage digital tools effectively.
Project Management: Lead digital transformation projects from initiation to completion, ensuring on-time delivery, adherence to budget, and successful implementation.
Performance Tracking and Reporting: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and monitor the success of digital initiatives. Provide regular reports to senior management on the progress of the digital transformation journey.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience in managing and executing digital transformation projects in a complex organizational setting.
In-depth knowledge of digital technologies, data analytics, and emerging trends.
Strong leadership and communication skills to drive change and collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
Experience in change management, with the ability to inspire and motivate others.
Familiarity with cybersecurity principles and risk management.
Project management expertise, including planning, execution, and stakeholder management.
Ability to think strategically and develop long-term digital strategies aligned with business goals.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Prior experience in the education industry or relevant sector is advantageous.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
We're looking for a Lead Consultant / Senior Consultant / Consultant (IT Security) to join , develop and drive effective IT security compliance programs involving activities such as reviewing and developing security policies, processes/procedures and guidelines, establishing compliance with policies, conducting security reviews and audits, vulnerability scans, security assessment and incident management.
Role Responsibilities:
• • Review and development of security framework, information security policies, processes / procedures and guidelines on an ongoing basis.\
• • Establish compliance with these policies / procedures through ongoing security reviews and audits, not limited to log analysis and security assessment of customer ICT systems
• • Conduct security risk management exercise
• • Conduct table-top exercises
• • Conduct vulnerability assessment, coordinate penetration tests activities
• • Conduct information security awareness training
• • Responsible for the development and management of customer’s security incident response plan.
• • Lead and support customer in the matters of security incident resolution and response.
• • Be the point-of-contact/customer liaison to assist and advise customer for ICT security related matters
• Project managed the activities and deliverables during the implementation phase.
Requirements
• • In the area of security audit, compliance and security governance:
• • Strong understanding of information security principles, ISO 27001 and PCI Security Standard is preferred
• Good working knowledge of security risk management, security governance framework and compliance (IT Security Audit / log review), technical vulnerability management (Vulnerability Assessment, Penetration testing), application security, security technologies (system hardening, IDS/IPS, firewall), security incident response and security assessment.
• • Customer-focused with good interpersonal skills
• • Team player with leadership qualities
• Strong Project management skill for Lead role
Mandatory certifications:
• Possess one (or more) of the following security certifications: CISSP/CISM/GCI

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, is an IT service management firm is looking for an Assistant Manager to be part of Swift Migration (Project Management) team, the role will be based at Central.

Role
Gather, analyze, and formalize user requirements and processes. This includes understanding the user's needs, documenting their requirements, and evaluating the feasibility of implementing those requirements.
Prepare project documentation. This includes creating requirement specifications, project plans, and other documentation that is needed to manage the project.
Adhere to project scope. This means ensuring that the project stays on track and does not go beyond the agreed-upon scope of work.
Develop technical design specifications. This includes creating a detailed plan for how the system will be implemented.
Set up and make changes to configurable items. This includes installing hardware, software, and documentation, as well as making changes to these items as needed.
Participate in coding and code review. This includes reviewing and testing the code that is developed for the project.
Assist with integration testing, system testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT). This includes testing the system to ensure that it meets the requirements and that it is ready to be used by the users.
Prepare user manuals and operations manuals. This includes creating documentation that will help the users and operators use the system.
Provide post-implementation support. This includes providing support to the users and operators after the system has been implemented.
Discuss and escalate critical issues with the relevant managers. This includes discussing issues that could impact the project, such as scope creep, with the appropriate stakeholders.
Conduct requirement gathering sessions and gap analysis of current business processes. This includes working with the users to understand their needs and identify areas where the current business processes can be improved.
Have clear and open communication with customers. This includes keeping the customers informed about the project and addressing their concerns.
Track the progress of the project and provide updates to the project manager. This includes ensuring that the project is on track and that any problems are identified and addressed early.
Resolve problems promptly and provide effective solutions. This includes taking steps to resolve problems as soon as they are identified and ensuring that the solutions are effective.
Manage and perform ad hoc tasks in a timely manner. This includes being able to handle unexpected tasks that come up during the course of the project.

Requirements
Education:Degree from a recognized university
Experience:At least 5 years of IT experience in business analysis
Familiarity with banking business, especially the remittance area such as SWIFT
Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Experience with financial domain projects
Knowledge:Ability to monitor and mitigate risks in project delivery
Ability to lead, develop, and maintain good relationships with customers

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
WHO WE ARE
We believe digital transformation is delivered through designing exceptional customer experiences. We are passionate about understanding people and the opportunity they create. We use the power of design to solve problems that positively impact customers and businesses.
Collectively what we do could be called lots of different things but really, we’re a group of smart, creative people who deliver end-end solutions with data, strategy, design and technology.
Our approach is simple. Identify the fundamental business problem, understand the customer, and design beyond digital re-invention. By doing so we help clients prepare today for the customer of tomorrow.
At MullenLowe you’ll enjoy working in an ego-less environment with people passionate about thinking, designing and building products and services that people find helpful, convenient and exceptional.
THE ROLE
You will primarily work on the Sitecore Experience Platform and will participate in various projects from a wide range of industries.
The role performs the full range of web development, configuration and support. You will collaborate with designers, business users and consultants to bring our client’s vision to life within the Sitecore Experience Platform and its suite of products (xDB, xConnect, Content Hub, CDP).
Your technical background allows you to provide an escalation point for any situation that may arise, being able to quickly diagnose the root cause and apply both short term and long term recommendations.
While your technical knowledge can solve any problem, you also know that success is delivered through collaboration with the entire team.
You are passionate about building products, enthusiastic about software craftsmanship, and excited to inspire self-improvement in your peers.

ON ANY GIVEN DAY
· Develop features on the platform, and work with team members to ensure that all features meet the same level of quality
· Work with the product and design teams to find that perfect balance between customer experience and feasibility
· Engage with project managers on any technical issues that may require escalation
· Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability while ensuring application security
· Identify and recommend improvements to the hosting infrastructure and continuous delivery pipeline
· Work with project managers to identify technical debt and work to resolve it
· Strong analytical and diagnostic skills, with a track record of quickly finding and resolving critical issues
· Work with global and offshore teams
· Develop proof of concepts
EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS
· Sitecore certified developer (v9 /v10)
· Developing solutions with C#/.Net and web UI development (HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
· Developing solutions with Sitecore 10, 9, 8
· Experience with the Model View Controller (MVC) design pattern and SQL
· Understanding of cloud-native architecture, API-first development, and microservices
· Experience in writing and maintaining technical documentations
· Demonstrable experience designing systems that are maintainable, reliable, and secure
· Ability to quickly deep dive into new technologies to the level of advising on potential risks and shortcomings
· Experience managing DevOps processes
· Version Control principles and strategies to enable large development teams (experience with Git is a plus)
NICE TO HAVE
· Huge advantage if familiar with PHP
· Knowledge of modern web frameworks like Angular JS, React and Bootstrap
· Familiar with Sitecore headless JSS

Roles & Responsibilities
As our Senior Cybersecurity Product Manager, you will lead the charge in driving innovation and enhancing our suite of internal security products. These tools are the backbone of our defense against threats from various sources. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will shape our cybersecurity offerings, ensuring they align with our evolving business and regulatory landscape while continuously safeguarding our network from potential cyber threats.
Job Description
Spearhead the analysis, design, and iterative improvement of internal cybersecurity platforms and entire products life cycle.
Consolidate existing risk management tools and take the lead in designing and deploying our internal audit risk control platform.
Define a visionary cybersecurity product roadmap encompassing both short-term and long-term objectives.
Proactively engage with the compliance team to gain insights into compliance requirements across diverse businesses and integrate them into our product strategy.
Interface with relevant internal stakeholders to collect and analyze their security product needs, translating them into actionable plans.
Generate detailed Product Requirement Documents (PRD) and, in close collaboration with the engineering team, oversee product launches and feature enhancements.
Create comprehensive product guide documentation and organize product training sessions to enhance the understanding of product features and advantages among internal teams.
Drive market research for product innovation.
Requirements
At least a Bachelor degree in computer science, information technology, programming and system analysis.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in an Information Security Product Management role.
Familiarity with security products and deep insights into at least one of the following products: SOC, SIEM, DLP, UEBA, S-SDLC, IDS, NDR.
Exceptional project management and teamwork skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks in a multi-tasking environment.
Strong communication skills, capable of effective interactions with team members at all levels and external partners.
Proficiency in project management and product design tools such as Jira, Confluence, Figma, or Axure.
Preferred Experience
Previous work experience in top-tier internet companies.
Experience in designing platforms for staff behavior monitoring and risk control.

My client, a corporate banking is looking to grow their IT program team. The office is located at Changi Business Park (East).

As part of the APAC IT team, you will be responsible for defining and setting up the IT landscape for APAC region. This includes working with business and IT stakeholders to understand their needs, leveraging on the existing systems landscape, and developing a plan to implement the new IT landscape. You will also be responsible for managing the implementation project and ensuring that it is completed on time and within budget.


Role

Formulate and set up IT workstreams for wholesale banking and private wealth products and services.
Create technology roadmaps to meet program objectives.
Lead feasibility studies and identify solutioning options.
Establish program plans, including scope, schedule, resources, budget, and quality assurance.
Review application architecture and infrastructure designs.
Ensure adherence to financial and head office policies, guidelines, operating processes, and project management practices and standards.
Work with stakeholders to explore technical solutions and achieve business objectives.
Drive the implementation of regional technology programs to meet strategic or tactical objectives, always looking for standardization opportunities.
Develop an understanding of various SMBC systems to provide solutions for specific projects and lead such initiatives.
Support the establishment and implementation of project management practices, templates, policies, and tools to expand and mature the program and project management capabilities of the IT APAC organization.
Support project portfolio reviews in the region, ensuring alignment with the APAC region's strategic objectives, and proposing optimal prioritization for decision-making by management.
Participate in key regional meetings and provide updates and alignment for programs and projects.
Be responsible for program risk assessment to mitigate potential issues and track status and progress.
Coach, mentor, and motivate other program and project managers when required.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science or information technology.
Minimum of 12 years of work experience in IT program management, preferably in the banking industry.
Strong knowledge of banking domain, such as wholesale banking and private wealth banking products and services.
Familiarity with regulatory compliance requirements for the APAC region for the banking industry.
Strong technology delivery capability, solution design, and project governance framework.
Experience in program feasibility studies, pros and cons for solutioning options, cost-benefit analysis, and building consensus among stakeholders.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to effectively manage and motivate teams.

AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers. AMD, Singapore is the Singapore Product Development Center (SPDC) for AMD as well as its Asia Pacific regional headquarters for AMD Sales and Marketing. title: Assistant Manager / Manager (Corporate Branding Department)
company_info: The National Environment Agency (NEA) is the leading public organisation responsible for ensuring a clean and sustainable environment for Singapore. Its key roles are to improve and sustain a clean environment, promote sustainability and resource efficiency, maintain high public health standards, provide timely and reliable meteorological information, and encourage a vibrant hawker culture. NEA works closely with its partners and the community to develop and spearhead environmental and public health initiatives and programmes. It is committed to motivating every individual to care for the environment as a way of life, in order to build a liveable and sustainable Singapore for present and future generations. For more information, visit www.nea.gov.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
[What the role is]
NEA’s Corporate Communications Division (CCD) develops strategic communications plans, leveraging media relations, online communications and marketing communications, to strengthen the organisation’s branding and public communications efforts. As part of the Corporate Branding Department under CCD, you will produce compelling content for NEA’s various digital media platforms, to enhance NEA’s reputation as the lead agency in sustaining a clean and green environment.

[What you will be working on]
The work is fulfilling, challenging and exciting. You will also be working in a fast-paced environment and be responsible for the following:
• Develop a digital comms strategy to enhance and strengthen the NEA brand.
• Conceptualise, develop and deliver content for NEA’s digital and social media platforms.
• Work closely with other departments in NEA to craft digital content to raise awareness and profile NEA’s areas of work, expertise and officers.
• Manage vendors to execute branding and marketing communications strategies for the CleanEnviro Summit Singapore.
• Provide online sensing of NEA’s issues.

[What we are looking for]
• Degree or diploma in Mass Communications or relevant disciplines, with a minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience in content development and marketing communications, or related fields.
• Strong interest in creating compelling digital content to engage different audiences.
• Familiarity and a strong interest in the various social media platforms.
• High level of commitment to producing quality work.
• Resourceful and a creative thinker.
• Good analytical skills, attention to detail and project management skills.
• Independent worker and team player.
• Excellent oral and written skills.
• Ability to multi-task, with good organisational skills.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment, especially during periods of crisis, that would require managing multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.
• As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

title: Assistant Manager / Manager, Global Business & International Networks
company_info: The Singapore Manufacturing Federation (SMF), formerly known as the Singapore Manufacturers' Association, was first established in 1932. Its main aim is to champion the Singapore manufacturing sector. Our mission is to represent the interest of the Singapore manufacturing community and to drive its competitiveness and sustainable growth through serving industry-specific needs. SMF is supported by 10 industry groups to serve diverse industry-specific needs, as well as 6 Centres of Excellence to offer our members a holistic approach towards improving competitiveness, upgrading skills and capitalising on new technologies. With a membership of over 3,000 corporate members ranging from MNCs to SMEs, SMF carries out a myriad of activities to enhance the competitive edge of our members. Our Council As a not-for-profit organisation, SMF is governed by a Council whose members hail from some of Singapore's most established and progressive companies. Through our strong links with the government, we are suitably qualified to represent our members objectively and to facilitate communication between the government, foreign delegates and the manufacturing community. Responsibilities
Perform technical validation (TEV) to ensure Customers’ network and site readiness is in line with the services ordering.

Preparing a diagram based on idea and plans for installation.
Address order automation fallout including verification & approve correct design, ASR and/or other subtending orders.
Validate all wiring connections & schedule dispatches with field operations.

Ensure any change requests are deployed and completed.
Close order post scheduled activation/hot-cut.
Document results of test & acceptance.
Diagnosis and repair of faults, and the selection and installation of equipment.

Bachelor's Degree/Master’s Degree in Telecommunications, Computer Science or Electronics.
8 years to 10 Years of experience.
Strong understanding of IP addressing/Subnetting/CIDR.
Transport: Ethernet, TDM.
CPE: Cisco, Juniper, Fortinet, Viptela, Versa, Aruba etc.
Protocols: TCP/IP, Private IP, Ethernet, GRE / IPSEC, MLPPP.
Routing Protocols: BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, RIP and Static Routing.

CCNA or JNCIA certification.

Network Operations (Managed Services for WLAN, LAN, WAN, IP PBX, Automation/Orchestration).
Wireless technologies (IoT).

IT based certifications (ex., Intel, Networking, ITIL, etc.).

title: Laboratory Assistant Manager
company_info: JMS SINGAPORE PTE LTD or JMS(S) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of JMS Co., Ltd. Established in June 1979 to meet world-wide increasing demands for disposable medical products. JMS develops and produces high-quality medical devices, which meet the needs of the current developments in health care by closely consulting with experts in the field and by observing the needs dictated by the market. By using an integrated system that relies upon highly qualified engineers, we have developed a wide variety of products, ranging from transfusion sets and infusion sets and disposable syringes, which pioneered the disposable medical supplies in the marketplace today, to dialysis and cardiosurgery devices.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:
Lead and coach the Lab Analysts, Controllers (chemist and microbiologist) in analytical testing. Ensure the data review and analysis is performed in a safe and reliable manner to support manufacturing operations in accordance with standard procedures.
Ensure the Lab’s operation and practices are following to EN ISO 13485, current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs), JQMS and Good Documentation Practices (GDPs).
Perform daily operations, problem solving, and continuous improvements in the Laboratory.
Supervise LAB analysts and technicians during testing and that will also include equipment troubleshooting, equipment failure handling and investigation.
Review analytical test results (inclusive of both raw materials and product) and monitor trends to detect early anomaly to prevent an Out-of-Specification situation.
Perform root cause analysis and implement appropriate corrective action during failure investigation. This is to be followed by ensuring all actions are completed. Make decisions based on scientific and logical rationale with a risk-based approach.
Ensure continuity in laboratory consumables, chemicals and supplies by monitoring inventory.
Completes operational requirements by assigning and scheduling staff.
Establish, review and/or approve operating procedures.
Train the LAB team on established operating procedures pertaining to equipment operation, test methods and all laboratory control.
Review regularly for continuous improvement and safety-related initiatives.
Coordinate, develop and maintains the scope and performance of LIMS (Lab Information Management System) projects.
Counsels and disciplines employees as required to achieve productivity.
Perform other related duties and responsibilities assigned by Lab Manager.
Job Requirements:
Minimum 2 years of technical experience in Quality Control laboratory within the medical device, pharmaceutical, food, chemical or process industries.
Experience in managing/supervising a team of Laboratory Technician, Analyst, Chemist and Microbiologist will be advantage.
Experience in operating LIMS (Lab Information Management System) will be advantage.
Willing to travel within the Asia-Pacific region when necessary.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational and project management skills.

title: Fundraising Manager
company: ASIA RESEARCH AND ENGAGEMENT PTE. LTD.
company_info: ASIA RESEARCH AND ENGAGEMENT (ARE) ARE helps financial institutions, companies, and civil society organisations understand and communicate the financial relevance of the sustainability and governance issues that matter to them. ARE provides specialist research, consultancy and engagement services to help these organisations reach their goals.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description – Fundraising Manager
Full-time or Part-time
Location flexible – SE Asia networks essential
$7K to 9K plus bonus, negotiable and depending on experience

Asia Research and Engagement (ARE) brings the voice of investors to Asia’s sustainable development challenges. We run collaborative engagement programs across Asia, assembling coalitions of investors to address strategic sustainability issues and using dialogue and shareholder escalation tools to shift the mindsets of senior decision-makers across finance and industry.
ARE has a team of highly motivated professionals with a range of backgrounds and disciplines who help to drive change. Our activities include running investor-backed engagement programmes and producing high-grade research on sustainability themes and management by Asian listed companies.
Our main areas of expertise are energy transition and its financing, protein transition, and sustainable real estate. We target a range of sector related Asian companies and banks.
ARE is looking for someone to focus on designing, driving and delivering an effective fundraising strategy and activities. The role holder will work with the Managing Director, Program Directors and Communication team members.

Duties and Responsibilities:
· Design and deliver a fundraising strategy to grow and diversify revenue streams from philanthropic foundations, grants, high net worth individuals and our collaborating investors.
· Collaborate with the Managing Director and Program Directors to drive and support ongoing fundraising activities
· Ensure sustainability of relationships and inspirational stewardship with our network of existing investors and funders.
· Manage key streams of revenue for ARE’s Programs working with departmental budgets to achieve or exceed fundraising and growth targets, including forecasting, planning and pro-actively reporting on progress of achievements to stakeholders
· Plan a programme of fundraising and business development events in collaboration with the Communications Manager and Program teams
· Project manage the submission of fundraising grant pitches and proposals including leading writing of applications to foundations and other institutional funders, in collaboration with the Program Directors.
· Following up with targeted high net worth individuals, investors, family offices and foundations in and beyond Asia.

Requirements and competencies:
· Proven experience and raising revenue in fundraising with an existing established network
· Experience of producing and delivering pitches, applying for grants and ability to write persuasive funding applications
· A broad understanding of sustainability and climate contexts, or an ability to rapidly grasp Energy Transition, Protein Transition and other sustainability and environmental topics
· Bachelor’s degree and Master’s level education preferred
· Excellent communication, writing, organisational skills and attention to detail
· A genuine interest in Asia and sustainability, location flexible but Asia networks and working time zone essential

Benefits including CPF (Singapore) or pension contributions, discretionary bonus, 20 days annual leave, group medical insurance (Singapore), flexible working from home/office. Hybrid working arrangement if located in Singapore.

www.asiareengage.com

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Contract Manager/Quantity Surveyor holds a vital role in our construction projects, overseeing contract administration, cost management, and procurement processes. This position combines meticulous attention to detail, strong industry knowledge, and effective communication skills to interact with various stakeholders. The Contract Manager/Quantity Surveyor's primary location is in the office, with occasional site visits as project requirements dictate.

Contract Administration and Workflow Management:
Administer project contracts and oversee workflows including variations and Contractor’s claim processes.
Ensure timely issuance of contractual notices as per project contract requirements.
Contractual Advice and Payment Management:
Advise management on contractual matters, progress payments, variation and cost claims with contractor and client.
Review and assess variation order requests, proposals, and associated costs.
Provide guidance to Project Manager/Director on cost impact due to project specification variations.
Prepare final accounts for settlement with contractors.
Cost Management and Analysis:
Evaluate completed works, comparing them with budget allocations.
Monitor actual costs versus project budget, identifying discrepancies and proposing corrective actions.
Pre and Post Contracts:
Assist in preparing, negotiating, and administering pre and post-contracts.
Prepare and assess bills of quantities, measurements, and cost estimations.
Payment Claims and Responses:
Assess and prepare payment claims for client submissions and invoices.
Prepare payment responses for compliance with SOP act for contractor, subcontractors, and others.
Tendering and Proposal Preparation:
Participate in tender documentation preparation, cost reporting, and administration of the tender process.
Evaluate tender submissions and contribute to recommendation reports.
Others:
To follow all company business operation and SOP at all times
Participate actively in Health Safety and Environment programs and activities in order to achieve Company’s KPIs, ISO 14001 objectives and target. Proactively rectify any abnormalities, unsafe acts or unsafe situations and report to supervisor accordingly
Maintain high standard of housekeeping at all times
Other ad-hoc duties as may be assigned
Work Experience Requirements
Minimum 8-10 years' relevant experience in the construction industry, including contract management, progress payment submissions/responses, and project claims.
Need to have main contractor exposure to understand the complexity of the project. (Preferable LTA exposure)
Familiarity with Public Sector Standard Conditions of Contract will be advantageous.
Strong technical background with pre and post-contract duties knowledge.
Proficiency in standard forms of measurement, forms/conditions of contract, and industry regulations.
Independent and collaborative team player with proactive, self-motivated, and multitasking abilities.
Exceptional problem-solving and organizational skills.
Familiarity with tendering, project cost control, and strong analytical skills.
Able to work under pressure and within tight deadlines.
Independent work ethic with good hands-on experience with Microsoft Office skills.
Quick learner with willingness to explore new skill sets and technologies.
Excellent communication skills and comfortable to present to senior management and clients.
Membership with SISV, RICS, or/and AIQS preferred.

description:

We are an early stage Proptech.

title: Internal Audit Manager
company_info: ALPHASEARCH PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Internal Audit Manager

Focus: Real Estate Asset Management
Location: Singapore (Regional Coverage)
Substantive AUM Growth
The Company
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a noted, real-estate focused group with substantial AUM across its Public & Private markets portfolios. Over the coming 4-5 years, accelerated growth is planned across all lines of business with a dramatic uplift in AUM reinforced by the launch of new Funds and ongoing balance sheet investments. As a result, the firm now seeks to appoint an appropriately experienced Internal Audit Manager for a newly-formed Asset Management division.

The Position
Reporting and working closely with the Head of Internal Audit, the Internal Audit Manager will be responsible for the Asset Management department and oversee a team of well-qualified internal auditors. The appointed individual will oversee all internal audit engagements and projects for the group. As such, the appointed individual will be involved in the planning of audit fieldwork and procedures (including audit focus and resource allocation), project managing the internal audit assignments and liaison across the senior executive management team. Naturally, there will be a need to develop audit recommendations and agree appropriate action plans with Management. This will necessitate the preparation of internal audit reports, findings and other related deliverables to the Audit Committee complete with continuous monitoring for performance improvement.
Why you should be interested? The firm is a powerhouse and poised for dynamic growth that will yield top-tier status in Asia for the size and quality of its real estate portfolio.

The Person
Interested candidates will be Degree-qualified (Accounting, Finance or Business) whilst holding professional Chartered Accountant or Chartered Internal Auditor accreditations whilst offering at least 8 years of relevant working experience, preferably secured within a Real Estate Asset Management / Investment Management or a PERE firm, complemented by exceptional English language proficiency. Candidates should demonstrate proven ability to prioritise and execute specific projects within tight deadlines, exceptional attention to detail and an ability to nimbly operate within a highly collaborative and high-performing team. specific projects within tight deadlines, exceptional attention to detail and an ability to nimbly operate within a highly collaborative and high-performing team.

title: Management Trainee
company_info: Hydroleap is a Singapore-grown water treatment startup backed by governmental and private VCs. We seek to replace chemical pretreatment processes with proprietary, IoT-enabled electrical treatment technology. Hydroleap's deep technical expertise allows us to design modular electrical treatment processes and deliver end-to-end wastewater treatment systems, offering solutions that are automated, robust, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hydroleap is a Singapore-based deep tech startup with the mission of disrupting the wastewater treatment industry. Our cutting-edge electrochemistry technology and innovative approaches to waste management have eliminated the need for manual interventions and toxic chemicals, making our solutions fully automated, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly.
With multiple successful deployments across the Asia Pacific region, including in the agri-food, oil & gas, data center, real estate, and construction sectors, Hydroleap is significantly impacting how wastewater is treated. We are proud to be backed by an impressive group of governmental and private venture capitalists, such as Realtech Holdings, Wavemaker Partners, Seeds Capital, 500 Startups, SG Innovate, Sparklabs, and Entrepreneur First.
Join our team and be a part of a mission-driven organization that is changing the world, one drop of water at a time.

Who we are looking for
The Management Trainee Program is an entry-level rotational program that offers an excellent opportunity to gain comprehensive exposure to various departments within our organization.
You will undergo a 1-year program, rotating between 4 departments - Business Development, Operations, Research & Development, and Projects.
This immersive experience will provide you with a deep understanding of Hydroleap's business and operations and equip you with the skills necessary for a successful career in the field of wastewater treatment.
This role reports directly to the Chief Operating Officer and dotted line to the Chief Executive Officer.

What you will be doing
Business Development
Identify potential clients and market opportunities.
Assist in conducting market research and competitive analysis.
Support the development and implementation of business strategies and initiatives.
Participate in client meetings and presentations.
Operations
Gain hands-on experience in the factory prototyping of Hydroleap's electrocoagulation and electrooxidation wastewater treatment products.
Assist in factory acceptance testing, site assessment testing, and commissioning of equipment.
Participate in installation and maintenance activities.
Collaborate with team members to optimize operational processes and improve efficiency.
Research & Development
Conduct laboratory tests and experiments on wastewater samples.
Generate feasibility reports based on experimental findings.
Collaborate with the team to develop innovative solutions and improve existing products.
Stay updated on the latest industry trends and technologies related to wastewater treatment.
Project Management
Support the planning, execution, and monitoring of Hydroleap's projects.
Assist in coordinating project activities and ensuring timely completion.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address project challenges.
Contribute to project documentation and reporting.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Environmental Science, or Business) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Proactive mindset with a desire to learn and contribute to a fast-paced environment.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Passion for sustainability and innovation, a desire to positively impact the world, and an interest in making a difference in the water space
Upon successful completion of the rotation program and based on performance evaluation, the company may offer a professional position aligned with the incumbent's skills and the company's requirements.

Join Hydroleap as a Management Trainee and embark on a rewarding journey to shape the future of sustainable wastewater treatment solutions!

title: Operations Manager, Quality Management & Training
company: CERTIS CISCO AVIATION SECURITY PTE. LTD.
company_info: Certis is a leading outsourced services partner that designs, builds and operates multi-disciplinary smart security and integrated services. Our multi-service offerings leverage our strong heritage in security, and are augmented by applied AI solutions. These solutions are part of our comprehensive technology development and systems integration capabilities that are fully cyber secure by design. At Certis, we seamlessly orchestrate security, facilities management and customer experience for greater cost efficiencies that empower your future. We are committed to building a safer, smarter, better and more sustainable business for you. As a diverse tech-led security organisation, team members enjoy job rotations within the wide Certis Group, with opportunities for continuous learning and the strengthening of skill-sets. Certis offers you a platform to shine in the operations realm and the chance to build meaningful relationships working together with like-minded colleagues. Certis is headquartered in Singapore, with an international presence that extends to Australia, Hong Kong, Macau, China and Qatar.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Certis
We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thrive.
We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make our world safer, smarter and better.
Life at Certis
If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a ‘job’, we would love to hear from you.
At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you’re looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solution, we want you to bring your ideas to the table.
We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow – the perfect place for you to grow your career!
Position Overview:
You will supervise Quality Learning Centre Operators and Quality Service Supervisors, ensuring the standards of the Quality Management & Training Office are upheld, and oversee the creation of training programs, quality assurance efforts, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:
Training & Development:
Ensure the highest standards and consistently deliver top-quality service to our clients.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create training materials, manuals, and multimedia resources.
Develop quality control measures to the best practices and regulatory requirements.
Conduct training sessions for security personnel, covering topics such as security protocols, emergency response, customer service, and use of matterssecurity equipment.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training sessions, making adjustments as necessary.
Provide feedback and coaching to security personnel to enhance their performance.
Quality Assurance:
Establish and maintain quality assurance processes to assess the current processes
Ensure the highest standards and consistently deliver top-quality service to our clients.
Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with security protocols and procedures.
Identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.
Coordinate all operations matter with stakeholders
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain accurate records of all administrative, IT-related matters and all red teaming records
Generate reports on training effectiveness, compliance, and quality assurance findings.
Communicate findings and recommendations to senior management.
Continuous Improvement:
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging security technologies, and regulatory changes.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and training enhancements.
Lead initiatives to enhance the overall quality and efficiency of department operations.
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., security management, criminal justice, or education) preferred.
At least 3 years of Lean Six Sigma experience with hands-on experience in implementations, coaching and mentoring.
Possesses functional knowledge and management experience with quality, customer satisfaction systems and processes
Experience with developing and implementing quality data collection and reporting procedures
Possesses abilities to influence, negotiate, and resolve conflicts to reach a consensus around common goals
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational and project management abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Recognition & Award
What you can expect from us:
Work on world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency
Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education
Community volunteering opportunities
A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance.
Certis is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.

Roles & Responsibilities
*Only candidates from eCommerce retail / FMCG / Consumer Electronics will be shortlisted*

The Client Singapore's Retail team is looking for a Vendor Manager. It is a pivotal role for a highly analytical Manager with a passion for driving thought leadership, delivering exceptional results and launching new ideas and initiatives that will contribute to the evolution and success of the Singaporean retail business. If you’re inspired by a new challenge and the thought of contributing in a significant way, then this is the position for you.

As the Vendor Manager, you will be a passionate customer and category advocate within the company; possess strong negotiation and analytical skills, together with proven commercial knowledge and experience. The ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task is a must, together with excellent project management skills and laser sharp attention to detail. The Vendor Manager must also be an effective communicator, working with some of the Singapore's most important partners and vendors, as well as with internal colleagues and cross-functional leaders. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a passion for retail and a high level of flexibility and commitment.

Please note this role is a 9-months fixed term contract (maternity cover).

Key job responsibilities
• Conduct financial analysis of business opportunities to meet and exceed revenue and profitability targets
• Act as the ‘new business developer’ for PC categories and brands, possessing a complete understanding (inclusive of the strategic context) of internal and external variables that impact your business. This includes owning forecasting, analyzing, understanding and reporting on the business, in particular prospecting, conversion and terms negotiations).
• Have a thorough understanding of the industry, seasonality and business trends/events, and continually monitor competitor/industry developments
• Maximize company's business and financial profitability through selection expansion opportunities
• Have a complete understanding of the customer needs, both existing and potential, and use that knowledge to advocate for and drive delivery of site features that provide customers with an unparalleled shopping experience
• Build vendor/brand relationships - be the primary point of contact for vendor on-boarding and then ensure smooth transition to the category teams once on-boarded
• Coordinate cross-functional teams, and communicate with internal and external stakeholders, while meeting tight deadlines
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
- 3+ years of with Excel experience
- 5+ years of retail, operations, product or program management, or business management/consulting with negotiations and delivering results experience
- Bachelor's degree, or 3+ years of professional or military experience
- Experience with financial analysis and P&L ownership
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
- Experience managing large data sets and utilizing to drive performance and process improvements
- Experience in vendor negotiations, pricing and promotion, inventory management, and product development


Location: Central
Working hours: 9am to 6pm / 5 days
Work arrangemnt: Hybrid (3 days onsite compulsory)
