· Partnering and supporting core banking flagships and transverse areas in their large scale development projects.
· Providing premium In-house Banking applications
This unique positioning empowers us to bring our core banking business a sustainable competitive advantage on the market.
We seek innovative and agile people sharing our mindset to support ambitious and forthcoming technological challenges.

Position
CSI department is responsible for development and maintenance of Compliance, Referentials, Counterparty/Credit Risks and Finance applications used by worldwide users, composed of the following divisions :
- Compliance IThandles Business Compliance & Financial Security application portfolio, based on internal and regulatory models
- Referentials ITcovers Know Your Customer processes & Counterparty referential management
- Credit Risk ITcovers Front office Applications, Credit Decision Processing tool, Global Authorization Repository system and Default History Data Base
- Counterparty Risk IT handles applications responsible for risk data collection, risk
- calculation and monitoring for CACIB worldwide
- Finance ITis responsible for applications handling financial accounting and liqauidity and yied financial risks for CACIB worldwide.
CSI applications are in-house developments.

Main responsibilities
As a Delivery Project Manager you will :
· Liaise with IT business lines contacts for clarification and understanding of requirements.
· Analyze functional impacts considering technical constraints with technical lead and business analyst contributions
· Prepare and present functional aspects of changes/evolutions to developers
· Provide detailed cost and planning estimations
· Manage the resources “workload capacity” and communicate to Client Project Manager
· Handle relationships related to the delivery between the project and other GIT teams
· Coordinate delivery during all the project phases and resolves conflicts
· Maintain project detailed schedules ( in respect of budget scope, time and quality)
· Provide timely reporting of issue(s) that impact project progress
· Follow-up delivery progress
· Assesse activities and deliverables and report the result of this assessments through the KPIs
· Identifie risk and define risks/ mitigations plans with the Client Project Manager
· Organize and lead operational committees

As a senior Business Analyst you will :
· Liaise with IT business lines contacts for clarification and understanding of requirements.
· Analyze functional impacts considering technical constraints with technical lead and business analyst contributions
· Prepare and present functional aspects of changes/evolutions to developers
Responsible for the functional testing of development
· Develop tests strategy in coordination with Technical leads / Business Analysts
Involved in support of application for functional incident
· 3rd level support work on request escalated from level 2
· Reproduce, make first analysis and investigate verifying codification and data
· Analyze and/or solve functional problems in coordination with developers
The activity provided will have to comply with the CA-CIB Policy.

Qualifications and Profile
This position requires a minimum of 8 years as a Delivery Project Manager with at least 2 years into a CIB organization.

General
Advanced Experience in Project Delivery lifecycle methodologies
Proficient in Waterfall and Agile methodologies
Experienced in team distributed context
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Excellent communication skills
Pro active and result oriented
Strong sense of confidentiality & Sense of commitment
Technical
Any Project Management certification
Microsoft Project (advanced level)
Microsoft Excel (advanced level)
Kanbans, Burndown charts (advanced level)
Software Factory & DevOps principles Knowledge
MS TFS and Altassian JIRA or equivalents
Functional
Risk and Finance domain knowledge (strong asset)
Corporate Investment Banking Environment (must have)
Strong technical skills in Data Mining
Education & Work Experience:
Intermediate or Senior Level (8-12 years exp)
Master or Bachelor’s degree in relevant specialities

title: IT Project Manager (Applications / Infrastructure) - RT
company: SMART INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS PRIVATE LIMITED
company_info: About the Company: Smart IMS delivers IT solutions that create a sustainable competitive advantage for its clients across the world. The company was founded by business and technology experts with extensive backgrounds in designing, implementing, and managing large and complex IT projects at Fortune 500 companies. We are a Cisco and Microsoft Gold certified Partner, specializing in providing end-to-end Infrastructure Management Services (Network, Security, VOIP, Systems, Databases and Applications) across the Globe. Our core portfolio includes IT applications, business process services, and IT transformation services. We leverage our deep industry and functional expertise, leading technology practices, and an advanced global delivery model to help clients transform their highest-value business processes and improve their business performance. Smart IMS is headquartered in Plainsboro, New Jersey (US), with offices in India, Singapore, Sydney, and Dubai. Our Global Delivery Center is located in Hyderabad, India and is a state-of-the art facility designed to accommodate up to 500 employees. It was built using best-of-breed products and solutions from global leaders such as Cisco, HP, Sun, IBM, Oracle, and Microsoft. The high-end configuration infrastructure, built using a fiber-optic backbone, enables high-speed communication links with all our offices and client sites. Smart IMS deploys a global delivery model at the heart of its business operations, leveraging people and infrastructure in different global locations. • Cloud Transformation – IoT, Big Data, ML/AI, Migration • Enterprise Application - Microsoft Dynamics 365 / AX / CRM & Salesforce & Oracle & SAP & Guidewire • Infrastructure Engineering – SDN -WAN, SBC, RMM • Unified Communication – Voice & Data (MS Teams), Contact Center • Application Development & Management • Managed Services – 24/7 in different time zone • Professional Staff Augmentation Services – Onsite/Offshore
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Executive Summary
Smart IMS Inc provides Digital technology & Cloud transformation services, Application & Infrastructure Management Services, Unified Communications and Insurance implementation services to customers across the Americas, Europe, Middle East, and Asia-Pacific regions. As the trusted technology and business partner of leading MNCs, including Global Investment Banks, Smart IMS is also a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner, Oracle Platinum Partner and AWS MSP Partner.
We are looking to hire an IT project Manager to drive IT projects for our client in Singapore, a multinational shipping company.
Job Description:
Provide leadership for the project team to meet project goals and adhere to their responsibilities and project milestones.
Controlling and analyzing the project delivery process
Leading and facilitating various IT functions to drive effective and timely deliverables.
Work with respective IT functions to prepare estimated budget and detailed project plan for all activities of the project to achieve project objectives in planned timeframes.
Manage the day-to-day project activities and resources and chairing the IT project management team meetings.
Provide status reporting regarding project milestones, deliverables, dependencies, risks, and issues, and communicating across leadership.
Understand the interdependencies between technology, operations, and business needs.
Define the Statement of Work and Specifications for the requested goods and services.
Develop and manage all aspects of project engagement, including planning, external vendor relationships, communications, resources, budget, change, risks, and issues.
Work with respective stakeholders to develop overall budget and timeline, generate periodic progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation.
Conduct regular working level meetings with Business and IT Functional managers and team members.
Conduct periodic update meetings (e.g. SteerCo) which includes CEO, CFO, Business Program Manager, IT Director, and other stakeholders.
Manage project issues, risks and escalations to mitigate impact to baseline.
Job requirements:
3-5 years’ experience in IT project management in both Applications and Infrastructure is required for this position.
Prior experience in managing the IT integration and migration of M&A is highly desired.
Deep experience in delivery within a programme management that involves complex IT and business functions.
Have good experience in managing business applications, data mapping/migration, application integration, etc
Familiar with infrastructure and EUC management
Experience implementing change management.
Certified in PM accreditations (e.g. Prince, PMBOK, PMI) will be an advantage

title: Manager, Project
company_info: Molex Incorporated is one of the world’s largest manufacturers of electronic connectors. Today, we employ over 46,000 people worldwide. Our core business is the manufacture and sale of electronic components. Our products are used by a large number of leading original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) throughout the world. We design, manufacture and sell more than 100,000 products. We also provide manufacturing services to integrate specific components into a customer’s product. Our engineering, development and manufacturing capabilities are organized into four product divisions, all serviced by the Molex Global Sales and Marketing division. Molex brings together innovation and technology to deliver electronic solutions to customers worldwide. Molex offers a full suite of solutions and services for many markets, including data communications, consumer electronics, medical, industrial, automotive, and commercial vehicle. For more information, please visit www.molex.com Molex is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of color, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, military status, medical status, marital status, gender identity and expression, protected genetic information or other legally protected factors. Molex Singapore will not refuse to hire a disabled applicant who can perform the essential functions of the job with reasonable accommodation.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your Job
Be part of a global cross functional team that help to develop exciting products for the EV industries, globally. Leading the cross-functional team in the execution of the project and are required to hold accountability for the success of the project. Follow the Molex PDP process, management skills and leadership to lead and accomplish the project as per the project plan .

Our Team
Independent, fun and passionate group of people who enjoy working with people from different regions; putting differences aside with one common goal. You will be reporting to Group Manager, Project.

What You Will Do
Lead cross-functional teams to deliver new product launched on time and budget. Ensure that these teams achieve or beyond all customer and company requirements including quality, cost, delivery, product performance and customer satisfaction.
Hold accountability on all new product launch related issues and lead team to achieve project flawless launch successfully.
Involve in Pre-Project period with technical/timing/ customer requirement/ quotation discussion and review with PDM if needed.
Assess the projects’ risk, execute and monitor it.
Ensure the advanced product quality planning (APQP) process is established, documented, implemented, and followed according to IATF16949 procedures.
Serve as the expert in new product launch systems including timing, documentation and interaction.
Ensure the team develops/finalizes special characteristics, design reviews FMEA, establish actions to reduce potential failure modes, develop and/or reviews control plans and communicate variance to plan early so issues can be addressed.
Maintain good communication among project team members, departments, and customers.
Maintain program cost reporting against budget.
The responsibility relevant to manpower management.
Participate in trainings, actively reporting and timely escalation.
Other duties as assigned by Management
Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)
Degree in Engineering / Management or equivalent field
At least 5 years work experience in project management
Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills.
Documentation management and ability to use project management tools.
Time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.
Office 365 Competency (example: SharePoint, TEAM, Excel etc)
What Will Put You Ahead
Mechanical/Manufacturing/Electronics/Project Management
Work experience related to new product development in multiple sites will be preferred.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Project / IATF16949
At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.

Who We Are
As a Koch company, Molex is a leading supplier of connectors and interconnect components, driving innovation in electronics and supporting industries from automotive to health care and consumer to data communications. The thousands of innovators who work for Molex have made us a global electronics leader. Our experienced people, groundbreaking products and leading-edge technologies help us deliver a wider array of solutions to more markets than ever before.
At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.

title: Assistant Project Manager-Ship Repairs & Conversions (Tuas)
company_info: We provide innovative solutions in turnkey building, repair and conversion services for naval and commercial vessels and are one of the few shipyards in the world capable of supporting the entire lifecycle of a ship. Our shipyards in Singapore and the U.S. have established a strong track record in designing and building highly customised and technically sophisticated commercial and military vessels for customers worldwide. Expanding on our core competencies in large scale engineering, we provide a comprehensive suite of environmental engineering solutions in water, wastewater, solid waste and renewable energy. A trusted partner to naval and commercial sector customers worldwide, our track record includes successfully delivered projects in Brunei, China, India, Thailand, Singapore, the Middle East and the U.S.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Manage and direct ship repair, construction and conversion projects.
Conduct and lead the daily VSCC meeting on hot-works and incompatible jobs onboard to ensure safety of personnel and property are not endangered.
Meet repairs / refit schedules by planning, monitoring projects’ critical path, cost control and execution.
Develop good working relationship with customers and maintaining teamwork showing high interests.
Solve daily conflicts at ground level by monitoring and coordinating sequential and incompatible jobs affecting master schedule.
Closely liaise with classification societies, ship owners, owner specialist engineers, vessel crew and ship agents to ensure successful completion of the project meeting or exceeding customer’s expectations.
Meet commercial / naval contractual commitments and quality of repaired ship.
Capture additional works and raise work list and provide information to Commercial Dept for more competitive pricing.

Requirements:
Degree/Diploma in Naval Architecture/Marine/Mechanical Engineering.
Min. 5 to 7 years experience in project management for ship repairs in similar capacity from marine / heavy industries.
Possess SRM Certificate
Able to make appropriate decisions and judgments, decisive and take proper actions.
Able to lead and manage ship repair, construction and conversion projects independently.
Willing to work late at times and possess leadership qualities.
Proficiency in MS Office
Proficient in report writing

Other Information:
Location: Tuas Road (Island-wide transport provided)
5 days work week
Working Hours: 7.25am to 5.00pm

Well-versed with installation of M&E services and builder’s works.

Good in negotiation.

PC literate and knowledge in MS Office.

Minimum 10 years of relevant experience with 3 years of managerial experience.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose of Position
To manage and coordinate according to company’s standard business implementation methodology for qualified accounts, and provide support to sales & operations.
To drive implementation programs of new business
To manage re-implementation (continuous improvement) of re-awarded or on-going business;
Urgent operational interventions as may be required to secure and retain ‘business at risk’ caused by repeated or on-going operational underperformance;
Constant review of the complex business within the Organization in particular in the event of business changes or new trends have been identified; identify and recommend opportunities for improvement and business optimization.
To take lead and support the promotion and deployment of company’s track & trace system
Responsible for customer and internal training of company’s track & trace system usage

Key Tasks
Business Implementation Management
Develop implementation plan for awarded business based on contract requirements and involve all stakeholders (Identify, plan, prioritize and monitor implementations)
Create flowcharts and contact lists that clearly show ownership and escalation paths.
Identify and support the development of metrics/measurement tools according to the customer’s requirements and company’s capabilities
Work closely with Regional and Global Implementation Team on designated projects.
Liaise with Account Owners, KAM/IV, Sales, Supply Chain Management, Products, and Tender Management teams to confirm expectations and requirements, based on customer needs and contract details
Ensure that business impacts (scope creep) of project are properly managed and communicated
Coordinate implementation with relevant partner countries and ensure smooth and proper SOP handover (sign-off) to operational delivery prior business start
Set-up and manage cross-functional project teams to handle implementation requirements
Provide a handover and closing report at the end of each account implementation project detailing what worked well and what did not, including recommendations for future improvements in the overall process
Support post-go live operations as required
Provide profitability and productivity benefit estimates and tracking methodology further to business re-implementation or optimization
Adhere to defined Panalpina customer implementation methodology
Customer Care and Business at Risk Management (systematic and repeated service failures)
Review procedures of existing accounts as to identify & recommend opportunities for business improvement and optimization.
Analyze and identify root cause problems; assign ownership for resolution to respective Countries where appropriate and ensure corrective actions completion as per defined time lines
Initiate and manage required cross Country changes (up to and including re-implementation of business) to ensure sustainable performance improvement to expected levels
Adhere to defined continues improvement methodology
System Commercial Superuser
Thoroughly understand company’s track & trace system as a user
Take lead and support the promotion and onboarding customer to the track & trace system
Responsible for customer account creation
Supporting group direction and attend monthly / quarterly global calls
Responsible for customer and internal training on user level
Processes and Tools
Identify and support the development of metrics and measurement tools according to customer requirements
Assist corporate or regional supply chain team with establishing systems requirements and coordinate systems integration where required
Assist in the analysis of operational processes and identification of improvement opportunities
Initiate and coordinate training for operational units on customer-specific tools and processes
Additional to above tasks
Any other job-related tasks as assigned by the superior.
Adherence to the Code of Conduct policy of the DSV Group
Competencies
Self-motivated and self-disciplined
Organizational skills (prioritize, plan, assign and control)
Ability to influence and negotiate
Ability to drive innovation, manage change and deal with ambiguity, devising effective change management processes
Ability to think creatively and "outside of the box" when needed
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, listening and presentation)
Is result oriented and places great emphasis on customer focus
proactive and capable of working independently
Has an international mindset and exhibits great cross-cultural sensitivity
Experience & Education
University degree, business administration, logistics management preferred
Logistic industry experience (minimum 3 years)
Working experience (minimum 5 years)
Functional & operational know-how on global forwarding
Basic knowledge in finance & good business practice
Six sigma Black belt is desirable

Lendlease Singapore is currently searching for an experienced Project Engineer to join the Project Management & Construction team responsible for the build and delivery of a range of projects.

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to;
Key Accountabilities
. In conjunction with the Construction Manager and other supervisors regularly assess the project for high-risk construction work activities and related hazards and risks and maintain oversight of the development and implementation of preventative control measures consistent with the requirements.

. Ensure project sites implement forward planning of tasks ahead and obtain a SWMS for high-risk construction work and any related documents well ahead of schedule.
. Support the Construction Manager and General Foreman/Site Managers in EHS initiatives.
. Identify and deliver relevant aspects of project sustainability objectives and targets.
. Apply knowledge of current best practice in sustainability and industry knowledge to design development.

. Degree / Diploma in Building, Engineering (Civil, Mechanical or Electrical), Architecture or related disciplines
· 3-5 years of design and construction work experience in a project management position.
· Candidate should have related work experience in one or more of the following sectors: Retail, Commercial, Residential.
No matter where your office is, you will be a part of a company that values you. At Lendlease, we invest in you professionally and personally so that you perform to your full potential to leave behind positive legacies in years to come.

Lendlease is a diverse, flexible and inclusive employer of choice. We engage, enable and empower our people. Inclusion sets all of us up for success.

At least 1 to 2 years of related experience in Power Generation Engineering and Project Management

Knowledge in electrical aspects of power systems and control panels

company_info: We believe our success is through the efforts of our people. We welcome high energy individuals with the right skills and mindset to join our team! Founded in 1995, the Prime Structures Group is a Singapore-managed group of companies providing building envelope solutions. Prime Structures has presence in Brunei, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Philippines and Sri Lanka. We take an integrated approach to provide design, build, and supply solutions across Asia. We pride ourselves on our ability to manage the challenges and complexities of providing complete building envelope solutions. Our integrated approach lets us take ownership of our clients' building envelope. Our ﬂexibility and experience enable us to anticipate challenges in the process, ﬁnd innovative ways to solve problems and build buy-in from everyone along the way. With our commitment to delivering the building envelope solution that meets our clients' goals, we give all a peace of mind. We are in the business of Façade Design & Management where we focus on 4 main businesses offerings: 1. BUILDING ENVELOPES We’ve developed innovative building envelopes that help to improve overall building design and maximize light and heat efficiency. As a certified Building Construction Authority of Singapore (BCA) CR16 L6 curtain wall contractor, we’re able to tender for curtain wall projects of unlimited amounts. 2. CUSTOMISED STRUCTURES AND ART STRUCTURES We have the engineering expertise to construct and install customised structures and art structures. The ‘Momentum’ by David Gerstein, and the ‘Wind Arbor’ art wall are two of our completed projects situated in prominent locations in Singapore. 3. SECURITY FACADES We’ve developed security facades that resolve environmental, structural and security threats in order to achieve secure buildings that are both aesthetically appealing and functional. 4. INTERIOR FIT-OUTS We deliver end-to-end restoration, renovation and interior fit-out solutions on time while maintaining the highest standards of safety and quality.

The Project Coordinator supports two functions:

2) Project
Assist in the planning, execution and monitoring of the project to be completed on time, within budget, safely and to specfications.
Responsibilities:

Planning, Execution and Monitoring (Project)

Assist in the overall quality control of the work (budget, schedule, plans, personnel’s performance) and report regularly on project status

Assist to prepare internal and external reports pertaining to project status

Collaborate with design team and engineers regarding the design and cutting lists and shop drawings
Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques
Assist to obtain required permits and licences
Ensure compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards and specifications
Contract Management (Project)
Evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports
Timely submission of progress claims to the client/main-contractor
Supplier and Sub-Contractor Management (Project)
Coordinate and direct construction workers and subcontractors
Planning, Execution and Monitoring (Fabrication)
Coordinate and collaborate where necessary with procurement and project teams to ensure timely fabrication of materials to be delivered for the projects.
Quality Control and Compliance (Fabrication)
Assist the fabrication and production processes, ensuring quality control and compliance with industry standards and specifications.
Ensure factory production and processes are in compliance with related legal/statutory regulations and as per contract specifications
Implement quality control standard operating procedures and ensure factory employees work to established standards
Propose and implement machine standard operating procedures and ensure factory equipment are running at optimal efficiency
Safety
Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues
Ensure ongoing works are in compliance with building and safety regulations and report incidents (if any)

Diploma in construction management, architecture, civil engineering or related field
Working experience in building and construction / civil and structural projects

Working knowledge of softwares: Microsoft Office, Project, BIM, Autocad, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)
Competent in conflict and crisis management
Excellent time and project management skills
Excellent communication skills (Oral and Written). English proficiency is a must.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description of the position: Senior Security Project Engineer

A Senior Security Project Engineer with extensive expertise is needed to join our team. You will be a vital part of design, implementation, and management of security solutions a Senior Security Project Engineer. You will take the lead in organizing and carrying out security projects and driving our security initiatives and upholding a strong security posture will need the use of your experience in security engineering, and security project management, and security assurance in projects.

Responsibilities:

• Manage all phases of a project's lifecycle, including planning, estimating costs, allocating resources, executing and contacting stakeholders.
• Oversee the development, optimization and administration of security solutions for projects.
• Identify risks, weaknesses, and potential threats, conduct thorough projects.
• Create and implement security standards, processes, and policies in compliance with MAS TRM and industry best practices.
• Integrate security controls and measures into systems and infrastructure by working with cross-functional teams.
• Work in coordination with outside suppliers and partners to guarantee the smooth completion of security initiatives.
• Junior team members should receive technical mentoring and advice to foster professional development.
• Prepare and present thorough project reports and progress to key audiences, such as reporting and senior management.

Requirements:

• Degree in computer science, information security, or a related subject.
• Certificates like GDSA / TOGAF / SABSA / CISSP.
• 7 years of experience in security project management, as well as demonstrated experience as a security engineer.
• Familiarity with industry security frameworks and regulations (such as ISO 27001, NIST, PCI –DSS and MAS TRM).
• Strong interpersonal and communication abilities, with the capacity to work successfully with stakeholders and establish connections.
• Leadership qualities and the capacity to guide and mentor the team members.
• Capacity to coordinate several tasks with competing priorities.
• Strong technical proficiency in the concepts of security engineering, including Network Security (FW / IPS / Anti-DDoS), Endpoint Protection, Encryption, WAF / CDN/ DNS, Proxy, DLP, SIEM and Vulnerability Management.
• It is preferred that candidates have knowledge of cloud security and experience securing cloud settings (such as AWS).

Roles & Responsibilities
Audio Visual Project Engineer
Working days: Monday - Friday
Working hours: 9am - 6pm
Salary range: $2800 - $4000
Location: Kallang Bahru (Near Bendemeer MRT)

The Audio Visual Project Engineer will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of audio visual systems for various projects. The Engineer will work closely with project managers, technicians, and clients to ensure that all audio visual systems are implemented to meet project requirements and specifications. The Engineer will also be responsible for testing and troubleshooting audio visual systems, as well as providing technical support to clients as needed.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with project managers to determine project requirements and specifications for audio visual systems.
Design and develop audio visual system schematics, floor plans, and wiring diagrams.
Oversee installation of audio visual systems, including equipment placement, cabling, and integration with other systems.
Ensure that all audio visual systems meet industry standards and project requirements.
Test and troubleshoot audio visual systems to identify and resolve any issues.
Provide technical support to clients, including training on system operation and maintenance.
Create and maintain project documentation, including system manuals, as-built drawings, and testing reports.
Work with technicians to schedule and perform regular system maintenance, including firmware updates, software upgrades, and hardware replacements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices for audio visual system design and installation.
Brief project updates and status to project managers and clients as needed.
Qualifications:
Possess with Electrical Engineering, Audio Engineering, or related education background.
Experience in audio visual system design, installation, and maintenance.
Knowledge of audio visual system components, including video projectors, sound systems, video walls, and control systems.
Familiarity with audio visual system design software, such as AutoCAD or Visio.
Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and schematics.
Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.

title: Project / Product Manager for ERP System Development
company_info: AppsPOS is a leading provider of customised software solutions to the F&B and Retail sector in Southeast Asia. We are currently seeking an experienced Systems Engineer with a strong background in .NET technologies and ERP system development to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the design and implementation of our ERP system.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
AppsPOS is a leading provider of customized software solutions for the F&B and Retail sectors. Our products include cloud-based Point of Sales systems, mobile app ordering, online payments, customer loyalty programs, kitchen display systems, and queue systems. With a footprint across Southeast Asia, we are rapidly expanding our operations and are looking for a dynamic Project/Product Manager to join our team.

Job Summary:
The Project/Product Manager will be responsible for overseeing the development of a new ERP system. This role requires excellent communication skills, an analytical mindset, and the ability to work closely with both the founder and an offshore development team. Experience with ERP systems is an added advantage, although candidates with the right attitude and willingness to learn quickly are also encouraged to apply.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development of the ERP system from conceptualization to launch.
Translate user requirements into development requirements for the offshore developer team.
Work closely with the founder in both pre-sales and post-sales support.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are met.
Conduct market research to identify opportunities for product enhancements.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior management.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Business, Computer Science, or related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in project or product management is an added advantage.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex requirements into actionable plans.
Experience with ERP systems is an added advantage.
Candidates without ERP knowledge may apply if they possess a strong work ethic, commitment, and willingness to learn quickly.

What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits.
Opportunity to work closely with the founder and senior management.
A fast-paced environment with enormous opportunities for career growth.
Exposure to international markets, particularly in Singapore and Hong Kong.

title: Director, Benefits & Rewards Projects – Asia Pacific
company: HILTON INTERNATIONAL ASIA PACIFIC PTE LTD
company_info: Hilton is a leading global hospitality company with a portfolio of 18 world-class brands comprising more than 6,100 properties with more than 971,000 rooms, in 119 countries and territories. Dedicated to fulfilling its mission to be the world’s most hospitable company, Hilton welcomed more than 3 billion guests in its 100-year history, earned a top spot on the 2019 World’s Best Workplaces list, and was named the 2019 Global Industry Leader on the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices. Through the award-winning guest loyalty program Hilton Honors, more than 103 million members who book directly with Hilton can earn Points for hotel stays and experiences money can’t buy, plus enjoy instant benefits, including digital check-in with room selection, Digital Key, and Connected Room.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A Director, Benefits & Rewards Projects - Asia Pacific will primarily be responsible for shaping the Benefits culture for Corporate Offices and Properties in APAC through delivering Benefits expertise leadership, and support.

You will lead the benefits design or review projects for all Corporate benefits on an end-to-end basis, and shape benefits practices for properties on a scalable basis through toolkits, templates, benefits fundamentals workshops, and other creative approaches.

This role is held accountable for developing the APAC Benefits Strategy and Priorities, in alignment with global benefits principles and strategy, and driving successful implementation of the strategy and priorities through project leadership and strong collaboration with HR Ops leaders and all other key stakeholders. The primary focus is on benefits deliverables and will encompass other non-benefit aspects of Rewards including but not limited to rewards communication, analytics, and other projects as assigned by the Head of Compensation & Benefits APAC.


What will I be doing?
As the Director, Benefits & Rewards Projects - Asia Pacific, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:

Benefits Design & Reviews
Work with the Head of Compensation & Benefits APAC to develop APAC Benefits Strategy and benefits principles & standards that are fit for business and relevant to Team Members (TMs). This will include consultation with relevant global stakeholders to ensure that all proposed principles and standards are aligned with global standards and policies and Hilton values.
Provide benefits expertise leadership, guidance & support to regional benefits projects or benefits projects of key properties in APAC.
Responsible for end-to-end benefits projects management for all Corporate Benefits reviews and assigned benefits projects of key properties/markets.
Main contact for all global benefits-related projects or policy actions. Collaborate with/support global benefits team members as required.
APAC Benefits Policy Advice and Administration
Provide advice on questions or issues related to Area benefits policies. Work with relevant stakeholders to develop solutions for benefits-related issues.
Ensure efficiency in the admin processes/operations of area/global benefits policies or programs.
Responsible for developing benefits budget guidelines for key policies/programs to corporate offices and properties.
APAC Benefits Inventory
Lead the initiative to evaluate the need and use of 3rd party vendor/consultant in the project to set up a comprehensive benefits inventory for all Corporate Offices and Properties in APAC. This includes project management and required technology to house the benefits inventory.
Work with relevant Regional HR leaders, property HR teams, and other relevant stakeholders to set up the APAC Benefits Inventory and develop ongoing and sustainable processes to maintain updates and accuracy of the data with optimal resource engagement.
Benefits Governance & Cost Structure
Set up an APAC Benefits Governance Structure - develop and conduct regular reviews of an APAC RASCI and review/approval process for all benefits-related policies, programs, and decisions that are fit for business based on sound governance principles.
Establish APAC/Regional insurance pooling arrangements for key insurance-based benefits based on a growing scale to achieve greater and ongoing cost-effectiveness.
Thrive@Hilton Team Lead
Work with HR leaders to develop an ongoing and self-sustaining APAC strategy to embed Thrive@Hilton in everything we do for our TMs.
Work closely with global Thrive owners/team to ensure global alignment of Thrive strategy, campaigns, and activities. Leverage Thrive champions and partner with other Corporate and Property resources to drive the successful implementation of the APAC Thrive strategy.
Drive stronger collaboration and partnership with Communications in all relevant Thrive communications including marketing and promotion of Thrive campaigns/events.
Reward/Benefits Communications & Storytelling
Work with the Head of Compensation & Benefits APAC and HR Leaders to establish capabilities/expertise around rewards communications (particularly in benefits-related areas) and high-impact storytelling in our corporate and property HR team. Leverage the Communications team and global expertise resources to build and sharpen these capabilities.
Rewards Projects
Undertake any APAC benefits or compensation projects as the development of toolkits to deliver/build rewards expertise at the property level.

What are we looking for?
A Director, Benefits & Rewards Projects – Asia Pacific serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow:
University Degree from a recognized university.
At least 5 years of APAC Benefits specialization at a managerial or senior consultant level in an MNC environment.
Experience working in multi-cultural or international settings with at least 5 years of extensive regional benefits specialization at a Senior Consultant or Managerial/Director level in an MNC environment.
Strategic and big picture thinking and commercial savvy, coupled with the strong ability to deep dive and work the details.
Strong benefits design expertise: understand key design elements of each type of benefit and be able to identify and collaborate with key stakeholders for each type of benefits review.
Extensive understanding of local market and industry practices and sources of market intelligence. Be resourceful in tracking or establishing market intelligence where required.
Ability to critically analyze market data that are relevant to the scope of review; run cost and risks/benefits analysis to develop and present sound proposals independently or with minimal guidance.
Be able to set service and analytical reporting requirements/standards for vendors to enable the C&B team to make well-informed and data-based recommendations/decisions.
Strong end-to-end project management skills including planning and execution skills: the ability to track and stay on top of all deliverables and lead/guide/support project team members as appropriate to deliver according to project goals, requirements, and timeline.
Excellent stakeholder management skills including influencing and communication skills (presentations and written).
Ability to direct collaboration among cross-functional teams including external resources.
Ability to analyze market and internal data to develop recommendations and make strategic and tactical decisions.
Demonstrate the highest standards of ethical behavior and absolute discretion with sensitive and confidential information.
Ability to take initiative to identify, prioritize and implement actions required to achieve functional goals.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills including the ability to address any issue in collaboration with others, identify and prevent potential problems and develop problem-solving skills in others.
Ability to provide development and mentoring to others to help others acquire benefits and expertise skills.
Ability to work independently and manage the work of others through influence and strong project management skills.
Ability to recommend segmentation proposals and to assess team member impact, cost, risks, and other implications.
Ability to think out of the box and be flexible and creative with benefits solutions and processes.
Fluent language skills (reading, writing, and speaking).
Technically savvy with high proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to travel across APAC (estimated 25%).

What will it be like to work for Hilton?
Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for passionate team players to join us in managing our portfolio of B2B2C Loyalty and CRM programs. You will be responsible for operating and implementing day to day program activities, reports and deployment of digital innovations with close collaboration with internal and external teams. The role covers understanding, applying and enhancing business processes, marketing operations and digital technology engagements.

Job Description:

The Account Manager grows/retains a portfolio of accounts and is responsible for building client relationships, developing account management strategies, coordinating with internal teams to deliver solutions that meet clients' needs, and identifying opportunities to grow accounts.

Account Manager demonstrates CRM/Loyalty/Marketing expertise. Together with Project Management, strong quantitative and qualitative skills, Account Manager leads internal teams and external clients, representing strong business skills and functional skills.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide leadership and support during strategy, concept, and execution.
Partners with internal teams to drive value and engagement.
Looks for ways to improve account growth by understanding clients’ objectives and goals.
Demonstrates ability to communicate, present and influence effectively at all levels.
An expert at building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions.
Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs.
Effectively presents insights and recommendations and point-of-view.
Assists and advises account and financial management relating to account profitability.
Fosters a collaborative environment to encourage an exchange of ideas between cross-teams.
Perceives obstacles and objections as an opportunity to engage, consult, and deliver value.
Skills:
Highly motivated individual with strong communications.
Ability to excel in fast paced environment drawing on proactive problem-solving skills.
Experience in managing internal and external teams.
Keeping abreast with the latest marketing and client trends to build competitive solutions.
Building a deep and collaborative working relationship with clients and partners.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or related field of study.
3+ years of account management experience (agency/MNC environment).
B2B industry, CRM and Loyalty experience.
Experience in marketing operations, communications and analytics.
Strong expertise in Excel, PowerPoint and Project Management.
Exposure to Data Analytics tools such Power BI and Tableau (preferably)
Excellent communications, negotiation and presentations skills.
Have deep understanding of customer experience and their digital transformation needs.
Good organization skills, attention to details and multi-tasking.
Manages client expectations, bringing issues/concerns to the clients' attention before they become issues, offering potential solutions, and advising of potential delivery delays.
Opportunity to:
Work with an award winning b2b marketing and technology agency.
Work on regional and global projects and stakeholders.
Practice and improve strategic and functional aspects of loyalty programs.
Master various loyalty, marketing and digital tools and technologies.
Progress to more senior business management and team management roles.
Widen your skills to expert level and progress to senior managerial roles.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Ensure enhancement of Cyber Security Operations for cyber threats monitoring, detection, analysis and response through the use of threat intelligent and automation
• Project management and Vendors Management
• Drive continuous improvement of Incident Response Framework, Incident Response Plan, Event Management, Standard Operation Procedure, Playbook and etc. for cybersecurity operations and incident response
• Perform advanced trend, pattern and statistical analysis to project future technical cyber threat scenarios
• Synthesize multiple information sources and analysis reports into a holistic view of potential threats
• Conduct in-depth research into cyber security issues of industry- or nation-wide significance
• Produce findings to help initialize or support law enforcement and counterintelligence investigations or activities
• Establish incident management procedures for the detection, reporting and handling of incidents
• Develop a playbook for cyber incident management
• Perform the remediation and resolution of cyber incidents at the organizational level
• Direct post-mortem activities following critical incidents
• Work closely with internal and external parties to manage the operation of SOC
• Manage security operation to ensure implemented security technologies and controls are effective and adequate to protect our infrastructure/business
• Track and analyse cybersecurity metrics for effectiveness, benchmarking and management reporting.


QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

• 6-8 or more years of experience in running security operations including project management and implementation skill set.
• Technical know-how and experience in IT security solutions such as (but not limited to) and at least operated in more than one of the followings:-
• Network Security : F/W, IPS, VPN, UTM, NAC
• Knowledge in Checkpoint, Juniper, Cisco, Aruba and Fortigate, CyberArk, Tripwire, will be an added advantage
• Content Security : WEB Security, Anti-Spam/Anti-Virus
• End point Security : Anti-Virus/Malware, Host base IPS, DLP, BitLocker
• Security Information Management: SIEM, Security management, Forensics
• Advance Persistence Threat Solution
• Experience in conducting detailed cyber security events investigation and analysis including leading and responding to cyber security incidents
• Familiar with Kill Chain methodology, MITRE Att&ck, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001, 27002 and etc.
• Relevant Cybersecurity Certifications such as CISM, CISSP, GCIH, GNFA, CCSK, CRIST will be an added advantage

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose:
Construction Manager reports to Site Manager and is responsible to manage and execute the construction works and plans at the yard. He leads the Contractor’s multi-disciplinary construction team and coordinate with yard construction team to ensure that the project meets the technicalities of construction requirements, cost is within budgeted amount and construction standards are adhered to.

Responsibilities:
Oversees all site execution by planning, managing, coordinating construction execution strategy, preservation and day to day activities. Provide overall technical direction the construction. Coordinates project execution and planning with the relevant parties, departments and agencies.
Responsible for the formulation of construction delivery schedule; upon the execution of the project, responsible for the constant review of the timeline and re-arrange and deploy resources and manpower, where needed, to meet targeted schedule.
Manage any conflicts between the various parties
Manage and execute the site works and plans at the yard and ensure that the technicalities of construction requirements and standards are adhered to. Coordinates all project installation engineering between designs/engineering, material procurement, load out design and transportation of line pipe and offshore installation activities. Responsible for the successful delivery of yard project scope within specified quality standards, time and budget.
Work closely with the Site Manager by any means of communication on the status of work packages, oversees coordination of material management and mobilizations and demobilizations of subcontractor companies. Follow up on issues of Purchase Requests for materials and/or equipment related to the Project.
Scheduling and Cost Management by ensuring construction & installation progress on schedule and within prescribed budget.
Undertake the lead role in managing and monitoring the assigned site fabricator in ensuring that its resources, compliance, deliverables are executed according to the contractual scope.
Identify elements of project design and construction likely to give rise to disputes and claims. Understands interface issues e.g. procurement, construction, commissioning & pre-operations and actively manages them. Communicates possible changes in the scope of work to project manager (applicable to contractor companies or client)
Managing various trade contractor performances with regard to safety, quality, budget, production and preservation. Develop relationships with client technical or service personnel.
Comply and implement MODEC HSEQ Policy and requirements to the yard sites, including but not limited to, ensuring HSEQ requirements are communicated, training and competency for HSEQ critical roles, effective workplace hazard management, incident reporting and investigation, and emergency response.
Organize, direct and supervise contractors to ensure construction & installation procedure strictly follow drawing & relevant regulation requirement and equipment vendor’s specification
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering/construction with 10 years of work experience, or master’s degree in the same discipline with 8 years of work experience.
Minimum of 10 years work experience in EPC of onshore/offshore Oil & Gas or FPSO projects.
Track Record in Site Construction Execution.
Basic understanding of construction management, project management, construction methodology principles, quality assurance and HSSE requirements.
Demonstrate interpersonal skills with effectiveness across functional, racial and national boundaries.
Strong working knowledge of marine construction and/or topsides modules structure/piping construction and preservation.
Strong working knowledge of contractual documentation (contracts, waivers, addendums, annexes, scope changes, contractual schedule etc) and ensures planning and execution complies with contractual requirements.
Strong oral and written communication skills in to guide and communicate information to multinational personnel and different levels of work force and a large variety of vendors and fabricators.
Logical/MECE thinker and good presentation skill using visual aid of MS power point.
Commitment to take responsibility with willingness to personal growth.
Extensive experience managing Topside Construction over multiple FPSO projects
Fluent in Mandarin.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Digital FX Implementations Project Manager will be responsible for driving new client-facing technology onboarding projects. Reporting to the Head of Digital FX Implementations, the individual will coordinate the integration of a suite of FX trading applications and the implementation of multi-country solutions on CitiFX Pulse, Citi’s award-winning FX dealing platform. The candidate will work with clients from Citi’s corporate and public sector segments, and the role requires extensive coordination with our sales teams and client stakeholders. The role involves understanding the client's environment where the application will be implemented, required interfaces, user journeys and bespoke customizations. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to engage different client profiles and stakeholders, and be able to deliver on project timelines, while ensuring full adherence to Citi’s governance and controls.

Responsibilities
Oversee the end-to-end implementation and onboarding cycle, liaising with client stakeholders, product teams, developers, technical support and sales
Contribute to the UAT and go-live procedures, adhering to Citi's technology deployment requirements
Manage up to 10 implementations at any one time, ranging from 4-10 weeks.
Contribute to sales solutioning and design from time to time
Contribute to client onboarding an CX projects and initiatives
Qualifications:
5-8 years of experience
Previous experience in client-facing roles with proven track record on technology deployment, client implementation and project management
Adept with FIX protocol and have experience with API integrations
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
Ability to articulate technical concepts in an accessible manner
Knowledge and experience of payments (interbank and card processing) processes will be a plus

title: Cost Manager / Senior Cost Manager
company_info: Asia Infrastructure Solutions (AIS) is one of Asia’s leading multidisciplinary consultancies in the construction & real estate sector with project managers, programme managers and cost managers delivering some of the most iconic projects for international and local clients in Singapore and the wider APAC region. Recent projects include the Jewel at Changi, CapitaSpring, the North-South Corridor, the Hilton, Data Centers, Corporate Headquarters for the world’s leading MNCs and financial institutions and many more. Applying our deep market sector insights, we work in partnership with our clients to deliver exceptional and sustainable outcomes throughout the lifecycle of their natural and built assets. In Singapore, we employ 300 staff and we are part of a global group of 9,000 people active in over 80 countries. AIS. Delivering the Future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Main Purpose of the Job:

Key responsibilities for this role include, but not limited to, managing end-to-end cost management from pre-construction to post-construction; high-level costs plans/estimates, procurement strategy, governance and compliance reviews. The (Senior) Cost Manager is expected to liaise with client and external project teams to formulate procurement and cost solutions/ scenarios.

The role is a seconded resource into Citibank D&C Office Cost Management team.

Job Description (Key Responsibilities):
Develop high level Costs Plans / Estimate / Benchmarking Data for client budgeting purpose for projects across the APAC region.
Work with Citi and other vendors to develop strategy & costs required to undertake the work/strategy in a timely manner.
Formulate and review procurement strategy, award recommendation and change orders / variations in accordance with governance and ensure compliance in place.
Liaise with local project teams and client to formulate cost solutions / scenarios / approvals and ensure correct governance for end-to-end project stages; from project strategy to financial close-out stages.
Involves in commercial & cost initiatives as needed.
Job Requirements & Person Specification (Qualifications, Experience, Skills & Behaviours)
Cost Manager/Quantity Surveyor with at least 10 years’ experience and has Corporate Real Estate experience (preferred).
Proficient technical knowledge – Measurement, cost estimating, construction technology, contracts and law.
Competent with professional practice and contract administration processes.
Able to handle multiple projects independently.
Able to work as a team player, but also autonomously to achieve what is required and within the deadline.
Exhibit strong interpersonal skills
Ability to lead and drive local project team to deliver effective and consistent cost management deliverables.
Good communicator both written and verbal and able to speak Cantonese (preferred).
Ability to work within a diverse team in a fast-paced environment as well as being a self-starter with positive attitudes.
About Asia Infrastructure Solutions:

Asia Infrastructure Solutions is a leader in delivering project & programme management, cost management, sustainable design, engineering, business advisory and consultancy solutions for the infrastructure, buildings, and environmental sectors. The company was established by Global Infrastructure Solutions Inc. (GISI), the largest privately owned construction manager in the commercial building, industrial and healthcare markets, and a leading project / construction manager in the environmental and public infrastructure sectors. GISI and its founding members have over 90 years of project experience in Asia and currently employs 12,500 employees globally, operating in more than 90 countries.

Asia Infrastructure Solutions has a strong and diversified team of project managers, construction managers, programme managers, cost managers, sustainability consultants and various disciplines of engineering professionals with a long track record in the infrastructure, building and environmental sectors delivering the future for the built and natural environment. Our professional and technical expertise and capabilities are inherited from the Arcadis Design & Engineering / Hyder / Freeman Fox in Hong Kong and Arcadis Consulting / EC Harris / Davis Langdon & Seah businesses in Singapore which span many decades in the Asia region.

Notable projects in Singapore include the Jewel at Changi, CapitaSpring, the North-South Corridor, various hotels, data centers and corporate headquarters for the world’s leading MNCs to name a few.

We empower our employees to succeed and we invest in their professional growth through learning & development programmes as well as membership of professional bodies. Our employees also receive a range of benefits that includes opportunities for hybrid/flexible working, a share-ownership scheme, and private healthcare coverage.

Asia Infrastructure Solutions . Delivering the Future . AsiaInfraSolutions.com

Fair recruitment practices:
Asia Infrastructure Solutions adheres to the Tripartite Standards for Recruitment Practices in Singapore and uses fair, merit-based, and inclusive hiring practices.

Employment agencies:
Candidates referred by employment agencies will not be considered unless the agency has been explicitly instructed to provide candidates for the stated role.

title: HSSE Manager
company_info: No information added.
address: THE METROPOLIS, 9 NORTH BUONA VISTA DRIVE 138588
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Offshore Frontier Solutions Pte Ltd is a leading provider of solutions to the Floating Offshore Oil & Gas market for more than 50 years and we are currently looking for a HSSE Manager to join us.

Being part of Offshore Frontier Solutions means being the protagonist of a challenging career and being in touch with the latest deep-water production systems, knowing that your career begins in Singapore, but your talent can take you anywhere in the world. If you want to be one of the greatest in the market, this is your opportunity!

Responsibilities:
Possesses in-depth knowledge of Statutory HSS&E Regulations and Industry HSS&E standards and ensures their correct implementation. Develop and maintain updated Project Regulatory Compliance Register.
Ensures project activities carried out by MODEC are conducted in strict accordance with international standards (ISO 14001 series and ISO 45001) and within corporate HSSE standards.
Ensures that MODEC HSSEQ Policy, Standards and Corporate HSEQ-MS, Client HSE requirements and Project HSSE Plan are implemented consistently and effectively and are known and understood by all project site team members.
Maintains HSE communications with HSSE Manager – MOPS and Project Manager on safety alerts, HSE concerns and resources so as to respond promptly when necessary.
Creates, establishes and leads implementation of Project HSSE Plan(s), HSSE procedures, work instructions, etc. and HSSE performance measurement.
Establishes, attends to and monitors the conduct and execution of project HSSE studies, reviews, assessments, etc. including HAZIDs, HAZOP’s, FSAs, Risk assessments, JSAs.
Monitors and evaluates Contractors’ HSSE performance as per Corporate requirements, Project Contract and Project HSE Plan.
Ensures that systems are implemented to aid the continuous improvement of the project HSSE Plans, programs and practices.
Advises project personnel in the identification and prevention of unsafe conditions, unsafe practices, health hazards and environmental aspects by audits and inspections. Advises on future preventive measures and/or corrective actions.
Ensures all project accident/ incidents are reported and investigation reports are issued timely as per Corporate and Project requirements.
Form and lead the incident investigation team.
Ensures all corrective actions of accidents and inspection are followed up and closed out.
Identifies HSSE training needs, plans and ensures training is effectively conducted.
Champions CARE program and ensures that awareness process is fully implemented within the Project.
Ensures and implements effective emergency response plans for all project sites, including communications and drills.
Ensures HSSE records and reports are compiled, maintained and submitted in accordance with Corporate and project requirements and schedules
Requirements:
Minimum Masters in Environmental Engineering and minimally 15 years of experience.
Completed Certification as a Workplace Health and Safety Officer (WHSO) through the Ministry of Manpower, or equivalent/similar for overseas base.
Must have ISO 45001 lead auditor certification.
Must have knowledge of ISO14001 internal auditor.
Must have exposure and knowledge of ISPS code.
Min 10 years of progressive experience in the development and implementation of Health, Safety and Environmental programs involving the project life cycle with at least 8 years in a Lead HSE position within an EPCI environment.
Experience as an HSE trainer or coach and in developing general and specific HSE awareness, induction and refresher HSE trainings for site leaders, supervisors and engineers.

Modec is committed in creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected characteristics.

title: Talent Development Manager

PropertyGuru.com.sg is used by over 4.5 million consumers who view over 50 million pages. address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Make A Real Difference at PropertyGuru.
Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.
PropertyGuru is Southeast Asia’s leading PropTech company, and the preferred destination for over 41 million property seekers to connect with more than 63,000 agents monthly to find their dream home. PropertyGuru empowers property seekers with more than 3.2 million real estate listings, in-depth insights, and solutions that enable them to make confident property decisions across Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, and Vietnam.

PropertyGuru.com.sg was launched in Singapore in 2007 and since then PropertyGuru Group has made the property journey a transparent one for property seekers in Southeast Asia. In the last 15 years, PropertyGuru has grown into a high-growth PropTech company with a robust portfolio of leading property marketplaces across its core markets; award-winning mobile apps; mortgage marketplace, PropertyGuru Finance; and a host of enterprise solutions now under PropertyGuru For Business, including a high-quality developer sales enablement platform, FastKey, DataSense, ValueNet, Awards, events and publications across Asia.

About the Role
The Talent Manager reports to the Group Head of Talent Development to provide talent management strategic interventions and tactical support to the Group. The role partners with business leaders and key stakeholders to drive talent engagement and implement capability building plans in alignment with the Group’s strategies.

Responsibilities
Design and conceptualize talent management frameworks, strategies and solutions to support business talent needs and drive talent engagement across the group.
Work closely with business leaders and key stakeholders across the group to spearhead key talent development initiatives across talent reviews, performance management and promotion to drive a high performing culture.
Support the group leaders in succession planning, to identify, groom and position high potential talents for leadership positions and specialist roles.
Future-proof the group competency framework to maintain relevancy in the skillsets of our high performing workforce.
Develop and execute career development framework and enablers for the group and enhance talent mobility across regions and functions.
Requirements
Minimum 8 years of experience in talent and succession management, in a regional capacity.
Strong record in leading talent development projects, managing the end-to-end talent management process and cultural change at organizational level.
Experience in identifying needs, developing strategies and implementing talent and career development initiatives and programs.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills.
Strong stakeholder management experience.
Highly adaptable and demonstrate agility to thrive in a fast pace and evolving environment.

title: Assistant IT Manager
company_info: The story of Bacha Coffee begins in the medina of Marrakech, Morocco. Built in 1910, the spectacular Dar el Bacha palace, which means “house of the Pasha”, united the greatest cultural and political minds of the century over glittering pots of “coffee of Arabia” or Arabica, as it is known today. Being the finest luxury coffee brand in the world, Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.
description:

Join the Bacha Coffee team
Great ideas start with coffee, Bacha Coffee starts with you. We are headquartered in Singapore with coffee rooms and boutiques in Europe and Asia currently. We are expanding aggressively to achieve a worldwide presence in the upcoming months...
Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine-flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.
The qualities that have made Bacha Coffee a legendary brand around the world also make us a great place to work: innovation, creativity, passion, and excellence.
Job Description: Assistant IT Manager

Project management, tracking, monitoring and status reporting to stakeholders. Defining deliverables, resources and workplans for projects. Ensuring the timely delivery of projects.
Assist the department head in organising, planning and implementing IT strategies.

Manage a team to ensure smooth running of daily IT operations, ensuring timely resolution of issues, fulfilment of requests and provision of IT related information.
Manage vendors and suppliers to ensure deliverables, cost effectiveness and timeliness of services/ products.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Infrastructure Engineering Team
Our infrastructure team supports the company's fast growth by building and operating hyper-scale datacenters, managing the life cycle of server fleet, providing cloud solutions, and developing various infrastructure services and making sure they are scalable and are reliable.

Responsibilities
• Grow and lead a team of engineers committed to building and operating platforms and systems that monitor, maintain, upgrade and dispatch workload over our planet-scale server fleet.
• Test, evaluate, benchmark, introduce and quality control server hardware in a production environment.
• Be both technically hands-on and people manager. Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your project peers.
• Communicate cross-functionally across various teams, organizations and internal and external stakeholders to drive engineering efforts.
• Lead the team's innovation efforts, bring in new ideas and technologies.
• Oversee the acquisition and development of software systems in organisational units.
• Monitor the results and quality of the different software solutions and projects implemented in the organisation.
• Oversee the development of Proof-of-Concept/ solutions and provide technical expertise on the development of software and platform features, ensuring that appropriate security and risk factors are considered.

Qualifications
• At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
• 5+ years experience working with Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond
• 5+ years experience in one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, C++ and Python.
• 3+ years of direct management experience in a technology company or experience as a technical lead and experience in formal project management or business training.

Preferred qualifications:
• Master’s degree (or Bachelor's degree with 5+ years of experience) in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related major
• Building platforms, automation and tools to manage server fleet, their life cycles and systems running on top.
• Building tools and systems that test, troubleshoot and measure the performance of server hardware
• Successful experience in establishing product visions, managing roadmaps and product delivery.
• Excellent analytical, comprehension, communication, writing, and consultative skills
• Experience in a production and hyper-scale environment

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
Provide training and assistance in the Centre Of Excellence for Asia Pacific import and export regulatory issues with focus on China; compliance resource for the corporation; interface with clients through information sharing and compliance programs; work with the Chief Compliance Officer to develop corporate compliance policies; perform internal audits to monitor compliance and provide compliance training internal and externally ; assist BDP offices on-site to take necessary corrective action in the event of compliance shortcomings.

Essential Responsibilities
1. Act as a Subject Matter Expert with regards to import and export documentation/permit/licensing, HTS, valuation of products, Country of Origin, and regional logistics compliance issues.
2. Liaise with local operations teams and other cross-functional teams across the company’s global network to optimize daily operations through sharing of best practices.
3. Drive customs initiatives with Regional Key Account holders for our global clients i.e. leverage on FTAs, changes in policies and regulations, etc.
4. Experience with export and import controls, economic sanctions, and other trade laws, regulations and requirements administered by jurisdictions in APAC.
5. Create best practice methodologies that are to be shared inside of BDP operations as well as to external clients.
6. Train BDP staff at all levels in formalized programs based on areas of potential exposure.
7. Keep current with global and local regulatory issues to limit corporate exposure at all levels.
8. Increase productivity and efficiency at the operations level thorough systems development, written procedures and policy, and recommendations.
9. Provide supervision and guidance to Asia Pacific offices on regulatory changes and compliance matters.
10. Provide or support training and education on trade compliance related matters in APAC.

Other Responsibilities
1. Must be willing to travel and maintain flexible schedule
2. Participation in Corporate seminars, when needed

Job Specifications
Experience:
Required minimum 5 years’ experience in international and local regulatory framework for Importing / exporting
Preferred- one year transportation / logistics experience

Education:
A good degree in supply chain or international logistics
Preferred- Chemical or Logistics background

Knowledge:
Proven ability within Trade regulations, logistics, operations and project management Experience with Trade Management Systems

Hours of Work:
As required, including travel

Supervision:
Must be independent and motivated, requiring little or no immediate supervision. This position currently has no direct reports. Complexity of This position requires attention to detail, strong organization skills, Work: and ability to handle competing priorities. The position requires Professional interaction with clients, government officials (such as Customs). As “gate-keeper” for the Organization’s liability in many areas, focus on proper resolution to protect BDP must be a priority.
