description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Account Manager – Spurwing Communications

At Spurwing, we have created an environment that helps our people be better every day.
If you’re seeking a company that values curiosity, initiative and bold perspectives to shape the future of communication in the healthcare, nutrition and sustainability sectors then you will thrive in our environment.
We get excited by people who will seize the opportunity and freedom to shape the work they do and the place they work. We’ll give you the chance to make an impact in the industries addressing the world's most significant challenges.
We’re proud of what we have achieved in just a few years and excited for what the future holds.

The role you'll play:
We are looking for an Senior Account Manager to help drive and deliver excellent communications strategies that inspire clients and engage their target audiences. You will be accountable for the successful delivery of clients’ campaigns and programs and setting the bar for excellent delivery from your teams. You will play an important role in the agency, nurturing key client relationships to establish trust through deep understanding of their position and objectives and providing counsel, supporting senior management by taking ownership of client accounts and providing guidance to junior team members, AM and below, to help them grow, thrive and champion their successes.

About you:
At least 6 years’ experience in communications, ideally from an agency
Knowledge of what is going on in the global healthcare, food and/or nutrition sectors
Experience in project management, effectively managing multiple workstreams simultaneously
Ability to independently give client counsel and lead meetings
Experience managing professional development of junior team members
A strong track record in nurturing excellent client and media relations, with outstanding interpersonal skills
A talented writer with a flair for storytelling
An energising, can-do attitude with a thirst for learning and self-development
High levels of initiative and drive, with a well-developed commercial acumen and professional work ethic
A deep understanding of public relations and digital communication
Experience and interest in new business pitch and proposal development
A Degree or higher in Public Relations, Mass Communication, Media Studies, Journalism or any communications-related field is preferred but not essential.
Are you ready?
Send us your resume and tell us why you are right for this role.

title: Account Manager (Oncology)
company_info: MSD PHARMA (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. Today’s MSD is a global healthcare leader working to help the world be well. MSD is a tradename of Merck & Co., Inc., with headquarters in Whitehouse Station, N.J., U.S.A. Through our prescription medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies, and consumer care and animal health products, we work with customers and operate in more than 140 countries to deliver innovative health solutions. We also demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to healthcare through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships. Whatever your career path – whether it’s pursuing original science in the laboratory, working directly with our customers, manufacturing quality products or supporting our business in another way – MSD offers opportunities to develop and expand your career while making a true difference in people’s lives. Learn more about who we are as a company and to discover the many reasons to join MSD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on the Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).
Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.
Our Oncology team is dedicated to delivering breakthrough innovations that extend and improve the lives of cancer patients worldwide. Our team of forward-thinking individuals achieve this through an unwavering commitment to support accessibility to medicine, providing new therapeutic solutions, and collaborating with governments and payers to ensure that people who need medicines have access to them. Our focus is on innovation and launch execution excellence; we translate breakthrough science into innovative medicines that help people with cancer across the globe.
An Account Manager role will be a liaison between oncology customers and internal company teams, acting as a valuable partner for oncology customers and other stakeholders in key accounts to address their needs and pain points, delivering values to customers and the patients under their care.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Customer Engagement
Build and maintain long-term relationships with all key customers, leveraging in-house resources whenever is required to add value to customers
Identify and understand each customer’s motivation, unique business needs and objectives
Share products merits with HCPs tailoring their identified needs and provide basic product education to customers who are not familiar with company products
Understand the market dynamics and industry trends to provide advice to favorably position company’s products
Ensure great experiences and add values to customers and their patients whenever customers engage with the company
Stakeholder Management
Identify shared purpose among different stakeholders and leverage this to co-create solutions with stakeholders in the healthcare ecosystem
Create stakeholder mapping and identify key decision makers and their network of influence
Facilitate platform for different healthcare stakeholders to discuss optimum patient care & management
Communicate market and customer insights to cross-functional team to develop value-adding solutions for customers and patients
Plan, implement and coordinate internal efforts with cross-function teams (e.g. Marketing, Market Access) to deliver value for customer and other stakeholders
Account and Territory Management
Identify stakeholders and opportunities for the key accounts in territory and develop customer engagement plan for the account accordingly
Develop account plans with defining short and long-term strategy to support the growth of prioritized accounts
Identify prioritized key accounts, provide customized services to different customers in line with company service standard
Monitor performance metrics and is responsible for account performance and commercial proposals; ensures sales targets and goals are met or exceeded
Strategy Development Support
Contribute inputs and co-develops the therapy area strategies
Contribute to sales strategies and tactics development and deploy marketing activities, which are fully compliant with internal policy & compliance processes
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
To be successful in this role, you will have:
University degree in Pharmacy or Science-related domain (biomedical, biology, life science, medical related etc)
4 year of working experience in a MNC environment with minimum 2 years of experience in healthcare, preferably in account management.
Experience in Oncology
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills including partnering with key HCPs and organizations. Experience in project management is an added advantage
Broad understanding of patient journey(s) in defined disease area(s), enabling engagement at the specialist level
Strong business acumen with expertise in commercialization and customer experience. Good track record in sales, with a history of achieving results
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment and able to influence other team members to provide best support to customers
Excellent communication skill and able to understand and leverage digital means and tools
Strong learning agility and resourceful
Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Manage and control Day to Day activities
• To lead the team in managing the day-to-day operations of all company’s Facilities, Security and Safety matters in Singapore.
• To communicate with all levels, both internal and external, in getting the jobs done competitively and effectively and to meet all regulatory and statutory requirements.
• Manage and control day to day activities in terms of status and ageing through the platform (E-facility request).
• Provide the relevant advice to the facility team members to eliminate any obstacle and difficulties to get open items done
• To ensure the establishment, maintenance and continuous improvement of the Singapore site Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) management system, including maintenance of HSE related certifications and regulatory requirements
• Ensure proper maintenance of building and facilities. Take lead to solve facility issues including liaising with stakeholders and meeting contractors.
• Monitors and works closely with relevant divisions in facilities-related procurements.
• Schedules and arranges necessary maintenance of the equipment and facilities. Builds and maintains strong vendor relationships.
• To disseminate official announcements associated with new or periodical exercises such as Fire drill to all the relevant parties.

Facilities Profit & Loss management
• To be responsible for the facilities Profit & Loss and to continuously source for better solutions and to develop an effective and costs efficient process.
• To draft facility budget planning by liaising with internal and external stakeholders.
• To liaising with the account department to determine Capex/Opex and payment schedule upon any investment planning.
• To analysis monthly Facilities Profit & Loss with internal stakeholder

Facility Project management
• Work with Procurement to drive tender/sourcing processes.
• Plan and schedule respective project tasks and progressive update inside the platform (Microsoft project).
• Delegate the respective project tasks to team members properly and effectively.
• Closely monitor the progress of the respective tasks and highlight in case of potential delay to the management.
• Liaise with relevant internal or /and external stakeholders to come out with some alternative plan to overcome or /and mitigate potential risks.
• Closeout projects by conducting testing, getting statutory approvals, substantial completion, and final reconciliations and generate close-out report for the management.

Internal Audits / external audits
• Ensuring compliance with site HSE requirements through scheduled internal audits or inspections and propose feasible solutions to the management on the findings.
• Support and facilitate external audits on HSE related subjects as and when needed (regulatory inspections, customer audits, certification audit)
• Participate in company’s internal/external audit such as ISO 13485/GDPMDS SS 620 and ISO 9001 (2015). Equip with the experience and qualifications in Safety matters and to coordinate with Workplace Safety and Health Officer (WSHO) on safety matters.

Fire Drills and Emergency Response
• Ensure CERT team is formed; members with proper appointment; and adequate training.
• Ensure fire drills are conducted minimum twice a year and records in place.
• Identify and implement areas for improvement on fire drill performance.

Licensing
• Maintain the current register of all licenses required for the Singapore site and maintain hard copy filing, keeping track closely to ensure application or renewal of these licenses before expiry.

Pre-requisite
• Diverse experience and minimum 10 years in facilities / building services / safety management.
• Degree/Diploma in Estate Management, Facility Management, Real Estate Business, Property Development & Facility Management, Engineering preferably Mechanical or Electrical related.
• Certified FSM with FSM experience is a plus.
• Competency in Microsoft Office Suite applications is a pre-requisite.
• Competency in Numerical and Analytical application tools is a pre-requisite.
• Demonstration of personal commitment and curiosity to be involved in continuously upgrading one-self through various learning channels will be an advantage.
. Existing managerial experience will be at advantage

title: Assistant Manager, Brand Content
company_info: The story of Bacha Coffee begins in the medina of Marrakech, Morocco. Built in 1910, the spectacular Dar el Bacha palace, which means “house of the Pasha”, united the greatest cultural and political minds of the century over glittering pots of “coffee of Arabia” or Arabica, as it is known today. Being the finest luxury coffee brand in the world, Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join the Bacha Coffee team
Great ideas start with coffee, Bacha Coffee starts with you. We are headquartered in Singapore with coffee rooms and boutiques in Europe and Asia currently. We are expanding aggressively to achieve a worldwide presence in the upcoming months...
Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine-flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.
The qualities that have made Bacha Coffee a legendary brand around the world also make us a great place to work: innovation, creativity, passion, and excellence.
Responsibilities
Digital & Performance Marketing content
Conceptualize, write, proofread, and update evergreen and seasonal website and online marketplace content and campaigns across sites and platforms.
Liaise with translators to request translations to ensure websites are updated across all countries and languages.
Manage content performance through SEO; identify keywords and content strategies to increase the number of visitors to Bacha Coffee websites and online marketplaces to obtain high-ranking placement in the results page of search engines for our brand and products.
Set up and continue to improve the strategy, roadmap, tone of voice and language for Bacha Coffee customer service.
Create SOPs, templates, and training materials for order processing and customer service.
Write and review performance marketing advertising campaigns including Google Search, Shopping and Display, Meta evergreen and ad hoc promotional ads.
Marketing, PR & Social Media content
Collaborate with Marketing team on product, campaign, and promotional launches.
Plan, create and maintain meaningful content across all Marketing channels, including retail, F&B, wholesale, etc.
Manage and review content to ensure categorization, product imagery, and copy is accurate and enticing, meets brand guidelines and adheres to the Marketing calendar.
Write content for customer email direct marketing (EDM) campaigns, SMS and WhatsApp customer related messaging, and automated message services.
Collaborate with PR team to write, edit and/or proofread press releases, KOL content packs, boiler plates, company statements, and any other media content.
Manage and review PR content to ensure all details are accurate and ready to be released to media for timely publication to the public.
Collaborate with the Social Media team to conceptualize original social media content, and to assist in the writing, editing, and proofreading of posts and stories.
Other content projects
Collaborate with local or overseas departments to conceptualize, write, edit or proofread brand copy, including Training materials, Operational manuals and other branded materials which will affect the positioning of Bacha Coffee with its staff, partners, customers or the public.
Requirements
Bachelor degree in English, Communications, Digital Marketing, eCommerce, Business or similar equivalent with minimum 3-5 years of supervisory experience.
Strong communication skills with excellent command of English, preferably mother tongue.
Meticulous, adaptable, creative thinker who can work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient in MS Office, Google Ad Words and Meta applications.
Media and internet savvy.
Results-driven and able to work under pressure.
Experience working in the luxury industry would be a plus.
Understanding of Content Management Systems (CMS).
Outstanding problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot website issues in a fast-paced environment.
Strong time and project management skills with the ability to multi-task.
Bacha Coffee is an equal opportunity employer. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Manager, R2R Process Standardization
company: FUJIFILM BUSINESS INNOVATION ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
company_info: FUJIFILM Business Innovation is committed to continue offering innovations to businesses globally to help maximize their organizational strengths. We have pioneered numerous technologies and accumulated expertise since our establishment as Fuji Xerox in Tokyo in 1962, to build an environment that encourages the use of one’s creativity by effectively adopting information and knowledge. Our portfolio includes conducting R&D, manufacturing and sales of world-class multifunction printers, production printers and IT solutions, as well as business process outsourcing services. On April 1, 2021, FUJIFILM Business Innovation changed its name from Fuji Xerox to a name that embodies its commitment to continue as a company that always pursues business innovation. FUJIFILM Business Innovation Asia Pacific is the regional headquarters of the global company, FUJIFILM Business Innovation Asia Pacific is the regional headquarters of the global company, FUJIFILM Business Innovation, providing corporate support and shared services for the Asia Pacific region.
address: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 20 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117439
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE:
- To lead R2R Process Standardization in the Region (East Asia / South East Asia / Oceania)
- To lead implementation of BPO Project and support the New ERP Project for Operating Companies (OpCo) in the Region
- To develop BPO monitoring processes in the region / To continuously oversee quality of BPO work after the project go-live

RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS:
- R2R Process Standardization / Improvements in the Region
- To lead standardization of finance related business processes in the Region.
- To analyse the current states of Record to Reporting (R2R) practices of overseas sales operating companies (OpCos) in the region, to develop Finance RSP (Regional Standard Processes), to provide directions & instructions to OpCos, and, if any process gaps are identified, to lead implementing specific countermeasures.
- To lead collaboration with Corporate Finance, ICT and other related parties in establishing standard processes.

Implementation of OpCo BPO Project
- To lead establishment of standard accounting processes in OpCo BPO Project, in which OpCo accounting functions are outsourced to Accenture.
- To investigate OpCo current state processes, develop standard “to be processes,” evaluates gaps, and implement countermeasures.
- To lead OpCo process transfer to Accenture BPO.
- Throughout the projects, to train and educate Accenture BPO team.

BPO Quality Monitoring Lead
- To design monitoring processes with specific KPIs to evaluate quality of Accenture BPO work.
- To develop specific KPIs to control quality of Accenture BPO
- After BPO go-live in OpCos, to monitor quality of Accenture BPO with KPIs. As BPS owner, to continuously develop improvement measures for Accenture BPO in case there are any gaps from the expected states.
- To proactively manage relationship between Accenture BPO team and OpCos to mitigate expectation gaps as the representative of the region.
- To support the Financial Accounting Process Owner in New ERP Project To develop the financial accounting process in New ERP project.
- To identify current OpCo financial accounting process issues, analyse root causes, propose countermeasures, and develop accounting standard processes for new ERP.
- To provide guidance in accounting areas to PM team in designing business processes for new ERP.
- After new ERP go-live at OpCos, to monitor if OpCos follow standard accounting processes, and in case notable gaps are found, initiate corrective measures.

Accounting process improvement of Singapore Regional HQ
- To lead / support financial accounting process standardization of Singapore Regional HQ.
- To investigate past accounting transactions and to analyse gaps to streamline closing processes.
- To support Regional HQ Operation Team in specific closing activities, when necessary.

Others
- To lead / support various finance related projects, with working with relevant parties.
- To support semi-annual sales cut-off and sales cancellation testing of OpCos

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
· More than 12 years Finance experience, preferably with at least 5 years relevant experience in Business Process Standardization and Improvements.
Extensive knowledge in process improvements in finance operations
· Degree in Accountancy / ACCA
· CPA
· Knowledge of accounting standards (US GAAP, IFRS)
· Driven and self-motivated with ability to handle stress in a rapidly changing environment
· Strong leadership and sense of ownership
· Financial and business Acumen
· Analytical financial mindset
· Good project management skills, with eye for details.
· Excellent stakeholder management. Able to influence and negotiate effectively to secure buy-in from both internal and external stakeholders.
· Interpersonal communications skills. Good written and verbal communication.
· Excellent in MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook, OneDrive, SharePoint)
· Experience in Process Improvement Implementation
· Productive and Efficient. Able to multi-task effectively.
· Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or Oracle ERP is preferred

title: Product Management Director (Home Appliance)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Summary
As a Product Director, you will be responsible to lead the product planning and marketing initiatives, while growing the brand awareness for emerging products in Singapore. You should drive the business with excellence through qualitative 360 plan with other teams. You will also communicate with internal and external business partners to ensure that business objectives are met and aligned with Brand’s goals. This position reports directly to Managing Director.

Job Description & Requirements
Responsible for the execution of Home Appliance category (Washing machines, refrigerators, vacuum cleaners, etc.) marketing activities in Singapore local market.
Lead the execution of brand strategy and develop new initiatives to win market share and ranking
Ensure successful new product launches and review the pillars supported by effective 360 plans (PR, media, social media & digital, forecast, events and CRM, sell-out tracking and the product display in the points-of-sale)
Conduct market trend analysis, monitor competitors’ activities and plan proactive actions.
Ensure accuracy in forecasting of products and timely submission.
Ensure accurate and timely phasing of Sale Programs and A&P management.
Marketing support activities regarding whole Home appliance product
(APMS, Communication with Agency, Monthly marketing planning)
Lead Marketing Agency to ensure marketing assets and plans are well prepared.
Cultivate the product category passion both internally and externally.
Ensure all ATL & BTL collaterals, POSM, samples meant for the launch are well-prepared and delivered accordingly for maximum launch impact.
Implement events and promotions with qualitative executions to maximize commercial returns.
Regular and timely update and exchange with the sales and corporate marketing team to ensure the upcoming activities and marketing initiatives are successful.
Be physically present at all major promotions and events (closed door, pop-up events, workshops, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.
Ensure that all your media plans are in place in accordance to your launch plans.
Follow-up closely with PR and Corporate Marketing team to ensure marketing and PR coverage for the products and launches are in place.
Direct Marketing agency to ensure in-store concepts and activities are well prepared and executed.
Develop store concepts with Visual Merchandising agency to ensure visual merchandising are executed according with brand guidelines.
Plan and execute impactful promotions and events setup.
Ensure all POSM are delivered in timely basis for the launches.
Execute sales and marketing activities in consensus with HQ
Coordinate between local teams to implement solutions to enhance the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies
Education Level and/or relevant experience(s):
Bachelor’s Degree with Marketing or Business preferred
Over 10 years of experience in product management
Knowledge and skills:
Rich in Product experience and knowledge
Good proven track of Sales & Marketing
Good communication skills
Other requirements:
Proficient English and Korean language skills (Mandatory)

On behalf of its clients, the firm provides management and real estate outsourcing services to a property portfolio of 3.0 billion square feet. Its investment management business, LaSalle Investment Management, has US$47.6 billion of real estate assets under management. Jones Lang LaSalle has over 50 years of experience in Asia Pacific, with over 27,500 employees operating in 80 offices in 15 countries across the region. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objective : Responsible and accountable for the performance of the property, the management of staff employed as well as achievement of desired property outcomes and results.
Lead and manage a team with areas of responsibility including transactional financial, OH&S, (EEO), operational, HR, negotiation and contracting.
Contribute to the development and fulfilment of asset strategies by developing asset strategies and plans.
Ensure that client asset plan expenditure savings targets are achieved.
Deliver an exceptional quality of service to the client, as reflected by client feedback.
Ensure that the property asset management service offering is developed, implemented, achieved, and maintained.
Ensure the timely and accurate delivery to the client and senior management of analysis and information for the asset plan, management reports, client’s Annual Reports, Business Plans / overheads and others as required by the management company, relevant authorities, and the client.
Ensure that there are no major risks associated with public liability, fire and lift safety, essential services, non-essential services, the staff and office and contractors. This includes addressing all issues within the appropriate timeframes and ensuring the clients risk management plan is in place for the asset, particularly covering contractors and the management company team.
Ensure that all building systems are operating and maintained appropriately.
Ensure all Asset Plan and Business Plan KPI’s/targets are achieved, including but not limited to capital expenditure and OH&S.
Ensure all staff and contractors receive up to date training and site inductions.
Develop the team through performance assessments and training, managing staff workload through correct resourcing and developing a succession plan for key team members.
Ensure that all elements of the Managing Agent Agreement with the client are understood and complied with by the team.
Implement and supervise a Planned Preventive Maintenance Programme (PPMP) for all Building systems and soft services.
Ensure contractors, vendors and technicians complete all repair and maintenance works and soft services within the required timelines and in accordance with the standards set by OMS/Management or required by relevant Codes of Practice.
Plan and procure relevant maintenance services of all building systems including ensuring adequate inventory of spare parts and consumables.
Work with the appointed Senior/ FSM to ensure fire safety systems are well maintained and fire safety procedures and emergency responses (Evacuation, Fire Fighting, In-place Protection, ERP etc.), set up the Certified Emergency Response Teams (CERT) are in place.
Manage tenants fit-out to ensure compliance with the Fit-Out Guide and Green Lease, and relevant authorities’ regulations.
Provide Advice to Client on the operational requirements of the property.
Develop House Rules Fit-Out Guides for the property.
Manage the smooth transition of property from pre completion phase to occupation phase.
Interview and assess and provide recommendations on the staff proposed to be employed for the property.
Develop tenant satisfaction plan strategies/client liaison.
Manage tenant liaison and satisfaction emphasis on tenant retention.
Building day-to-day management including operations, engineering, and compliance matters.
Manage budget preparation and delivery.
Manage budget forecasting.
Finance administration, billing, and collection.
Tenancy fit-out co-ordination.
Capital expenditure implementation, tendering and management.
Monthly reporting.
Building services contract administration and procurement.
Manage repairs and maintenance.
Liaise/manage/communicate with legal, town planners, surveyors, project managers, tax and accounting advisers.
Requirement
Proven experience in property/asset management, ideally with previous experience managing commercial office.
An intimate knowledge of the office sector and ideally some exposure to the retail property.
A track record of success in significant supplier contract negotiations.
Demonstrated ability to add value to commercial assets through identifying value enhancing operational property management strategies (e.g. preventative maintenance/helpdesk/ IT solution implementation/ Smart FM) and/or essential capital works, developing a value adding Property Management/facilities management strategy for tenants, etc.
Previous experience preparing detailed asset plans, complex budgets and comprehensive reports.
Tertiary qualifications, particularly in a property-related discipline, are preferable.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE:
To lead R2R Process Standardization in the Region (East Asia / South East Asia / Oceania)
To lead implementation of BPO Project and New ERP Project for Operating Companies (OpCo) in the Region
To develop BPO monitoring processes in the region / To continuously oversee quality of BPO work after the project go-live

RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS:
R2R Process Standardization in the Region
To lead standardization of finance related business processes in the Region.
To analyse the current states of Record to Reporting (R2R) practices of overseas sales operating companies (OpCos) in the region, to develop Finance RSP (Regional Standard Processes), to provide directions & instructions to OpCos, and, if any process gaps are identified, to lead implementing specific countermeasures.
To lead collaboration with Corporate Finance, ICT and other related parties in establishing standard processes.
Implementation of OpCo BPO Project
To lead establishment of standard accounting processes in OpCo BPO Project, in which OpCo accounting functions are outsourced to Accenture.
To investigate OpCo current state processes, develop standard “to be processes,” evaluates gaps, and implement countermeasures.
To lead OpCo process transfer to Accenture BPO.
Throughout the projects, to train and educate Accenture BPO team.
BPO Quality Monitoring Lead
To design monitoring processes with specific KPIs to evaluate quality of Accenture BPO work.
To develop specific KPIs to control quality of Accenture BPO
After BPO go-live in OpCos, to monitor quality of Accenture BPO with KPIs. As BPS owner, to continuously develop improvement measures for Accenture BPO in case there are any gaps from the expected states.
To proactively manage relationship between Accenture BPO team and OpCos to mitigate expectation gaps as the representative of the region.
Financial Accounting Process Owner in New ERP Project
To lead financial accounting process development in New ERP project.
To identify current OpCo financial accounting process issues, analyse root causes, propose countermeasures, and develop accounting standard processes for new ERP.
To provide guidance in accounting areas to PM team in designing business processes for new ERP.
After new ERP go-live at OpCos, to monitor if OpCos follow standard accounting processes, and in case notable gaps are found, initiate corrective measures.
Accounting process improvement of Singapore Regional HQ
To lead / support financial accounting process standardization of Singapore Regional HQ.
To investigate past accounting transactions and to analyse gaps to streamline closing processes.
To support Regional HQ Operation Team in specific closing activities, when necessary.
Others
To lead / support various finance related projects, with working with relevant parties.
To support semi-annual sales cut-off and sales cancellation testing of OpCos

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ATTITUDES
More than 12 years Finance experience, preferably with at least 5 years relevant experience in Business Process Standardization and Improvements.
Extensive knowledge in process improvements in finance operations
Degree in Accountancy / ACCA
CPA
Knowledge of accounting standards (US GAAP, IFRS)
Driven and self-motivated with ability to handle stress in a rapidly changing environment
Strong leadership and sense of ownership
Financial and business Acumen
Analytical financial mindset
Good project management skills, with eye for details.
Excellent stakeholder management. Able to influence and negotiate effectively to secure buy-in from both internal and external stakeholders.
Interpersonal communications skills. Good written and verbal communication.
Excellent in MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook, OneDrive, SharePoint)
Experience in Process Improvement Implementation
Productive and Efficient. Able to multi-task effectively.
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or Oracle ERP is preferred

As a Product Director, you will be responsible to lead the product planning and marketing initiatives, while growing the brand awareness for emerging products in Singapore. You should drive the business with excellence through qualitative 360 plan with other teams. You will also communicate with internal and external business partners to ensure that business objectives are met and aligned with Brand’s goals. This position reports directly to Managing Director.

Responsible for the execution of Home Entertainment category (TV, audio, etc.)marketing activities in Singapore local market.
Provide guidance to the team in PSI planning, product pricing, P&L management and accountable for market share growth.
Provide clear understanding of category & product positioning to ensure all the executions in the market are in line with HQ direction.

Lead the execution of brand strategy and develop new initiatives to win market share and ranking

Implement events and promotions with qualitative executions to maximize commercial returns.
Regular and timely update and exchange with the sales and corporate marketing team to ensure the upcoming activities and marketing initiatives are successful.
Be physically present at all major promotions and events (closed door, pop-up events, workshops, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.

Follow-up closely with PR and Corporate Marketing team to ensure marketing and PR coverage for the products and launches are in place.

Develop store concepts with Visual Merchandising agency to ensure visual merchandising are executed according with brand guidelines.
Plan and execute impactful promotions and events setup.
Ensure all POSM are delivered in timely basis for the launches.
Execute sales and marketing activities in consensus with HQ
Coordinate between local teams to implement solutions to enhance the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies

Rich in Product experience and knowledge

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a renowned food manufacturing company known for producing a diverse range of high-quality, delicious food products. From fresh bakery items like bread and pastries to a variety of frozen and packaged goods. Their production plant located in the West of Singapore is now looking for a Engineering Manager responsible in managing the whole maintenance team as well as to lead major plant improvement projects.

➤ Basic $6500 - $8000 + AWS + Variable Bonus
➤ 5 Days (Office Hours) - Clementi area


Responsibilities
Lead a team of engineering supervisors and shift engineers to diagnose mechanical and electrical breakdowns, assessing the best course of action and conducting a root cause investigation to eliminate the likelihood of re- occurrence.
Project lead for all installations, overhaul of equipment and plant, working with suppliers to ensure they deliver on time, on budget and with minimum disruption
Lead the implementation of a factory wide PM system using the current Process Control System, and ensuring PM activity is carried out during factory downtime at the correct frequency to an agreed standard.
Effective manage an Engineering team including performance management, training and development
Ensure that all projects are engineered to scope, budget and relevant standard and regulatory compliance.
Fulfilling a key role within part of the site management team, being fully accountable and reporting on assets and ancillary plant downtime across site.
Lead all on site preventative maintenance activities.
Budgetary management/control, responsibility for the day to day management of the site repair and maintenance budgets
Implement safe systems work and managing 3rd party site engineering works, liaising with the operations team to ensure that plant critical repairs minimize plant disruption or managed out of hours.
Upholding GMP engineering standards across site, 3rd party technical customer audits & statutory inspections are passed any non-conformances are closed out with root cause analysis to avoid repeat failure.
Continuous improvement of engineering ways of working to ensure improved equipment performance. A six sigma qualification would be desirable but not essential however knowledge of continuous tools and techniques is essential
Lead the implementation of autonomous maintenance deployment process across the site.
Responsible for maintaining and improvement of all engineering assets and developing an asset care strategy
Setup an effective Engineering planning function, leading the development of Job Libraries and codifying repair

Requirements
Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
Minimum 7 year's management experience in engineering, project and maintenance management within food manufacturing industry.
Demonstrates understanding of project management and engineering from a technical and operational point of view
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
Excellent planning, organizational skills and sense of urgency
Background of hands-on experiences from new line installation project and/or focus improvement project will be advantageous

title: Manager - Business Improvement (Pacific Metal Sales)
company_info: RIO TINTO MARKETING PTE. LTD.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Manager - Business Improvement (Pacific Metal Sales)
Exciting opportunity to lead and work on improvements, process re-engineering, and knowledge management!
Partake in paradigm shifting commercial projects!
Opportunity to work across different cultures, timezones, and cross functional teams!
Based in Singapore, global commercial hub for Rio Tinto
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
The world around us is changing – fast. At Rio Tinto, we produce materials essential for the low-carbon transition and believe all of our commodities are vital. For example, as the world aims to decarbonize, demand for responsible aluminium will escalate; Copper will play an essential role enabling renewable electrification of energy; and lithium-ion batteries will be the preferred storage technology for EVs. The materials produced by Rio Tinto are all around us, in the products we use every day to enable our modern lives. And by working with some of our most strategic partners we’re helping turn the vision of a lower-carbon modern world into reality.

What the role entails
We are looking for a Manager Business Improvement to join our team!
This role is a great opportunity for a dynamic professional known for their exceptional skills in process management, their love for collaboration and engagement, and their enthusiasm for change management initiatives.
You will lead direct contribution to the transformation of Pacific Metal Sales through business process improvement and establishing a good knowledge management framework/process, which could involve implementation of technology solutions, where relevant, to enable the business to further scale and grow. Working within the Pacific Aluminium Sales team and reporting to the General Manager, you will be responsible for, but not limited to:

Program Management:
Leading a portfolio of business improvement projects with the key objective of ensuring the capability to scale business as usual activities (BAU) efficiently and launch new initiatives with agility.
Process Re-engineering and Business Improvement
Work closely with teams across the organization to understand key business drivers, objectives, and work collaboratively within Pacific Aluminium Sales team and across the Commercial business with various stakeholders, e.g. Digital team for technology implementatio
Conduct data analysis and performance assessments to identify opportunities for enhancing business performance
Mapping current key processes to identify and drive opportunities for improvements (assess and prioritise opportunities),
Re-designing and streamlining business processes, whilst project managing the implementation of such improvement initiatives to drive for tangible outcomes and benefits.
Knowledge Management and Change Management
Develop and implement a comprehensive knowledge management strategy to capture, share, and leverage organizational knowledge
Establish knowledge-sharing platforms and tools to facilitate collaboration and information exchange among employee
Supporting teams on stakeholder engagement and change management, working closely with respective business process owners to communicate change, ensure compliance and update of documents/processes.
What you will need for this role
To succeed in this role, you will have:
A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team, and alignment with our values of Care, Courage and Curiosity.
Proven experience in leading business process improvement and cross-functional teams or similar.
Meticulous attention to detail and ability to dissect complex processes into manageable components
Enjoy and relish in guiding others through transformations, process improvements, technology implementations, and culture shifts
Demonstrated success in driving Business Process Reengineering (BPR).
Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously with strong communication, collaboration and project management skills.
Proficient with MS Office Suite, Power BI
Highly effective leadership, organisational, time management and analytical skills and ability to work in a highly dynamic/complex business environment,
Strong communication verbal and written skills.
Lean/Six Sigma Certification, Black Belt, or Master Black Belt certification
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field or equivalent applicable experience and/or training.
It will also be beneficial if you have:
Forward looking and staying current on the latest trends in process management, engagement strategies, and change management methodologies
Experience in mining and metals industry
Experience in consulting
What we offer
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
About Rio Tinto
Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive. We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can’t do it on our own, so we’re focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win and meet opportunities

Where you will be working
Rio Tinto Commercial puts the company’s value over volume approach into practice, with the goal of maximizing the value of our physical flows to improve both our business and that of our customers. Headquartered in Singapore, and integrated with Rio Tinto’s assets, hubs, and offices globally, our Commercial group works hand-in-hand with our product groups to ensure both the amount and types of products we produce meet our customer’s needs, and manage the trade-off between volumes, quality, cost and capital expenditure.

Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

title: Senior Vice President, Regional Tendering & Procurement Manager

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As part of Vanda RE/Gurin Energy’s Regional Operations Team under the Chief Operating Officer Office, the Senior Vice President, Regional Tendering & Procurement Manager will be responsible for managing the tendering and procurement process for all projects. They will lead the EPC RFP and procurement process with members of the regional and country teams together with technical advisors and lenders. The role requires a strong background in evaluating of tenders for large scale renewable energy projects and sound knowledge of the various technologies cost benchmarks and supply chain of the key equipment for each market. The role is based in Gurin’s HQ in Singapore, however travelling is a main requisite of this role.

• Reports to the Managing Director of Operations, on all the EPC tendering and key equipment procurement for all projects under development to reach financial closure and FID.
• Lead in the preparation of all the required RFP tendering documents either internally with the engineering team or with technical advisors if required.
• Ensure the employers requirements are suitable for the project requirements and incorporates Gurin’s Energy’s ESG policy guidelines.
• Work with Gurin’s MD of ESG to ensure ESG standards are a key component for evaluation of shortlisted bidders and suppliers in their submitted qualifications and final interviews.
• Lead in the entire EPC tendering process with members of the Technical/Engineering team, evaluate, score and rank the bidders according to the tender evaluation criteria.
• Lead in the EPC and O&M contract negotiations with the final selected bidder together with the Gurin’s legal, commercial, ESG teams.
• Help manage the key technical related contractual risks in the clauses in contracts with the EPC/Installers.
• Develop the regional EPC/installer strategy and for each market and support in the further developing the evaluation methodology, scoring criteria and metrics.
• Manage the procurement and logistics of PV, BESS and wind technology suppliers quotes and their pricing in each market for each project.
• Manage the relationships with key equipment suppliers and the supply chain risks.
• Support in the preparation of reports/presentations for the Investment Committee (IC) approval or Gurin Board as required and coordinating the internal report preparation process
• Help in the development of internal best practices and SOP’s for tendering and procurement.
Requirements:
To succeed in this role, you will have the following qualification and experience:
• Higher professional degree in engineering field relevant for the job (M.Eng/B.Eng/B.Sc. Hons or higher)
• Energy industry background and more than 8 years’ work experience from renewable developers, power utilities, engineering companies, or power sector consulting companies
• Experience with utility scale solar, wind and / or hybrid power projects of at least 1GW capacity of which at least 5 large utility scale projects >=50MW.
• Strong understanding of technical design and technology performance risks
• Strong understanding of contractual availability and performance guarantee risks and LD’s
• Experience working on projects in Asian markets
• Experience working in large government tenders for renewable projects will be an advantage.
• Fluency in English and other regional languages advantages
• Excellent report writing, presentation and verbal communication skills
• Experience in client interaction and capability to meet deadlines

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Benefits Summary:
Consumer products
Basic up to $10k + VB
Monday – Friday: 9am – 6.30pm
Location: Bendemeer Road
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute go-to-market strategy by taking into consideration of the global view. e.g.: opportunities and target customers, initial development of the positioning, value proposition, pricing framework as well as initial capacity plans).
Source, build and maintain relationships with our partners, working closely to design and manufacturer new product models.
You would be required to lead and drive product development, conducting consumer and market research, define product requirements, lead and drive product launches, developing and maintaining user manuals and manage product roadmaps and timelines.
Partner with software development on the product requirements and oversee smart home integration for the product category.
Identify and prioritize new product opportunities for the product category, based on market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis.
Work with marketing to monitor and drive product success.
Drive innovation within product area with industry trends and best practices.
Ensure senior management are up to date with reports and communication on the progress of the product category.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline e.g., Management, Marketing, Commerce, Engineering or Finance.
Minimum of 8 years’ relevant working experience in B2B product management experience with ability to independently lead the agenda.
No fear of the unknown. You have to be an analytical self-starter, comfortable with complete uncertainty as we look to venture into new product lines or models. You need to be able to dive in and test all angles without supervision.
Data driven. You need to be able to structure, quantify and qualify information on product research, and present this to stakeholders explaining the logic. Comfort with spreadsheet software and data modelling is essential.
Strong Business acumen – Understanding of the wider environment within which our business operates and implications of e.g., trends / shifts in sustainability and consumer perception, brand owners’ opportunity & challenges, and being able to drive actionable insights and articulate what products/services to offer to accelerate profitable growth.
Detailed oriented with strong project management skills on multi-market projects

company_info: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD About Jones Lang LaSalle Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL) is a professional services and investment management firm offering specialized real estate services to clients seeking increased value by owning, occupying and investing in real estate. With annual revenue of US$4.0 billion, Jones Lang LaSalle operates in 70 countries from more than 1,000 locations worldwide. On behalf of its clients, the firm provides management and real estate outsourcing services to a property portfolio of 3.0 billion square feet. Its investment management business, LaSalle Investment Management, has US$47.6 billion of real estate assets under management. Jones Lang LaSalle has over 50 years of experience in Asia Pacific, with over 27,500 employees operating in 80 offices in 15 countries across the region. The firm was named ‘Best Property Consultancy’ in three Asia Pacific countries at the International Property Awards Asia Pacific 2013, and won nine Asia Pacific awards in the Euromoney Real Estate Awards 2013. www.ap.joneslanglasalle.com
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Real Estate / Property Management, Repair and Maintenance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objective : Serve as the key liaison on retail tenants fit-out applications, requests, and feedback. Drives events and campaigns for retail tenants and space activations at retail podium.

Administration
To prepare weekly/monthly meeting documents and minutes.
Prepare A&P calendar of events, revenue and expenditure.
To organize social events & meetings.
Operational Matters
Attend to day-to-day requests/feedback from tenants.
Assist the Manager in supervising soft services such as cleaning, security, landscape, pest control and carpark services.
Manage fit-out / reinstatement / A&A works.
Issuance / approving PTWs.
Coordinating viewing requests by leasing team.
Main contact for tenants' requests (deliveries, access, visits, air-con extensions, handyman works, etc.)
Preparing Tenants' circulars / correspondences.
Prepare & carry out Tenant Survey
To review, and if necessary, recommend and implement changes to operations procedures.
To review all areas regularly to determine whether cost - saving measures can be implemented without compromising on quality, durability, or effectiveness.
To set up a monitoring system to track repairs and replacements for regular update/check and control for any excessive occurrence.
To follow up on matters after meetings.
To set up inspection schedules on defects, cleanliness and other term contract works.
To liaise with Property Executive (M&E) and tenants on matters related to M&E services.
To arrange for handling of emergency situations such as power failure, burst pipe, gas leaks etc.
To review and update Fit Our Guide, Tenants Handbook, SOPs, forms, if necessary.
To attend meetings with clients, term contractors or any other meetings and to record and put-up minutes.
To prepare and submit all necessary documents to authorities such as BCA and URA, or any relevant authorities as needed.
To keep updated records of all warranties.
To conduct daily checks to ensure that the common areas are maintained like cleaning, landscaping, etc.
To conduct regular inspections with the term contractors (cleaning, pest control, fire protection system, lift, etc.) to ensure that the services are carried out / maintained to the standard set by the Management and or the authorities.
To conduct daily checks on common property to ensure their soundness and proper maintenance.
To propose / recommend improvement, repairs and upgrading works when appropriate and ensure that such are carried out properly when approved.
To monitor and furnish regular reports on any intrusions, irregularities, or unsafe practices.
To set procedures and contact numbers of persons to be contacted for dealing with emergency situations such as burst pipe, fire, power failures, structural damage, etc.
Tenancy Management
Help coordinate tenant move-ins and move-outs.
Build positive relationships with co-workers, clients, and tenants.
Respond to tenants’ needs and maintain positive relationships and high retention levels with all tenants.
Liaise with tenants on repairs and maintenance works.
Retail Management
Organize regular tenants’ communication sessions for marketing updates and management of issues.
Ensure tenants comply with key lease covenants such as permitted use, operating hours, signages, connection to POS, submission of sales data, etc.
Administer voucher system.
Drive campaigns and space activations.
Manage social media platforms, websites etc.
Emergency
To lay down procedures and contact numbers of persons to be contacted for dealing with emergency situations such as pipe burst, fire, power failures, structural damage, etc.
To ensure the implementation and maintenance of the OMS system in accordance to establish organizational standard.
Reporting & Budgeting
Prepare accurate, timely and completed reports, including monthly performance reports and variance reports for review by senior management.
Prepare annual budgets and quarterly reforecasts relating to the operating expenditure under your charge.
Manage all accounts payable for the property, including collection, and approval of invoices.
Respond to problems and concerns and ensures compliance with rules and regulations.
Requirement
Degree in Building & Real Estate Management or its equivalent with at least 3 years of experience; or
Diploma in Building & Real Estate Management or its equivalent with at least 5 years of experience.
Relevant experience in managing high rise commercial buildings or mixed developments.
Knowledge of operation, maintenance, fit out practices and related local ordinances.
Experience in formulating and implementing maintenance policies and procedures, project management for capital works.

HSBC Singapore serves as the leading international bank for ASEAN, an international wealth and regional wholesale hub, regional centre of excellence for sustainability, while being a sandbox for digital innovation experiments for the Group. If you are looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover an international banking career. address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 10 MARINA BOULEVARD 018983
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role:
The Operational Management function provides support to Regional,Country COO and/or CAO on an ad-hoc basis across all of their areas of responsibility, covering the DBS COO Office, as directed.
The Operational Management (OM) Team will deliver and contribute to the definition of necessary policies, processes, procedures, and tools for their implementation and management in DBS COO Office, working with Global Functions such as Communications, Finance, HR or Strategy & Planning where required. The OM Team will drive continuous improvement across the Group/Region/Country COO structure in areas such as Change Execution, Financial Management and People.

A Manager within the OM Team is jointly accountable to DBS CAO. This is a key role within in the Management layer within Region/Country COO Office.

This role has responsibility for contributing to:
Change Execution – managing change, either internally or externally driven, on a continuous improvement basis.
Communication – support line manager in developing and executing communication plans, with Region/Country Communications.
Service Performance Management – support line manager in managing any “services” delivered to the business, with appropriate benchmarks, metrics and reporting on efficiency, effectiveness and success of those “services”.
Governance & Documentation – support line manager in ensuring appropriate and consistent governance is developed and implemented with robust documentation and supporting management.
People – support line manager with implementing people strategies with Global/Region/Country HR.
Project execution – support line manager with region/country specific programmes supporting Group/Region/Country COO strategic actions’ execution or provide governance oversight on cross-line of Global Business / Global Functions.

Principal Accountabilities: Key activities and decision making areas

Impact on the Business - COO’s/ CAO
Provide management and administrative support to the Region/Country CAO/Senior Manager OM.
Supports the delivery of Change Execution – manage change, either internally or externally driven, effectively and efficiently, with appropriate stakeholder communication, to ensure the Group/Region/Country COO and CAO delivers its required services
Management Information - Produce accurate and timely management information including regular and on demand key performance indicator / management information reporting
Communication – develop and manage communication plans both within and outside of the Function to ensure internal and external teams have a strong understanding of the Function’s purpose, strategy, deliverables and value
Governance & Documentation – support line manager to ensure appropriate governance managed along with robust documentation and supporting management controls.
People – support line manager and execution of policy and process, in line with Global/Region/Country HR, ensuring our people are engaged, well managed and supported.
Strategy Execution –support line manager to develop and implement approaches for Region/Country CAO/ Head of OM and or Senior Manager (s) ensuring strong stakeholder understanding of the purpose and value of the HSBC strategy.

Customers / Stakeholders
The role operates across all levels of management and drives implementation and execution of the Operational Management framework across geographical area. Stakeholder management is therefore multi-faceted across geographies, Businesses and Functions.

Leadership & Teamwork
Leads by example, demonstrating core behaviours and values including teamwork, focus, drive and determination.
Acts in a manner that transparently promotes the organizations values and delivers in an aligned manner.
Cultivates an environment that supports diversity and reflects the HSBC brand.
Leading by example, ensures effective and open communication across the Operational Management Community.
Contributes to the implementation of the Group COO people strategy
Provide a professional representation of DBS COO Office across the Region/Country.
Influences greater team communication and collaboration

Operational Effectiveness & Control
Support the governance process and ensure robust documentation and supporting management controls are implemented
Provide documentation support for the governance meetings chaired by the Region/Country CAO / Senior Manager OM.

Knowledge & Experience / Qualifications

The role holder will have knowledge, skills and experience in the following areas:
Financial analytical background and proven ability in financial/analytical reasoning, including being able to contextualise financial data into business activities and conclusions
Demonstrated business knowledge, experience of working in a global P&L unit is preferred.
Excellent interpersonal skills, coupled with the ability to work within a matrix management structure and build and maintain regional team relationships;
Ability to authentically engage with team, colleagues and business partners to deliver at pace.
Working knowledge of the external environment – regulatory, political, competitors etc.
High level of personal drive and motivation to ensure delivery of a broad range of outputs simultaneously across HSBC
Ability to articulate issues concisely and in simple language to support problem analysis
Excellent relationship management, collaboration and influencing skills
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to communicate effectively and confidently at all levels across the Group
Ability and comfort to work across cultures
Practical experience of business transformation activities is preferred but not essential
Understanding of HSBC structures, processes and objectives across the Group (if recruiting internally)
Understanding of DBS or similar functions – functionally, operationally and financially

Qualifications / Experience
Educated to graduate degree level in business management related field or associated relevant business experience
Prior experience in banking/ financial services, ideally within a global organization.
Proven experience in financial budgeting, project implementation, communication and people management processes
Proven project management experience with an ability to influence at different levels
Previous background of working in a matrix organization structure; ability to persuade individuals at different levels
Excellent verbal and written communications skills required in English; other language abilities are advantageous

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
As a Software Consultant at One Technosoft, you will play a key role in assisting our clients in optimizing their software development processes and IT systems. You will work closely with clients to understand their specific needs, provide expert recommendations, and oversee the successful implementation of software solutions. Your expertise will contribute to our clients' success and the growth of our consulting practice.
Key Responsibilities:
Client Assessment: Conduct thorough assessments of clients' software and IT systems to identify inefficiencies, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
Solution Recommendation: Collaborate with clients to define their software requirements and provide recommendations for customized software solutions, software architecture, and technology stack.
Project Management: Lead or participate in software development and IT projects, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget. This may include project planning, resource allocation, and risk management.
Technical Expertise: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software development and IT. Share this knowledge with clients to help them make informed decisions.
Client Communication: Maintain clear and effective communication with clients throughout the project lifecycle, addressing concerns, providing progress updates, and managing expectations.
Quality Assurance: Oversee software testing and quality assurance processes to ensure the final product meets the client's requirements and is free of defects.
Documentation: Prepare detailed project documentation, including project plans, technical specifications, and user manuals.
Training: Training will be provided to support to clients' teams, enabling them to effectively use and maintain the implemented software solutions.

As SCS expands and refines its mission to serve more and serve better, we are looking for various talented individuals with an affinity for our cause to join Team SCS. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Reporting to the Supervisor, you will oversee the Society’s digital blueprint through conceptualizing, implementing and facilitating new IT initiatives to enhance the efficiency of the Society through continuing Digital Transformation.

As lead member of the IT Department, you play a pivotal role in the management and coordination of all digital projects in the Society. You will play a strategic role in identifying and developing key technology trends to enhance organizational growth. You will promote good project management practices and improve project delivery outcomes, providing critical project information to senior management for decision making and implementation.

Leadership
Develop a coaching culture to instill continuous learning and encourage high performance by leading, managing and motivating the IT team
Ensure that the department’s objectives and targets are achieved
Oversee the successful completion of all new IT Projects, ensuring that the tendered and agreed requirements and specifications are met and are while within the allocated budget and mutually agreed timelines
Partner with the related business owners in understanding and improving process attributes to contribute to a positive internal stakeholder experience
Ensure that compliance to project management and procurement processes are adhered according to SOPs for Project Closure, Handover, audit purposes
Manage the overall IT budget with prudence and good governance
Vendor Management
Take the lead in managing these new projects, including the design and deployment of new IT systems and services with contracted vendors
Facilitate new related projects initiated by the end users
Gather, validate, and analyze requirements pertaining to existing and new project initiatives according to the needs of the Society
Manage vendors to ensure that the scope of the project, schedule, and resources are aligned to the project requirements
Work collaboratively with user leads, vendors and partners
Ensure system readiness for smooth implementation, adoption and operations
Engage stakeholders to propose remedial actions in keeping project costs within approved budget
Highlight risks to facilitate decisions by senior management
Escalate issues to senior management for resolution and decision making
Ensure that stakeholders are regularly engaged to align and manage expectations.
Work with team members to refining the project management framework for the department
Implement the approved project management processes and framework to ensure consistency, efficiency and effectiveness for future reference
Other duties related to the job function may be assigned
Criteria
Strong desire to serve in a non profit community care organisation
Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
At least 5 years of experience in project management
Experience in managing vendors to deliver large, complex IT projects for the community care organization
Ability to lead teams
Strong communicator
Good planning and organizational skills is a must for a high pressure work environment
IT Project Management
Good working knowledge of cyber security practices and norms
Good understanding of PDPA so as to design and implement projects with data protection in mind
Attributes
Able collate and express well represented opinions and feedback from diverse groups
Strong collaborative approach in managing partners
Good negotiation skills to influence internal and external cross-functional partners toward positive outcomes
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to engage stakeholders and manage their expectations.
Able to understand and interpret requirements leading to technical implementation
Job Highlights
Flexi benefits include claims for TCM, dental and optical
Generous annual leave days
Good work life harmony

Key Roles and Responsibilities
Establish Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Control (QC) system and documentation for centralised utility facilities, utility power and water, petrochemical industries and utility scale renewable projects, including but not limited in QA QC system, manual, procedures, checklists etc.
Establish project quality plan, quality improvement plan (QIP) and ITP from specification to meet project quality inspection requirement.
Support in project execution including but not limited to implementation and/or review of Quality Control plan or system, review MSRA, review ITP to ensure the quality compliance.
Good knowledge in ISO standards and able to lead the programme.
Deliver technical guidance and direction for field inspection, NCR, survellence, FSSR, punch list etc.
Particpate in HAZOP, QRA, EIA studies.
Support in tender review in quality areas.
Familiarise with the local and international code of practice and standards.
Lead the project site quality control matters including lead the site quality personnel.
Ensure all activities carried out are in full compliance to all regulatory and authority requirement.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering discipline or equivalent
At least 5-15 years of experience in QA/QC career in energy business related engineering management and project management (engineering and construction) environment
Experience in renewable energy projects is preferred
Skills/competencies & Preferred Characteristics
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitute, teamwork, analitycal, communication skill, leadership skill
Strong self-motivation and work ethic, flexible and thrives under pressure
------

Please note: Only fully vaccinated candidates will be considered for the above position.

Remuneration will commensurate with experience and qualifications and only shortlisted candidates will be notified on next steps.

title: QAQC Manager, Project Management Office
company_info: ABOUT SEMBCORP INDUSTRIES (Company registration: 199802418D) Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) is a leading energy and urban solutions provider, driven by its purpose to do good and play its part in building a sustainable future. Headquartered in Singapore, Sembcorp leverages its sector expertise and global track record to deliver innovative solutions that support the energy transition and sustainable development. By focusing on growing its Renewables and Integrated Urban Solutions businesses, it aims to transform its portfolio towards a greener future and be a leading provider of sustainable solutions. Sembcorp has a balanced energy portfolio of 16.7GW, with 9.8GW[1] of gross renewable energy capacity comprising solar, wind and energy storage globally*. The company also has a proven track record of transforming raw land into sustainable urban developments, with a project portfolio spanning over 12,000hectares across Asia. Sembcorp is listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange. It is a constituent stock of the Straits Times Index and sustainability indices including the FTSE4Good Index and the iEdge SG ESG indices. For more information, please visit www.sembcorp.com. [1] Including acquisitions pending completion
